ts-CmXP65LGLhLCi0U_FGg.text: Nice set up in here with the bar in a horseshoe type shape in the center and tables surrounding both sides of the bar.  Great place to watch a game- plenty of flat screens...  I ordered the turkey club which had a weird name that I can't recall.  It was excellent- really good quality turkey and avocado on sourdough served w fries.    The drinks are STIFF!  Get a stiffy!  Haha

EQ5dUQKEyyIdc9JkfaFFWA.text: I ate here a couple of weeknights with my girlfriend and two other friends for dinner.  The inside of the place was not what I was expecting although I am not sure what I was looking for exactly. There is a large square shaped bar running almost the length of the restaurant in the middle of the floor with booths on one side and a high tables on the other side.  It was also a bit dark in the place but I think that was part of the vibe and I did not mind it.  After we were seated, our waitress came over and told us that for their happy hour specials they had draft Arsenal Ciders on sale for $5 and draft East End brews on sale for $3.  I loved that they were featuring local brews and not being ones to miss a good deal, my girlfriend and I both had an East End beer while the other couple also decided on an East End Beer and an Arsenal.  For our dinner my girlfriend and I decided to split the Buffalo Mac & Cheese appetizer while I had the Outsourced Burgher with an upgraded side of brussel sprouts with bacon & Gorgonzola and she went with another burgher that is eluding me at the moment.  The Mac & Cheese was delicious with cavatappi pasta, a cheddar cheese sauce and large chunks of boneless buffalo chicken.  My girlfriend and I both commented about how nice the chicken inside of it was and I think that it could have easily been a smaller entree.  My Outsourced Burgher came with habanero jack cheese, hot peppers and an aioli sauce.  It wasn't the best or spiciest burger that I have ever had in my life but it was still moist and I ended up enjoying it.  Finally I also enjoyed the brussel sprouts although I am not sure that they were worth the $4 up charge that I paid for them.  Everyone else at our table also enjoyed their meals and the other couple at our table were raving about the truffle fries that one of them had upgraded to.  We were close to staying around and getting one of their smokestacks where they infuse some smoky flavor into some bourbon after we were told about but at that point we were already full and so decided to let it wait for another time.  The bottom line for me is that I would definitely head back here in the future.  I am really looking forward to trying the smoke stack at some point but I also thought that their drink list was impressive and both the food and the service was good.

qjl44IiedMMGA4i3FGdJMA.text: Place was nice .. Bar atmosphere with tv's everywhere you look.. Food was really really good.. Orders were Eliza chicken sandwich ...  And shaved rib eye both sandwiches were outstanding ... The pot roast fries were amazing and reminded me of pouteen  .. Only down side was the overwhelming flavor of Salt

cGU3ip81oayeDWYWf8UkNw.text: I used to be a regular here, but the service and quality of food has really went down hill. The burgers were top notch, but the last two times I went there, the burger was very over cooked. Also seemed like fries had been sitting around too long.  On a separate occasion, I sat at the bar with my girlfriend, and service was quite slow even though it was half empty on a Sunday afternoon.

Ip6RapeFEeTQXnIyw9lWOA.text: I want so badly to love this place. It's got a terrific look; the space is really killer with so much potential. But, the potential is kind of squandered on the food and drinks. The foods aren't bad, per say, just overly heavy. The drinks remind me of that admittedly very smart freshman who thinks they know more than their professor because can throw around the word 'Marxism.' The cocktails are definitely rather inventive, but more gimmick than substance. For example, the idea of infusing a drink with cedar smoke is neat, and it looks cool in motion, but the drink itself really pales in comparison to the process.

nXD0cW4aRa4_I0zC0kWc_g.text: Fun bar/restaurant but for whatever reason it feels a bit like South Side in Lawrenceville there. I live down the street and was hoping to spend everyday at IPH since it's such a cool space but it's so impersonal and expensive (for a bar) I find myself choosing Tender or Thunderbirds over here. Beautiful interior though and the food is pretty good too.

N0PBiJkY2I7TlSgwAaUxnw.text: One of our favorite bars in Lawrenceville. Great beer selection displayed on big screen TV'S, huge whiskey selection. Our favorite drink is the smokestack, made in front of you as they light woodchips on fire over your drink to flavor it, a must try. Interesting food selection, a lot of unique choices.

ZaAa8x3ukf1gX2W2FxGo9A.text: We visited this place today for lunch.  Overall, we were impressed with the quality of the food.  My burger was perfectly cooked and the pot roast fries were quite yummy.  We had the short ribs appetizer and that was really, really good.  My husband had the prime rib sandwich and the truffle gorgonzola fries.  He really liked it.  Our daughter ordered a salad with salmon and she couldn't finish it.  The service at the time of the day during which we went was very good.  The downside is its cold in the bar.  I can see that things might get dicey when things get busy.

X_HC6Tf_lfQTLI0zmXD-_Q.text: Cool atmosphere and motif. The beer list is good and the prices aren't bad. Good selection of food items and the sandwiches are delicious.

D6-E7TkohoJJWl55ZdyW6A.text: Went here yesterday with a group of coworkers for lunch. It was a group of 16. We had one server and even though he was awesome,  it was very slow. It was because they only had one server working the entire lunch shift. My food was good...the inside out cajun chicken sandwich had lots of flavor. My issue was that after our meal a coworker spoke to the manager about how slow it was (an hour and a half). The manager kept blaming our group for being too large. Then, when she said she would not return as a customer,  he said, "that's fine". I understand we were a larger group, but you should be prepared for the amount of seats your bar area holds. This was not the first time I was there, and service seems to be a bit of an issue every time. So, although the food is good,  you are better off at one of the many other places in Lawrenceville.

5NdS2jNRZOnLI9iNfYGD0w.text: Somehow Industry has found the balance between a sports bar and a cocktail bar. They've got a wide whiskey selection, craft beer selection, and the type of liquor and cocktails that make your mixology nerds happy.

v_s-9N_CygTAW6IyooxMaw.text: Good place to grab drinks.  Decent food.  Nice space.  Went around 6:30pm on a Wednesday night a was seated right away.  Seems like it would be a great place for groups.  Really casual, but more on the trendy side.  There's about 100 options of beers to choose from, and I started with their house-brewed IPH, which was their version of IPA and not super hoppy, but a littttle on the sour side.  Most of our group ordered burgers.  I wouldn't say they are the best burgers I ever had.  I'd give it a 6/10.  Nothing special, but definitely not bad.    Main compliant I have is that my fiance ordered his burger medium rare, but his was definitely more medium/well done.  Mine was ordered medium, but came out a little more medium rare.  We ordered different types of burgers, so this definitely was a mixup.    I also ordered the Truffle Fries, which were yummy.  How can you go wrong with Truffle Anything!!  The fries are slightly thicker cut, but not wedge style fries and were cooked really well.  I didn't love the cheese crumbles that were on top of it though.  So I'd give the fries 7/10.    I also ordered the Carnegie Cucumber and it was the highlight of the meal for me!  I always love a well made cocktail.  Simple, crisp and strong.  Seemed a little pricey to me, more like LA-pricing to me, but you definitely get a LARGE glass, so it's definitely worth it!  I really want to go back and try their other cocktails!

GQ4rl0Be_CO-G0ny7MFsVQ.text: This is a South Side bar in Lawrenceville and defines everything bad that is becoming of the neighborhood. Garbage overpriced food with a crowd of aging frat boys drinking boring drinks.   Go to any other restaurant on butler st and it will be better. You are kidding yourself if you think this is well made food.   The staff seemed annoyed and angry to be there. I'll be amazed if this place is still around in a few years.

5Ye2VhsICMzuF_7KALRU7A.text: I dropped off my wife to get a growler of Nelson for $25.  When she returned to the car the growler was about 75% full.   This is the worst growler fill I ever had coast to coast and I have had many of them.  I would double check my growler if you ever get it filled there.

bSVTBJSKNzVSJiT0gdng4w.text: T'YEAH!!!! Industry absolutely and positively kills it.  How could a place like this go wrong in Lawrenceville?  I walked in and immediately grabbed a seat at the bar and studied their cocktail list. I'm not gonna lie, it took me awhile to really look at it. I decided to go with the a drink that was graced with the presence of a Nolet Gin, being as I'm a huge gin advocate. I can't remember the name of it, but I do know that it was lit on fire in front of me as it was being prepared and it contained legitimate rosemary and was topped with absinthe. This particular drink was one of the most amazing drinks I've ever had with Gin in it. Who the F came up with this drink?? It's divine! My roommate got the Carnegie Cucumber which was pretty good as well, but I definitely liked mine better.   To eat, I went with the Worker's Burgher cooked at a most perfect medium-well and it was impossible to put down. The burger was topped with arugula cheese and caramelized onions;  I loved it.  The whole vibe of Industry is awesome and I want anyone and everyone to partake in it.

FktCURrtUJLbmjHNexB2kw.text: Pot roast fries are to die for. Great vibe and decor. Lots of beers on tap. Prices are a bit on the expensive side. However, portions seem to be big. It's a great place to hang out after work or to just grab a drink with friends.

XQTys26lN79e-uIUYhKH3g.text: The beer selection was great but the food was disappointing.  For the prices they charge I would expect much higher quality and flavors that deliver what their menu advertises.  I ordered the steak nachos and was very disappointed.  My nachos were very cheese-less and dry.  After all of the toppings were gone there was a pile of plain nachos on the plate with nothing left to put onto them.  The ratio was completely wrong.  I would have rather had a smaller plate of nachos with cheese and toppings on each chip than the enormous wad of chips they gave me.  My buddy said the burger was average but nowhere close to the $14 he paid for it.

Yf2u7KGHvDJ15NeGepuXVA.text: While simplicity is key in the decor, the food and drinks pack a lot of punch. Came here on a finals game for the Penguins and the place was loud and hopping - everything that a sports bar should be. However we weren't there per say for the game and tucked into a nice corner by the window in the front. Our waiter was super chill but friendly with the recs and checking in. In addition to the waiter bringing out some of our food, the sous chef made some appearances and cracked some jokes. His boisterous personality made me laugh.  The nachos were delicious though nothing spectacular but I ordered the mushroom burger and a beer for my main. The mushroom burger was very vinegary but it suited my palette and I devoured each bite along with the beer and fries. Overall my stomach was content. I will be back here for sure. I'd suggest that if they were to improve upon anything is to have the windows in the front open up.

7J0Y2WtwWlcDQMV-CWLPCA.text: Industry is our neighborhood go-to place for a beer and a snack or a sandwich.  They always have an extensive number of craft beers on tap that changes frequently.  Everything we've had to eat has been good.  The nachos are our standby, and I'll post a photo as soon as I remember to take one before devouring them.  If you add the chili, they can serve as a meal for two (or at least that's what we do frequently!).  Just beware the fresh jalapenos, they're often pretty hot.  The fish and chips are also great, and the coleslaw that comes alongside is really tasty, creamy & vinegary.  Their house fries are definitely good, as are the house smoked wings.  The buffalo mac n' cheese flatbread is tasty but on the small side, as are all of their flatbreads, but good for a snack and a great happy hour deal at half off.  Happy hour (or social hour, as it's called) runs from 4:30-6:30 on weekdays and will get you a couple $ off draft beers and some deals on apps.  Worth checking out if you haven't been!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The inside out cajun chicken sandwich, served on a toasted bagel that&#39;s inside out.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Industry reuben, served on a baguette-style roll.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A 10 oz. craft draft with a view of half the taps offered.

SEpkGkgjfbBk74AhDztHgg.text: Pot roast fries were good. I got the fried chicken which was boneless chicken on top of grits and collard greens.  The chicken breading was very good, but the chicken itself was overcooked on some parts - I couldn't even cut those parts.  The grits and collard greens just seemed too bland. Husband got the fish and chips. Fish was beautifully fried but bland. Cole slaw was good.  Lots of seating.

r4wkU36mJtiyGHrANbqZOQ.text: I wish I lived closer to this bar. If we did, I'm guessing my hubby & I would have designated barstools by now. When I imagine the perfect bar, it looks just like Industry Public House in my head - a hip industrial modern place with exposed brick, dark wood & metallic touches - big bar in the center & lots of seating around the perimeter. I couldn't have designed this place better. It's the kind of place where I want to sit down and enjoy a beer & they have tons of great choices! Plenty of porters & brown ales for me and IPAs for my guy.  Wine and fun mixed drink choices abound on their drink menu, as well, but the beer vibe has hit me at the door when I've been there thus far and I'm not one to fight that.  Tasty bar food selections include some creative burger selections and I swooned over the Caribbean Burgher made with fresh pork & chorizo sausage, jerk sauce & a grilled pineapple, poblanos & jalapenos. I liked it so much, it will get ordered again soon along with a great beer, most likely!

GrzRwOIQMmAqEgHZBrVNQQ.text: I really used to love this place but today it took me 2 hours to get my food! It was not even that busy.

ekXcjICoAQ8SHcTne_ihqw.text: Love this place. They have a large selection of local beer and an inspiring hand crafted cocktail menu.  As far as food, the buffalo mac and cheese flat bread was delicious.

lVBD_fdB-pxC-3ML2MFVjQ.text: Just had our office Christmas party here!!!   Great location n the hipster district.   Appetizers, 2 captain and  cokes.    Smokehouse stacked sandwich was yummy.  Fun place for night out

-mWMUXe1rzp9eaxYxEFDLw.text: I normally have an ok experience here (rarely great but usually decent).  However today I felt like they dropped the ball notably.  Their draft system was down.  Stuff happens and that's fine but you would think the compromise would be to create a special for cans/bottles during happy hour to satisfy the beer crowd, but no such luck.  Also we ordered an app and entree.  The app came quickly which was nice and why I gave 2 stars instead of 1.  However it seems the entree order got lost in the shuffle and after 40 minutes of waiting we canceled our order and left.  I appreciate the bartender comping our app but the lack of HH beer and the 40 minute wait on the entree that didn't arrive was not cool.

cbxhYNCkAWt6zBDaLz1Awg.text: I'll throw in a bonus star for the draft selection (40 taps), but this place is laughable. We came in at 11 on a Thursday night, and the place was packed and the walls were shaking with TouchTunes selections. Our poor server seemed to be the only waiter on our side of the room so service was slow, but forgivable. The chili cheese fries were good, but $9 for a no frills appetizer seemed a bit much--until my boyfriend got his paella. $18 for about 2 cups worth of unseasoned chicken, unevenly reheated "saffron rice," and a few peppers. Granted, Industry doesn't look like the place you should order paella at, but still! My Marconi and Cheese with bacon was alright; bacon was very satisfying but it sat under the heat lamp a little bit too long so the cheese was mostly fused to the bowl by the time I got it. Marconi is rolling in his grave, but I imagine the profit margins at this place must be great.   No, the truly amusing part of the meal was watching the kitchen staff. My boyfriend came out of the bathroom with a disgusted look on his face and said that one of the guys just took a dump and charged out of there without washing his hands... maybe he washed them in the kitchen? That employee then proceeded to pull something out of one of the plates waiting under the lamps with ungloved hands (it turned out to be my boyfriend's dish). Another employee was just standing around picking his teeth for a solid 10 minutes. Then he got a cocktail straw and proceeded to dig with that instead of his fingers.   Bottom line: don't make this your first stop in Pittsburgh. If you do, sit at the bar (also, apparently this place has cocktails).

HM08AUMYz5kEfS_8fmfXYw.text: Great food here, as well as a great selection on drafts and bottles and any liquors really. It seems that they specialize in whiskey and bourbon but there were several tequilas and vodkas to choose from as well. I ordered the induction salad which came with watermelon. I'm not that fond of fruit in my salad but this was actually refreshing. A large bed of arugula with a light balsamic dressing and pickled onions. YUM! Those onions were fantastic!!  The hubby ordered the pot roast which I hear is very popular and now I know why. The meat is cooked to be very tender and it just pulls apart when you dig in. The gravy was creamy and completed the mashed potatoes very well. On top of all the deliciousness they added onion straws which made the whole dish that much better. The portion was a very nice size enough for two to split if your not starving.  The only bad thing was that the service was super slow! We sat at the bar and our original bartender only came over to use twice. Once to ask what we wanted to drink and then once to ask us how are food was. It was the guy with the curly mustache. I had to flag down another bartender just so we could order our food. He spent all his time at the opposite end of the bar and never even turned his head to see if we needed help. The fact that there were 3 bartenders and I had to flag someone down to help us order is unacceptable!!  Get your service skills together!!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Induction salad
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pot roast
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

AjCjNIn4Ldfs08s3dmrwJQ.text: I have nice memories of being newly moved to Pittsburgh and checking out the neighborhoods.  I was in Lawrenceville, and needed to make a comfort stop, so I ducked into Industry.  Feeling relieved, I stopped at the bar to order a drink.  It was mid afternoon, and a group of young people asked me to party with them (I am an old guy.)  So sweet, and it turned out to be great fun.  I have only had lunch here, but everything has been very good.  I have a friend from California who won t come to Pittsburgh without hitting Industry for pot roast fries.  We get an order to split as an appetizer.  The quantity is generous, and either some of the fries or the sandwiches/salads we order gets left behind.    Looking forward to getting over there for dinner one evening (live in Squirrel Hill.)

PXTIvYlbKgBkW4ev3B8wHA.text: A really great place for dinner with a small group. The atmosphere is hip and modern without feeling too forced. I ordered the Blast Pig burger which had a unique combinations of flavor that was different than any burger I've had before (a lot of jalapenos so it is quite a bit spicy). The prices are good for what you get for both food and atmosphere. I've been here twice with different friends and it's always a crowd pleaser!

WD9eX9qh332FXjMGZducaA.text: Worst fish and chips I've ever had. Huge portion of fish, but the breading was just saturated in grease and was the only flavor. Fries were ok. Server came to take order and drop stuff off but other than that was no where to be found. Pretty large draft and bottle selection though which was nice.

9pPR08PfHb266e7UFZVtog.text: First time here and I love it! Trendy whiskey/bourbon bar that serves food. It's good for a decent group of people and it looks like they have another side of rooms as well. Ordered the kimchi burger and Mac n cheese! Both super good!!! First time having a burger with kimchi and it is so good!!! Server was great and nice

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac n cheese and kimchi burger

ysjEXcTvsomocQDrJJ5hmw.text: Ordered take out from here and was extremely disappointed. Had ordered the Company Salad, Smoke Stack sandwich, and popcorn. The salad came dry, no dressing on it or on the side which was pretty annoying, and it BARELY had any onion, but it did include a meaty dead moth (also pretty annoying and very gross).  I for one like my salads to be moth-free. It made the whole thing inedible...I only wish I had noticed it sooner.   The sandwich was underwhelming. I don't understand why anyone bothers to put horseradish on a sandwich if they use so little that it's undetectable. And maybe that's intentional since a lot of people may not like horseradish. But I'm a fan of horseradish and if the intention is to make it seem like it's not even there then why bother to have it there at all. Just saying.   The popcorn was fine.  Good drink menu as well I suppose.

epONH2ZTveFIcXo0BOBSiA.text: This weekend, I hosted my boyfriend's surprise 30th birthday party here. I cannot speak highly enough of Adam and the staff at Industry. They were so easy to work with while planning and could not have been more kind accommodating that night. The service was incredible, the food was fantastic, and the whole thing went off without a hitch. I have been to Industry before for drinks and for dinner and it's always been great, but quality for a table of 4 can differ from that for a large-scale party. Industry did not disappoint, and their catering was just as good as any meal I've had there. I received compliments from all attendees on every aspect of the party and am so grateful for all of Industry's handwork in helping me to make the night so special. I would not hesitate to book another event here and highly recommend Industry if you want to hold a successful event! Thank you!!

OnLYqPz1esG1YKFmLV18cA.text: Industry was the pre-Mr Smalls-concert destination for dinner and drinks on Tuesday night. I had been here once before and was a little underwhelmed by my experience after having heard several rave reviews. However, my experience last week was much improved, and I really enjoyed my drink and food.  The restaurant is an inviting environment with large garage door-style windows at the entrance and a bar so large that it is probably never completely full. We sat at the bar, where I was actually a bit disappointed by the slowness of the service. We were on a bit of a timeline to get to our concert, and our bartender disappeared for a long period of time before collecting our dinner orders.  I ordered some sort of summer berry cocktail off the special menu listing, which was really tasty and delightfully strong. We started with a fried mozzarella appetizer. The mozzarella was an above-average quality and was flavorful and stringy. The five mozzarella circles were topped with a savory marinara sauce made with lots of basil. For my dinner, I almost ordered fish and chips but was happy when the hubby pointed out the Wheelhouse Ravioli. The "spicy marinara" in the description concerned me, but they actually used the exact same heavy-on-the-basil (in the perfect way) marinara that came with the mozzarella. The ravioli had a tasty filling of beef, goat cheese, and greens. Ravioli is one of my favorite foods, and I would definitely order this dish again.

OK8G3jNhMqY89ZwHY4rXSg.text: This place is awesome - I gotta admit I've based some of my basement reno project according to this place. The rusty, industrial look from the walls, tables, chairs all the way to the lightning is as cool as it can get.  This was only second visit and will not be the last. Besides my appreciation for it's aesthetic - the food here is very good at least from what I've tried so far. We were here for Brunch and I had the Corned Beef Hash and my lady had the Morning Meal. They were both really good but I'd take the Corned Beef Hash over the Morning Meal anytime.  However, the service here seemed a bit slower than expected. I'm not blaming the servers - they were very attentive and polite. It's just that the food took some time to get from the kitchen to our table. But I'll take that as a positive thing by assuming it was cooked fresh from scratch :)

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned Beef Hash.. .Pure Goodness

4G7t4-OnzF21WZomDman2Q.text: North Fayette location:  Got the pot roast fries.  The gravy was dark dark brown, all salt, and gelatinous.  Disgusting.  The onion frazzles on top were cold and soggy. Yes, they have 60 beers to tap.  Only saw a few local ones though.  Why can't you have more local beers?  Spoonwood, Hitchhiker, Apis, 4 seasons, draii laag....none of those!  None!  I saw one beer from Grist House and it was Camp slap red.  Disappointing.

LtQ2o_nEijeKF4sjPI-WxQ.text: The atmosphere at Industry is one of my favorite in the city! The interior features exposed brick and lighting, and tables and the bar are equally comfortable. Their Social Hour (happy hour) deals are rocking, too! The food and drinks are completely delicious, and the service has always been friendly.   The only downside is that the gluten-free options are quite limited, and there has been a lack of knowledge about what is/isn't GF from staff. Given the location and gastropub style, it would be fitting and easy to add gluten free buns so us celiacs could enjoy the burgers too!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parmesan truffle popped corn? Yes, please.

cShypXCM4OzDc47oT025Vg.text: My husband and I finally lunched at Industry which is consistently Lawerenceville's most recommended spot for daytime drinking and eating. The restaurant has a very cool design featuring a polished rustic theme and unique lighting treatments throughout.  The first thing I noticed in the unique menu was the seemingly endless selection of beers on tap. The whiskey offerings were also impressive.  Food items found on the menu showcase blue collar eats with a twist. Portions were very generous and our food was quite tasty. (See photos) Servers and staff presented that very common "hip" vibe that sometimes comes off as careless. Our own server was competent but she sometimes allowed too much time to pass between checking on us.  Overall I was very pleased with Industry and will try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blackened chicken Cesar salad. Nothing special as far as menu items go but this salad was flavorful and filling.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burly beef roast sandwhich with fried onions, decadent mac  &amp; cheese
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nice details.

2kYnYtdwAK4tr136KhWnaA.text: I have been wanting to come here for a few weeks and was finally in the area and in need of lunch. I will admit I wanted a smoked bourbon. I knew going in it might be a gimmick to get people interested in the place and it worked on me.   We were seated by the bar at a high top table. It was a few min before our waiter came out and brought waters without me having to ask. This was very nice. He also later brought out a glass bottle of water for the table. Loved this!!! I ordered my smoked bourbon. There is a nice long list of options. I chose a blackberry house bourbon with cherry wood and made sure to ask for them to make it on my side of the bar. It is definitely a fun drink to watch being made. It was finished with a large ice cube and an orange peel. This might have been my favorite drink EVER. Even more then my beloved Samos Nectar.   For my entree I chose the Worker Burgher. It was delish. The goat cheese with the caramelized onion was perfect. The fries were just ok. They didn't have much of a crunch and were over salted. I can say they were definitely fresh though.   I must give a shout out to our server who was excellent. I've been disappointed with service lately and he restored my faith.  Also I could see the kitchen window and they have a designated expediter. This was nice and I never just saw food sitting in the window. I find it hard to justify going to a restaurant more then once when I'm going out because there are so many great options in the Burgh but this is a place I wouldn't think twice about coming back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Current beers in tap.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Worker Burgher. Very tasty.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked bourbon. So yummy.

ZtPxwSrCt2ktTZ64O-gzAA.text: Nice spot, decent food, good whiskey selection.  The service was good, and they serve the whiskey with one big ice cube, which I am always a fan of.    This spot is very "cool"; crawling with hipsters.  I suggest going with your most bearded, tatted-up pals (I know I did).  It is a bit pricey, but the food and drinks are good quality.

NT-yRh-RMGjy5WAlfQc9EA.text: My wife and I stopped in at this restaurant around 5pm on a Saturday and placed our name on their list for a table for 2 and a high chair. It was a busy day in lawrenceville due to the cookie shopping event hosted by the local chamber.  The expected wait was 45 minutes but that was not a big deal because there was shopping to keep us busy. We came back around 45 minutes later and then had to wait another half hour and still didn't get seated. Their excuse was there wasn't a table that could fit a high chair.  Wish I could give a food rating but can't. Never got to taste it. This place is obviously not kid friendly but maybe that was our fault for not knowing their environment. We went across the street to Vandals and were treated better.

xODZcK_b6z0gmz1QQWXM1A.text: Really great drink selections. Service was good. Normally good food but my pulled pork sandwich missed the mark this time...just needed more seasoning. Great atmosphere--this is a cool place. I'll definitely be back.

PodHxj6xl1qcnTkVqf1MZw.text: I'd give this place another go during regular lunch/dinner hours.  We came in for dessert only to find they don't really have it so late night snacks it was!  We ordered the truffle blue cheese fries and the first few were good and then the blue cheese taste started to overwhelm the rest of the fry.  Don't go here to catch up with friends, you won't be able to hear them.

E5T28XzBzEg4R1QIsc6zEQ.text: I don't get it. Ate there on a Saturday night during Art All Night weekend. Eight of us. It was OK at best. Drink sucked. Maybe it was not exotic enough for all the craft cocktail nonsense. But how hard is it to make a Stoli&Soda? Ordered togo food today. Poor at best. Ribs burnt with a ketchup BBQ on top of fries. No Cole slaw like menu said. Fried pickles totally different from last time,and Mac & cheese oily with no taste. Third try for me. I am done.

3hhs_ZcqUxqVstxjEt7xxw.text: Well I haven't been thaaat compelled to write a review recently (or for a pretty long time for that matter) but after giving it some thought, I just had to express my meh experience at Industry.  Now don't get me wrong, I think it has potential and I, like others, wanted to like this place because the atmosphere is pretty cool and I was looking for a new great burger place...  Maybe we just caught them on an "off" day, but here's the breakdown of the experience:  Simple order for two including one of their house beers (copper ales), a burger (the farmed-out burger), a salad and a specialty cocktail.    Where things went awry:  After a bite into my burger, the bartender informs me that I was given the wrong burger.  Not wanting to make a fuss and because the burger wasn't that bad (just not what I ordered and overdone) I said it was fine a kept eating.  As the meal continued we realized that my dining partner had received the wrong salad AND the wrong drink!  Combine this with a less than personable staff and the dining experience was solidified.  No apology or we'll take a couple bucks off...  Bottom line:  what we had was actually pretty good, just not what we ordered and it seemed like it might happen alot, without a hint of "oops, we messed up".  It might be good for you, but I'm not sure I'll be back.

EJ31V5b7vI0cIb5fcbrUHw.text: I've been to Industry Public House a few times.  The drink selections are great, and the food is good.  There are so many places to go that have great food, so this place is not first on my list of places to go by any means.  It's noisy inside, but that may be because this place is usually packed.  Overall, Industry is worth trying, but there are better choices, especially for food.

YiKyha34HDwKG5JGqHXt5Q.text: Went to this establishment on my last trip to Pittsburgh last weekend. It was OK.  The beers were very good - that I have to say. Had a pumpkin beer on tap after tasting a couple of samples. We ordered popcorn for the kids and were unimpressed. I had the Lucy Furnace 2.0 and it was OK but nothing amazing. The chili cheese fries were pretty good. When we were done, the server simply dropped us the check and never asked if anyone wanted dessert, even though one of the arty came here to try the bourbon bread pudding. She never returned, by the way. A so-so experience. With all the other restaurants in this great city, I don't need to come back here.

V3MQM7-M-8FR8OvLh0y6dA.text: I've been to IPH a few times, and I really like it.  While the menu isn't large, and sometimes it takes me a while to decide what I really want to eat, I still think it's one of the more interesting places to eat in Pittsburgh right now.  The burgers really are exceptional. Where it rocks is with the drink menu - if only time, money and inevitable drunkeness weren't an issue!   I'll be back, but I also look forward to the menu continuing to evolve.

5IYraYAno4DNT_YqIT84UQ.text: Would only return for the discounted appetizers at happy hour. Place can get very busy, my husband and I only saw our server twice.

pZB5WhOjde_uyphY07BpPA.text: Ok, Saturday afternoon, average crowd; I went for the Reuben. At $14 it must be outstanding right? Wrong! It was 1/2 the size you'd expect and skimpy on the dressing.

g3STiAW_0xTTC7_BvflXlg.text: Awesome little joint in Lawrenceville. Burghers here are a must- I had the Farmed Out burgher-- I was sold on the wild board bacon (thicker cut, not as crispy as your run of the mill pork bacon). I had the side salad which was nicely dressed.   Huge fan of their ginormous beer list and dove heard first into PGHness and had a beer called a Pittsburgh Dad by Full Pint. Biggest downer? Very few descriptions of the beers exist on the beer menu, which unfortunately you can't leave to your server (in my case, Sophia) to remember tidbids about. She was attentive anyways but oh boy, if you have a beer list that big, I would half expect these people to be somewhat excited to talk about beer.

o8gbMkKYQQMOGA4-92Q8ew.text: Great place for a burger and whiskey! Cute, intimate date night or taking a group of friends, the food and libations won't disappoint. We had the mozzarella appetizer and shared the steak sandwich and burger! It was to die for! We also tried the speciality drinks of smoked bourbon and Lehigh Rock and Rye!! Can't wait to go back!

TmvwLbaIVeXL4Gv5oCUAGQ.text: New review!  So my first trip to Industry was good, I gave it four stars.  The place is loud and the atmosphere is a bit off putting.  The nachos and beers my friends and I had were top notch though and the service was prompt and friendly.  Now for round two.  My parents took my wife and I here for my birthday lunch.  We all started with beers and Industry's draught list is expansive and good.  We then ordered popcorn which was full of flavor and perfect for a light appetizer with our beers.  We then all got different burgers.  I got the farmhouse one with cheddar, bacon, and a dippy egg.  The meat was a little dry, but full flavor.  I'd give the burger a 4 out of 5.  The fries however were amazing.  Fresh cut, crisp, and it was an excellent choice to upgrade to fries with pot roast and gravy.  A very filling lunch.    So once again Industry just misses the mark, but I really like the place.

dox5RmOjHgzhw-VEMLb2aQ.text: Good and drinks are great. However, pray you don't sit in the booth near the kitchen. There is a direct view into the dishwashing room. You'll never forget the mental image

20N9oc5fyqxV6LInYGaM7Q.text: Great social bar vibe and we decided to hit it on a lazy Sunday afternoon for lunch. Kids meals were great and the truffle blue cheese fries are dynamite but the burger was small and poorly cooked. We ordered medium and it came medium well to well done. The brussels sprouts were steamed and mushy and Very disappointing. I expect more. My suggestion is tasty cocktails and barfood but industry is trying to be too trendy on its overall menu and just doesn't pull it off

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blue cheese fries

G3eGg6CMCiQmIjS-AuDK6A.text: I gave this place a 4 because the staff and atmosphere were fantastic! A bit loud, had a tough time hearing each other talk, but still fun. I love a good burger and this was definitely a good one. First off, the size was perferct, I could actually pick it up and bite into it and enjoy it the way it should be eaten. It was also cooked perfectly with a clean grill flavor. Fries with gorgonzala sauce was the bomb. Great beer and cocktail selection too. No complaints from our party of four. Fun, casual night.

LeqxwYRnuT_LvXEInhGiFg.text: I've been here for drinks before but just popped in for food last week. Service felt rushed, but I was very pleasantly surprised by how good my burger and the fiance's mac and cheese were! I was expecting typical, average pub food but that is not what we got. My burger was excellently seasoned and topped with goat cheese, arugula, and caramelized onions, and the pasta in the mac and cheese wasn't mushy with just the right amount of bite. I would definitely come back to try more food!

FmMdNaOiYkNJf7JyRmz7-w.text: I've been to Industry Public House a few times.  I really like the atmosphere and the food has been very good.  If a restaurant has truffle anything, I will probably order it, so I ordered the truffle Parmesan popcorn and also the truffle fries on separate occasions and loved them both.  I was very happy with my drink last time, the smallman st. fizz, however, the service didn't really impress us.  It took a while to be waited on, and we were ready to order our food when the waitress first came over, but she ran away before we could place our order.  It also took a long time to get our check.  Will probably be back though!

hXHNjgobiIpB9pHqGpC06g.text: Industry Public House is a solid 3 stars. I wanted it to be 4 stars, but it doesn't quite make it.   After drooling over items on the menu like "Wild Boar Bacon" and "Aged White Cheddar", my SO and I opted for a goat cheese flat bread, the farmed out burger, and the Electric grilled cheese sandwich.   Portions were very generous - and a good value of pricing. But our meals missed a a "wow" factor despite the ingredients. Good solid food, but not able to hit the mark they were shooting for. The bacon was a little too salty, the cheese a little too bland, the flat bread toppings generous but unbalanced.   The service was commendable (on a Wednesday night) and the food was solid good pub food with fair pricing. I wasn't impressed with the margarita, but it's hard to beat a good $4.50 house IPA. They also have a very extensive beer selection (but that's not anything new when you live on the South Side.)  If Industry were in my neighborhood, I would probably go back on a regular basis, but as it's across town, it won't have the allure to bring me back unless I'm already in the neighborhood.

g_RLsc_5u8qAuIP8nIsmYQ.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh! They've got a hefty drink menu and wide selection of whiskeys without being completely overbearing. The smokestack whiskey is definitely worth a try- and it's best to ask your waitress of bartender what flavors they recommend with particular whiskeys. Their popcorn appetizer is refreshingly simple and well-made. The side of bacon is a steal at only $3 for a hefty plate of thick strips. And, of course, their burgers and sandwiches (anything with meat, really) are great.  Beware of making reservations too late on a Friday or Saturday night. The place fills up with bar-goers and the areas around tables can get annoyingly crowded.

s2E5ntw2XMpiEVRak50ViA.text: So I want to like this place and have waiting through about 3 different bad experiences before writing this. First, the food has gone down hill tremendously. We ordered the management burger and fries and everything was very greasy. I'm talking shred your napkin greasy. The service was fine but we waited 20 mins to be waited on for drinks alone. Lastly, we were charged for drinks that they never brought us. They did correct the bill however. Overall, very frustrating and definitely not worth it. Would not recommend.

ZiiBMbvDv1fDDTThBjET1g.text: I used to work in the Lawrenceville area and Industry was one of my favorite places to go; in fact, it's where my wife and I first met, so it's always had a special place in my heart. I was in the 'Burgh recently, and as part of our Lawrenceville bar crawl we ended up at Industry.  The food is decent, prices are ok, and tap selection is great. Service, however, was HORRIBLE! We grabbed a spot at the bar and got our first round of drinks relatively easily; after that, it was like pulling teeth to get any of the multiple bartenders to just recognize anyone from our side of the bar. At one point (after waiting 15 minutes without a single glance from any of the bartenders whisking by back and forth) I very politely said "Excuse me" to a bartender filling up some glasses. Without even looking up, she gave me the 'one minute' sign with her index finger, said "Just a minute", whisked her drinks to the other side of the bar, and never made eye contact for the rest of the night.  I've never been in a place where it seemed like the staff was actively ignoring quite literally half the patrons. Had it been just me, I would have maybe questioned if I was doing something innappropriate to cause such behavior, but it was the entire side of the bar that got this treatment.  We had considered doing our rehearsal dinner at Industry but eventually decided against it (and I'm really glad we didn't, in hindsight). Unfortunately, I cannot recommend Industry any more, especially considering the wealth of competition a short walk away on Butler Street.  2 stars for decent food and good tap list, but that's all I can recommend for Industry. They have fallen a long, long way from the place I used to frequent.

T4iIBxlE5hALg-ULpK5M4w.text: Okay beers but BAD boneless wings. Not like anything I've had but not for good reasons

flN61MVgVqYgLnUWdpFCqQ.text: I ordered the 9th Ward Salad which had great ingredients! However, the ginger vinaigrette is unappetizingly spicy -- I have a spice tolerance but an incredibly spicy salad dressing is not something that I would have chosen. Industry should either place a warning on this dressing or bring the spice level down. It made the salad unpalatable except for pieces that had limited dressing.

3rxQ91YfUeHIbatU_EITBQ.text: Had our wedding rehearsal dinner here on 6/22/18 and Adam (the general manager) and his crew were amazing.  Adam was very easy to work with and helped us plan an amazing menu as well as walking us through every detail of of the night. He was easy to contact and coordinate with as the date came closer. The night of the rehearsal dinner his team delivered and constantly came out to check on myself, our guest, the food, our drinks - everything we could've asked for and more.  We heard nothing but glowing reviews from all of our guest on how much fun they had and how impressed they were with everything. Everything went flawlessly. We will definitely return next time we are in town to grab a bite to eat and say Hi to the staff.

6YjehTujOr-A-THb5AeqCQ.text: It's a gastropub with pretty good food.  Huge menu with some creative choices.  I've had one or two misses here but mostly winning options when it comes to the food.  I'd steer clear when it's gets really busy but it's a good spot for weekdays or a lunch date.  Also, a good spot to catch a game at the bar.

NHn8racLtJkQ1gD9_-KPKw.text: Amazing Mahi mahi tacos! Great space, great atmosphere, parking is slightly an issue because its butler street, but after 5pm parking is free. They have 4 beers they make in house as well, including 2 IPAs. Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

C8sJ83bgLKde8JgwTA6xaA.text: I came here with my husband at 11:15 on a Friday. There was no one here but the waitress let us know she wasn't happy about getting our table. Weird, but ok. I ordered a beer right away and it came quickly but my husband was still deciding. Didn't see her again for 15 minutes, she took his beer order and then it was another 15 minutes before his beer arrived... and that's pretty much how it went. She couldn't be found and couldn't get us beers in a normal amount of time when the place was practically empty! The food was delicious and that's what makes me sad. I love the food here! It's always spot on. But we paid 70$ for lunch and 4 beers and got truly awful service. We literally had to get another waitress to track her down so we could pay and leave. Not sure I will be back for a long time.

ruS2mLLAAuzZsQbYkIZkfQ.text: A fun place in Lawrenceville.   Bar has plenty of seats so on a busy night so can still sit somewhere.  Plenty of drink and food options.   Service can be spotty, that is the only reason I do not give in 5 stars

SJNZS5Ew6H2yVDWJKDkocg.text: We had such an enjoyable meal here! Service was spot on, great drink selection (beers and specialty cocktails), and all the food items we ordered in a group of 6 were delicious.  In fact, my chicken sandwich was one of the best grilled chicken sandwiches I've had in a long time.  I ordered a couple of their side dishes to share (brussel sprouts and Buffalo mac n cheese) and these were equally delicious.  Highly recommend if you're in Lawrenceville!

4oRgtuB2O7ZwfBLp9xqmvQ.text: This was a new place for me and I was super excited to try it. We ordered the Mac and cheese, the pot roast filament fries, the chorizo flatbread and the smoke stack sandwich. The standout was definitely the chorizo flatbread. The combination of flavors was so good. The fries had a ton of fat on the pot roast and basically flavorless. The smoke stack steak sandwich also had more fat than I expected but did get better when I asked for a side of the horseradish aioli to dip it in, and the Mac and cheese was lacking flavor as well.   I did go for the gimmicky smoked bourbon and it was okay. You choose your bourbon then the flavor of wood chips, then it's all a show from there.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoke stack sandwich &amp; pot roast filament fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and cheese and chorizo flatbread

nU5-nuDLOanQ4ybPyvVc8w.text: Oh mylanta.   I'm gonna need some after this AMAZING dinner.   When in Larryville, I always demand Smoke. Josh was up for something different tonight. "American, or whatever," he said, all hangry as I attempted to parallel park in a spot no bigger than my Kia. Okay, boss. Whatever you want.   We were seated immediately in the bar, at a kind of small table for two adults to enjoy large plates of food, but they make it work with a long beam that fuses the three tables in the section together.   Our server, Alex was great. He made suggestions when we asked, and was attentive. I asked him about the home soda of the day and it was Lemon Thyme. WOWZA. If it wasn't an overcast day in April, and it was one of Pittsburghs stupid 90 300% humidity July days, it would have been perfect.   Josh ordered the Farmed Out (yes, if you follow me, that's his second burger with an egg and bacon inside of a week) and he couldn't stop saying how good it was.   I had the Blast Pig, only because I saw like three million picture of it here on yelp! Holy Moley.  Candied bacon, candied jalapeno, candied onion. Now, to some, that might be too much candied food. It was perfect up against the garlic aioli. Melt in your mouth AMAZING.   Go here. Run here. Get here now.   Happy Eating!

NMVRvKfycx0_XbxkrLGsqg.text: Nothing but good vibes approaching Industry... probably one of the most happening spots in Lawrenceville.  Patrons lining up at the door- looking to dine in..  But there's always a spot at the bar.  Service at the bar is spot on.. not a moments wait until a bartender arrived.  Industry "Copper Ale" is liquid love in a glass!   I really didn't want to leave but we had other places to go.  I love the dark decor too ..  so ideal for a bar setting.   I have had great experiences at other locations too.  Thanks Industry!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. copper ale is liquid love!!

lYSfjhkhCKZ6qzf_EmvwZQ.text: I've been to Industry a few times now, and I'm happy with it every day. I'd say my favorite part about the restaurant is the atmosphere. It's a modern sports bar, hipster vibe? I guess that's the best way I can put it, but I always enjoy going. The beer selection is always great, especially if you enjoy craft beer like my friends and I. The crowd is older than college students, but ranges widely. I got a salad with salmon once and a burger, both were awesome. For appetizers I 100% recommend the soft pretzel. It's HUGE.

gAM-AyofAAEyA_yUgXMuTQ.text: This is one of my favorite places in Lawrenceville to go for lunch or dinner. They have a great menu (both food and brews) and include some unique items like a stuffed duck burger. It's a very open atmosphere which is important to me since I find most bars and pubs pretty suffocating. In the summer, it has a relaxed indoor/outdoor style seating area (you're seated inside but the windows are wide open so you get lots of fresh air without the sunburn).  They have great appetizers that are enough to share with a small group...especially the pub pretzel. The thing is enormous!!!!   I've yet to have bad service there. The waiters are really nice and upbeat without being over attentive and pushy.   Love it here and will keep coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huge soft pretzel with beer cheese and cheer mustard....how can you complain! Epically served and quite delicious.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Try the Industry Copper Ale! It&#39;s a smooth Amber ale that hit the spot after a long day at work.

Vr0AieTayT417EIWHPIM4A.text: Very good food with a large selection of beers on tap. I started with the Fried Pickles which were great and then had their Shrimp Po'Boy which was excellent. Everything was fresh and the breading on the pickles and shrimp was very well done. The service was a little slow but this place can get pretty busy. Overall a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp Po&#39;Boy with their Homemade Fries

X0EzyREqvtfGVvb1aOWI_A.text: Nice place with interesting drink selection and menu. I would have actually liked to have spent some money here, but after 15 minutes of sitting at the trash and dirty dish covered bar and not even getting eye contact from the bartender as she walked past us 6 times, we left. I will say, though that the bartender was hustling, but clearly had more going on than she could handle. Your manager should have stepped in and gotten her some help. Going to chalk this up to a bad, post-holiday afternoon ... at least I hope that's the case. Too much competition in this city for a place to be run that way.

B05UxGDK_dPNOjKjLz_cuA.text: This place has gone downhill. Sat at the bar. Bartender took my order has never come back to see how my food was so she wouldn't know that it wasn't good.  Ordered a worker burger with no bun + upgraded to sweet potato fries. Only half of the fries were actually cooked all the way thru. Couldn't eat the rest. That was an extra $4   The burger was supposed to medium. It was medium well almost well. Supposed to have caramelized onions on top. They looked like the tossed them in the pan for two seconds. No where close to being caramelized in color and taste. Burger was dry and flavorless.   The only highlight was the Arsenal cider  This place used to be great. Really sad what has happened. Will never come back. Service + food were awful

d2FMmS7Iq7VWls2hY8B8MA.text: James was a phenomenal waiter. The place had an amazing vibe, great patrons, orgasmic food...   To be finished when sober!

T53GcQnzqZ0ax4MhocU0hg.text: Food and drinks are good! At times, it's very hard to get the attention of a bartender. Once you get their attention, the service is fine. It's a good spot in Lawrenceville to frequent.

Rimj0h_s9OKCy3QHT2Oiig.text: I went here on a blind date once.  My date itself was ATROCIOUS.  However, my food?  Worse!  It was busy, loud, there were children screaming somewhere but I couldn't see them (WHY ARE THERE KIDS IN A BAR??) it was 9 p.m.  I ordered some grilled cheese with bacon concoction and my date ordered some brisket.  Let's start there... the grilled cheese was burned, yet also soggy.  The bacon was chewy gummy rubbery and just vomit inducing.  I didn't finish it.  His brisket?  Oh that was dry and completely inedible.  He compared it to chewing those jerky shreds they sell, over salted and dry like leather. Cocktails? Oh lordy lord.  They were watery.  Poorly mixed. Slow to come.  My waiter was a total bro dude who couldn't understand what we were saying because the music was blasting and overly loud.  oh, we wanted to order another cocktail?  No?  The waiter has disappeared?  Oh that's him out front smoking a cigarette and flirting with the scantily clad girl.  That's okay I'll just flag down another waitress and ask for my check.  Oh, I can't do that either?  I need to "wait for my real waiter to get back".  Sure. I'll just sit here for another 45 minutes making awkward and forced conversation. They've now expanded to be even bigger. So a small shit farm is now a humongous factory of utter shit.   Cool.   What is this place good for?  Nothing.

C35GWCRBQmBSJB7NZ-OejQ.text: Amazing food! Got the inside out chicken sandwich and it was so on point.  The drinks were bomb too. Wood chips and smoke treatment for the whiskey drinks was a great touch.  What a great environment. Good atmosphere & even better service. Our server Alex was awesome :)

KeelwCz-gH5Rutff9R7VKg.text: Came here for a company party and the food is great. Love the balsamic dressing on the salad. It's creamy with a slight sweetness, definitely a favorite.   We had Nachos, Truffle Fries and Buffalo Mac N' Cheese Pizza. They were all amazing.   Cant wait to go back to try other dishes.

Ivka8f8RP167kSVOy-ZGgw.text: We waited for two hours for a table. When I went to check where we were on the reservations list, I realized that one digit of my Phone number was written incorrectly. The guy at the host desk shrugged his shoulders, said whoops and moved me to the bottom of the list. Terrible customer service. Atmosphere is great, but don't plan to eat there.

2Rf9SnnVdmQ03yt-Id4d0g.text: Industry is right down the street from my office, so it's a frequent destination for lunches, happy hours, and the like.  Unfortunately, it consistently fails to deliver in a number of ways, including:  1. Service is always sloooowwww. On occasion, it's unbearably slow. My most recent lunch, it took over an hour to bring out dishes... and we almost just walked out.  2. Twice now at lunch, I've ordered the chicken breast entree. BOTH times, only after waiting for everyone else's food has started coming out, they've come by to tell me that they were out of chicken breasts. Each time, I instead opted for a salad -- for which, surprisingly enough, they happened to have chicken breasts!  3. They upcharge for drinks to be served neat and claim this is a standard practice.  In total, I'm thinking my coworkers and I will start heading elsewhere for lunches and happy hours in the future. This place is pretty disappointing.

I1kTpXYSFDjgcb6rgbHTvA.text: I knocked off 2 stars here due to service and ambience. We were told that our wait time was going to be half an hour, however, that half hour turned into a 45 minute wait. Around the 30 minute mark, I asked the hostess how long it would take and she said that they're waiting for a table to clear out, but because they're just hanging out, we can't be seated. Soooo...you're telling me that that's the only three person table in the entire establishment? Very confusing, indeed. Finally when we were seated, the three of us couldn't believe how loud it was! My friend was sitting next to me (like, RIGHT next to me) and I couldn't hear a word she said to me, just bass. Lots and lots of bass. Thumping music would be fine if I were at a club, but I wanted to have a nice meal with some friends so the music was a bit excessive.  I digress. I ordered the pot roast (my very first ever!) and it was very tasty. The meat was perfectly cooked and packed with flavor as was the beef gravy poured over top. The smashed potatoes that came along with the meal might well be one of the best potatoes I've ever had...super buttery and melted in your mouth. The service was kind, but incredibly slow. We waited probably close to 20 minutes for our food to come out, which was irksome since we had to wait a long time just to be seated.  Bottom line: this place is pretty decent, however, I do find it to be pricey. The wait is long and the service is slow, although they are very nice. Go here if you want to just dig in, since conversation won't be happening over the blaring music.

ddC1BXzMqa2M2FzliziMgQ.text: Absolutely NO. There is nothing worse than waiting at a table for 20-30 minutes, for a waiter to take your order on a slow afternoon.    Take a look around the F**king dining room; Does it look like there are tables where people have no service, no drinks, no food. Seems to be a recurring theme with a restaurants here in Pittsburgh, mediocre wait staff. Work as a team, communicate with your wait staff.

z0QdOs306HNzQhdNSDrJQg.text: Stopped back again. We were waited on by Bobbilyn. She was great!!!! Good employees make a company. We pestered her with questions about drinks she was making. She smiled and had an answer for each one. All to often bartenders run around behind a bar with their head down. Bartending is a profession, I appreciate people who work hard to keep it that way. She could have hated us and been pissed we kept asking her questions. If she was she hid it like a professional. As always the food was too notch and the beer was cold. One of my top two spots on my trip.

jjl7vTLcQULqLQRBC0dkfQ.text: I've been here several times for lunch and the food has always been satisfying. This past visit I had the vegan risotto which was very appealing on the menu. In real life, the balsamic dressing gave it a bit too much tart flavor. The risotto itself was creamy and flavorful. There beer selection is very impressive and the atmosphere is fun, on point for the neighborhood, but not too try-hard. Also, service has been to my liking--polite, efficient, and not too in-your-face chipper. I would love to come back here for their social hour! FYI this place is great for groups!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Social hour menu.

rR4Cm076RcpH0XGSQnDC8Q.text: I feel like this place needs two reviews- one for the restaurant and one for the bar. Let's start with the good... The bartenders are experienced, fast, polite. Everything you could want in someone who pours your drinks. If they aren't busy, they willingly come up with some creative options and make great recommendations. Very cool atmosphere and ideal location. It's loud, so don't hit this up for a romantic first date, but it's always a good time at night.  I've eaten here probably 5 times and never had a good meal. The servers vary between awesome and downright rude, so that's a gamble. The dessert ravioli is incredible, but I've never had an appetizer or entree that wasn't overwhelmingly salty- and that's not a complaint I've ever made of any restaurant.  My verdict? This is a great spot for drinks and a snack at the bar, and an even better spot if you're single and looking to mingle or ready for a fun night out, but I wouldn't recommend it for a meal.

IJEUK19kpTlUB75N476NUQ.text: Was waiting for a table for 2 hours- checked on our reservation which initially wasn't supposed to take over an hour- hostess said "it's not looking good for you tonight" like?????? Who says that???  Drinks were good though but $$$$$$$$

Lh4b6Eb8XnqV-OFl7-HXww.text: If you like an amazing selection of craft beers and American whiskey, this is the place to go! I wish I lived closer so I could work my way through the whiskey list. It's a bit hipster, so grow a beard and wear your lumberjack shirt. Food was good, the menu is filled with home-cooking comfort dishes with a gourmet twist. Had the chicken and biscuits, with a tray of bacon as an appetizer. Also had truffle fries, but they were also slathered in blue cheese which totally overpowered any truffle powder or oil that was present in the fries. The metal stools fit the industrial, repurposed factory feeling of the establishment, but they're not comfortable for a meal... Might be fine for sitting at the bar though. Overall, I'd go back.

ykYp0amgzg5svVN_EzgQqQ.text: The combination of classic and modern is perfectly paired in this unpretentious Lawrenceville public house. The menu offers old favorites with new twists. The beef stew has fluffy dumplings and all the flavor you could hope for, while the bread pudding is soft and warm, but not too sweet and not without ice cream. All tasting homemade.  The prices are fair and the portions are generous.  The ambiance and the service are very good, the decor is raw and industrial, but still warm and comfortable. The wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable. You are seated promptly even on busy nights.   We did not have a chance to sample the extensive craft beer and whiskey menu, so we will be returning soon!

In7zPtgUO5tXvFpVJPPi-Q.text: Industry is good, but not great. They have good food, good beer, good cocktails, and a good environment.  They are just good when they should be great.  The food is very hit and miss. Sometimes the dishes are over sauced, other times they are perfect.  My fries this time had way too much cheese. My sandwich was perfect. Last time my sandwich had way too much aoli.  The smoke stack cocktails are amazing. If you like smokey, they can't be beat.  My recommendation for Industry is to go early. The place gets way too loud way too quickly. They need sound dampening or something. I typically have to start shouting by 8pm.

1H4isfAMGAGV7GjgCV2XIQ.text: I had the IPH and the pulled pork flatbread during happy hour on a Thursday evening. For around $10, it certainly hit the spot. I thought I'd like the atmosphere more, but maybe I just caught it on an off day.

fqhyXL7nhm-lvBQAkDFZjA.text: This is a garbage bin of an establishment. This is nu-soufside. This is the enemy of culture in Pittsburgh.  Look. they have a "big" tap list. It's HUGE guys. CMON. THEY HAVE LIKE OVER 20 TAPS OK? But the selection is mega stereotypical PGH sad face "seen it 100 times before" fair.  Whatever.  Lets move onto food.  Hmm..I'd really be in the mood for a..WHAT!!! A 15 DOLLAR HAMBURGER? JESUS CHRIST YOU HAVE TO BE HUNGOVER AND JUST SMOKED A CIGARETTE BECAUSE THAT TOILET BOWL SAYS YOU'RE SH***** me.  Man. That pricing is balls.soup. But hey, it's a Friday night and..oh NO I CAN'T HEAR ANYTHING BECAUSE ITS PACKED AS HELL IN HERE AND THEY ARE PLAYING LOUD CLUB MUSIC SO IT'S COOL RIGHT?  Whew. Well ok. Maybe I can talk to some of the locals to see how they feel about..Oh...wait..you just called the middle Eastern guy behind me a terrorist? Wow. Ok. And your friend just said that black people "get everything" for free. Cool dawg.  THIS IS MY SH**************************************T.

Cen_yq0-sf-QjoTzm_lbOw.text: My husband stopped in to have a beer and quick snack.  We sat ourselves at the bar.  For a Saturday late afternoon, the place had a good crowd in it.  The atmosphere is very casual and laid back.  The bar tender was very attentive.  We got a beer each and it was hard to pick because they have a nice selection.  I got one from a local brewery, which was quite good.  I also ordered a flatbread which hit the spot.  I thought it was too big for a "snack," but my husband helped me with it.  Lots of fresh mozzarella cheese and a crisp crust.  He got some boneless wings that the server recommended.  I was glad he got the half pound because it was a lot of food.  the wing sauce had a good spice.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Late lunch date.

cbjvaOlIZenyZlAF7cowXQ.text: Okay, but not great. People seem to LOVE this place so I feel a little weird writing this.  The first time I came here was to meet a friend for an post-dinner drink on a random weekday. The bartenders weren't particularly warm and friendly. Nothing really stood out from the visit. The second time was for happy hour with a few friends. I had their IPH IPA, which was decent. Happy hour pricing is pretty good, with $2 off drafts. The beer was fine but nothing special.  Yesterday I had lunch with a friend here, which was my first time trying the food. I ordered the Smoke Stack sandwich: shaved ribeye, white cheddar, arugula, and horseradish on sourdough. I enjoyed the ribeye with the melted cheese and horseradish (though it could have used more, to be honest). My only complaint is that there seemed to be an overwhelming texture and flavor of butter--I believe from the bread. It seemed like it was brushed or slathered on, and it was just too much. It gave the sandwich a greasy texture that just sort of ruined it for me.  I had a side of the loaded truffled fries. They were served with a very generous portion of the gorgonzola/truffle oil combination. They were good but extremely rich, so I could not finish the portion.  My friend had the fish and chips. She was served two GIANT pieces of fish, and commented that there were some uncomfortably soggy spots within the pieces. I tried a bit and it was okay, nothing amazing.  The atmosphere is pretty cool, I'll give them that. The bar/restaurant is also very spacious with plenty of seating. I'll probably stick to happy hours here going forward.

1bbu2rO1_dSs8y3ealTa-g.text: I'm in a bowling league at Arsenal Lanes, and my team was meeting here every week for happy hour before we roll.   We tried to dine here three different times, and every time our bills were messed up, food was forgotten and took forever, and when we were finally fed it was cold or bland.   They have really nice specials ... but I would have rather paid full price to have things done right.   The bar-tenders were forgetful and not attentive at all ... and they weren't even busy!   I really want to like Industry, but it just hasn't proven itself to me. I'll probably give it another shot at some point, but it's not going to be any time soon.   For now, we've taken our pre-bowling business to New Amsterdam and have been quite happy.

aX2_d99LjQPhmvKpeGbRMg.text: I am giving this place one star because I can't give it zero stars. Let's start with the dirty drinkware. There was old lipstick & fingerprints all over our water and drink glasses. A dining companion ordered the mozzarella wheels and when they arrived, 3/5 had no cheese in them. It took us over an hour for us to receive our meal. When our food finally came, my order was incorrect. We decided to order dessert (either creme brulee or bread pudding) and we went with the creme brulee. It was awful. It was cold & very thick. I exchanged it for the bread pudding which was slightly better.  I've been to the Lawrenceville location before & had no issue. I'm definitely not coming back to this location.

J2llkUWUGoCHjtdi6wkuCg.text: HOLY COW was this place LOUD. There are brick walls and really high ceiling so noise really bounces around and is amplified in there. They could really benefit from installing some sound absorbing blocks to make it a little quieter. We were there on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't even that busy and it was still crazy loud. I can't imagine being there on a Friday or Saturday Night.  Other than the noise, the food was pretty delicious. My husband and I split a few of the appetizers. We're a huge fan of Burgatory's gorgonzola truffle fries. My husband enjoys them so much that he gets an order all for himself every time we go. So needless to say, when we heard Industry Public House also had Gorgonzola fries, we wanted to try it out.  The fries didn't disappoint. They were smothered in melted Gorg! We nearly cleared the whole plate and it was a big serving! We also got the boneless wings, which were different from your traditional boneless wings. These guys were more like striks than the typical chunks of breaded chicken served as boneless. They were also very light on the breading. I think the strip-style made them a little dry, but they were covered in sauce so it didn't deter from the taste too much. I think I still prefer the more traditional boneless wing though.  We also got the buffalo chicken macaroni and cheese. All of the flavors were on point. The only complaint I have is that the chunks of chicken were really big and I think it would have been a lot better with smaller pieces that were mixed throughout the mac instead of piled on top. I'd get it again though because who can say no to buffalo chicken mac and cheese? Obviously not this girl.   The menu had lots of other items I'd love to try so I think a repeat visit will be in order in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cobbler salad

xhwkchGXOb77_JJtCTWN4Q.text: I love the atmosphere of IPH and Lawrenceville in general. The food is absolutely wonderful and the drink selection is terrific and has a lot of variety! As a cheap college student, I think IPH is unfortunately overpriced. The burgers are around $14/15 and the drinks are on the expensive side as well. All the times I've come to Industry Public House I thought the staff was a little snooty and wasn't polite to me or the rest of my group. The other thing I wasn't crazy about was that it's super loud in the restaurant and it can be very hard to hear someone else. Overall, I really like IPH and it's always a treat to go to whenever I'm in Lawrenceville.

skptLfG8wbVETy5XeBtzSQ.text: Food was pretty good, nothing to wrote home about. Host was pretty rude when we walked in. Put our menus on the table admit answering the phone while escorting us back and never acknowledged us after placing the menus on the table. Just walked away, didn't say another word. Pretty inhospitable with that. Server was nice, everyone working here just seemed to be unhappy and just going through the motions.

SS57GQ-I5Cb3zu3rFABRcw.text: Really cool and creative drink menu!  Their signature Smokestack is worth going for ... we went for our anniversary, and this made it fun and special.  The Rhuby Rhuby Rhuby was quite smooth and delicious, also.  The menu looked creative, but the two items I got were average .. the brisket pot roast and bread pudding.  Wouldn't order those again.  Our male server was wonderful!

E8wTjuAIUW6SanAkGXb0lg.text: This was a subpar experience.  I had high hopes because they ticked off all of the millennial trendy restaurant boxes with a flourish- edison bulbs, exposed brick, lavender-infused gin. I should have been put on notice when I was served with an old fashioned that may or may not have been mixed with a sour mix.  My burger was mediocre.  My friend's steak was over cooked, the salads were drenched in too much dressing, my brother's brisket mac n cheese was dry.  The two redeeming factors were the dramatic pretzel and the extensive beer list.  Resounding "meh" from the table.

IQwhr6WuEiwPVRcYkB9iFQ.text: It was ok. The poached eggs on my hash were tiny, almost worth not even adding them. Don't sit near the door, the temperature drops 20 degrees each time the doors open. Friendly staff and nice decor, though.

9fljERTajrp_ty7JpeDnkQ.text: Two years ago, this place would have gotten four stars from me, but I think it's a bit of a victim of its own success.  It's so insanely loud and crowded all the time when I go there nowadays that it's put me off from going back.  Maybe it's a sign of my old age that I want to be able to have an audible conversation with friends when I go out for dinner and drinks. Never mind that it's hard to get a table for dinner, and Industry seems less cool now that it's crawling with undergrads.  Man, I sound super-crotchety in this review ("You kids better stay off my lawn!")!  On the plus side, the interior is cool, the Smoke Stack smoked whiskey is incredibly tasty, and they have a  great booze and food menu, with high-quality ingredients (boar bacon-yumm).  So there.  No cataracts and hip replacement for me just yet.

uefKlDRJrXgaE5aZK3or8A.text: My husband and I went out tonight for drinks and some apps, which we don't get to do often. When we arrived, the place was already packed which we expected considering it's the weekend before St. Patty's. We got a table without a wait which was great. And then we realized we weren't going to be able to have a conversation because the music was so loud.   We got the truffle oil & gorgonzola fries and fried pickles. Both really delicious! Comfort food at its best.  My husband and I are both big whiskey drinkers. We were excited to see such a big whiskey list, but disappointed to find only a couple of cocktails centered around whiskey. Isn't it a whiskey bar? We were disappointed by it. For sake of trying something new, for his first round my hubby got the War of Currents cocktail, and I went for the Union Bushel. We both enjoyed the drinks, though we had to admit that with the excessive amount of ice in the glasses they were hard to mix and by the time we got halfway through it was half water.   Second round, he did the Smoke Stack with Knob Creek & mesquite flavoring. It was like a glass of charcoal and ice. There was no whiskey taste to be found. Super disappointing. My second round was Butler St Mezcal. I have no idea what the drink tasted like because the spice around the rim was so overpoweringly spicy that it was all I could taste for a couple minutes after taking a sip. We returned the drinks and were appropriately comped.   We went back to our original drinks as a replacement since we were a little nervous at the second round being so bad. These drinks weren't even recognizable as being the same as the first. They each tasted completely different than the first round of the exact same drinks. I could barely get through mine because it was so sweet.   All in all...our server was pleasant and the food was good. The atmosphere was relatively poor considering we couldn't hear one another over the Pussy Cat Dolls & Taylor Swift (really, guys?), and the drinks were a total disappointment. We won't be returning.

pipEpJwGfnJotczV7PERbg.text: There a many potentially awesome things about this space that just need to be tweaked.   1. It's so loud. So, so loud. With walls of brick and wooden floors, every sound that is made bounces back, so groups find themselves screaming at each other while having dinner.   2. Service: let's pick it up a bit. 10 minutes between the order for a drink and the delivery is too long, busy or not. Food was delivered in a timely way, but by runners, not the waitress, so this may have been a personnel issue.   3. Tone down the salt. Yikes! I've been enjoying the new styles of fries around town, and Industry is cooking them really well, with crispy on the outside texture. However, the amount of salt they threw on would have preserved me on a boat trip across the Atlantic to the Old World.   4. Nice draft list and creative cocktails. They don't fall short here. There's a mighty list of beers, bourbons and mixed concoctions. The variety is sure to please.   5. Great Nachos!

xMS1HvCCwv9pemNs4QOhuA.text: This is such a cool place.  It defiantly has the whole industrial almost steam punk feel going on.  The lighting is very cool old style bulbs that make you think Edison himself made and installed them.  The tables and chairs around the bar are metal.  This was actually my biggest complaint.   The small metal stools are about 8" square and are just not comfortable at all.    The drink menu is massive.  There are something like 30 different beer on tap, mostly craft.  I tried the house ale and was surprised at how good it was.  It tastes darker then an ale, but really smooth with an almost sweet hoppy after taste.  Very well done.  I also had the pleasure of my first of the season pum-king ale.  It's better this year!  Not as heavy, it's more bright and the aroma is amazing hints of pumpkin and ginger.  The liquor menu is also rather large, with plenty of different kinds of whiskey, scotch, and tequila to pick from.  We tried the smoke stack house bourbon and were very impressed.  Let's face it, fire makes anything better and that's True for this little gem.  They pour your shot, place a screen and wood chips over top, light the chips then let the smoke infuse with the whiskey.  It was amazing.  A must try.
