I also tried a mixed drink on the menu called hair of the buffalo.  Came out like a mojito and I enjoyed this as well.    The food actually disappointed me.  I got the "beastloaf."  It's a beef and sausage mix meatloaf that was bland.  The herbed gravy was bland.  The mashed potatoes were bland.  Are we seeing a theme here?  I think I got screwed here because I tried the better half's burger and it was really tasty, so take that for what you will.   It's also worth noting service was excellent, the waiter really knew his menu, and everybody seemed really friendly.  All in all I enjoyed my experience and I'd come back with friends.  Nice job, public house!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pum-king!
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hair of the buffalo.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cool lights!

EfkoWWUiYTI2C5cLmG0BZw.text: I've been here once, and it was only for drinks, so I can't comment about the food they serve.  I tend to hesitate to go out to the bars in Larryville because I don't feel nearly young or hipster enough to fit in there. Nevertheless, I recently found myself out at Industry Public late one night with some friends.   The positives: Love the industrial decor here. Cool lighting fixtures, exposed brick walls, giant garage door windows. I thought it had a very modern, hip vibe, while still feeling welcoming.  The negatives: Drinks were super expensive and not great. When we sat at the bar, I asked the bartender to recommend an interesting drink that doesn't taste overwhelmingly like liquor. He said he would concoct something for me, and came back with a margarita (how uninventive!) But apparently it was his "special" margarita, and he went on and on about how he makes the best margaritas, yada yada yada. Well, it didn't taste like a margarita...it tasted like straight up tequila (maybe that's why he thought it was "special"). But I'm not a fan of straight up tequila. So boo for that. My mistake for not being more specific in my order, I guess, but at places that are known for their drinks, I like to let the bartenders be creative and discover new things. Serving a drink that tastes like nothing but tequila to someone who specifically asked for a drink that's not too heavy on the liquor taste definitely doesn't speak well to this bartender's skills.  A bit later, I flagged down another bartender after our first one started ignoring us (it started to get busy and service became spottier as the night went on). Again I thought I would allow the bartender some creativity. I asked her to make me any tasty drink with grapefruit juice. I have no idea what she made, but she came back with a drink that was unpalatable. I couldn't discern anything in the drink (not even the grapefruit juice), but whatever ingredients were in it did not work well together. Blech!! It was so nasty that I couldn't even pawn it off onto one of my drinking companions (and one of the friends I was with has been known to drink just about anything, so that goes to show just how gross this drink tasted).  My friends' drinks were not much better. One friend ordered one of their specialty drinks with flambeed rosemary, which looked a lot more interesting than it tasted. On the whole, we ended the evening each having ordered two subpar-to-mediocre drinks, and the bill was pushing a hundred bucks for the four of us. Yowza, next time I think I'll just directly flambee my wallet instead and save myself the trouble.

N171-VKo2a_oGsCWM4NwNQ.text: This review is verging on two stars. The food isn't that great and it takes FOREVER. I cannot believe I waited over 45 minutes for a few simple sandwiches while at lunch. It's just your average food place, everything tastes alright but it isn't good food.   On the plus side the location is great, the atmosphere is great, the beer/liquor selection is incredible and reasonable.   I'd say go here for happy hour, but not for dinner. Whatever you do avoid this place for lunch. The wait is unacceptable (3 times so far) when there's barely anybody seated. Management needs to do something about the kitchen quality and speed.

pvEaDOBEk_i_SrJiA9s1Qg.text: Cool atmosphere here with a nice list of drinks. Service has been pretty good and attentive. We typically have our 4 year old and now our newborn with us, and it's kids friendly here.  I forget every time we come that we should just stick to the appetizers. The Pot roast fries are good! We weren't impressed with the hamburgers and grilled chicken salad. If we didn't have kids with us, this really wouldn't be our first choice in Lawrenceville.

ndke2hAnkd2yHJRGYKzdSQ.text: Really, extremely unhappy with the way my friends were treated. You don't tell people who have a complaint that "two other people ordered it today and nobody said anything to me about it." Some people may just suck it up and eat just because they're hungry, and just not order that again, or not ever come back. I've had plenty of fried fish all over Pittsburgh and this is the first time I've run into a beer battered fish that simply had no salt at all. Not in the batter, or on the fish. Totally bland, and very oily on top of that. Also they completely forgot to put dressing on my salad even though the menu said it was tossed in it, and the waitress didn't ask me for burger doneness. To even ask about any of this, I had to get up and find our waitress since she didn't come back to check on us for quite some time. Thankfully the burger still came out okay (if a bit more done than I prefer, since I like to order it medium rare and it had a medium well tag stuck in it), and I'm glad the fish and chips was taken off the check; these are honestly the only reason this isn't a one-star review.   I don't know what went wrong since I've been here plenty of times in the past and the food and service have both been great, but I really don't appreciate being treated like we don't know what we're talking about when it comes to food.

4R2gODJbN1aIgUdDx9cDyg.text: Food was not great, service wasn't great. The menu is not accurate, we ordered a sandwich they are not making anymore but is on the menu. I was brought the wrong wine. The atmosphere and the decor is awesome though. It's located in a nice area too. Maybe just a bad day here? Who knows, but poor service and food brought the rating down.

xm0pYdSczutA98AdET4TOA.text: Some of Kay's friends from Virginia were in Pittsburgh for medical reasons, and to express their gratitude for providing them with room and board at our home, they decided to treat us to dinner on a humid Friday evening. Being that Industry Public House is blocks from my place of employment and that we haven't stopped in yet, I figured it was as good a choice as anything else in the city.   One could argue that Industry Public House is somewhat redundant with the similar New Amsterdam within shouting distance, so I'm not sure Lawrenceville "needed it" as another reviewer suggested, but considering its overall quality, it's welcome to stay.   It's hard for me or anyone else I know to pass up truffle fries when they appear on a bill of fare, so the four of us shared a serving.   IPH calls them Truffled Filament Fries (one can also have them Loaded or Pot Roast style). I call 'em "pretty good." Along with that occult and controversial oil of fungus (that angry bastard Gordon Ramsey hates the stuff), the well-fried spud staves are adorned with Gorgonzola cheese, sage, and rosemary, making them all the more arcane (if humble french fries can be so), not to mention rich. I probably would have preferred the cheese to have been melted more, but immaterial of that, we all savored them heartily, even if I don't feel they matched up to that which Meat and Potatoes offers.   I TRIED like hell not to order a burger, but when I discovered that I could upgrade a certain one with "sweet lobster and garlic aioli" (speaking of redundant, is that a redundant term, 'garlic aioli?'), I felt I could achieve a compromise of sorts.  The Caribbean Burgher is centered around a patty constructed of ground chorizo and pork with a "jerk bbq baste" and a sort of relish or compote (?) called "sweet pineapple calypso mojo" along with the standard lettuce, tomato, and "housemade" pickle.  For the most part, to me the carmine burger was a success with its head-on crash of sugar and spice, but I felt the burger itself could have used a bit more ampage on both counts. It was filling and tasty enough, but I would have liked the flavors of the entire thing to have been larger than they were. The fragmented lobster claw almost became lost in the Santeria going on inside the strong bun, and the garlic mayonnaise was served on the side.   Our quartet tackled the Coconut Milk Cake for dessert. Its whipped cream frosting held toasted coconut shavings and would have served as a tremendous sundae topper. The discs of poundcake were divinely dense and absorbed the percussive ecuatorial essence of both the lemon and mango purees.   Kay and her childhood chum Renee shared some Pot Roast Sliders that contained within a potato roll the following elements: pot roast, sauteed onions, and mashed potato wafers. I had a taste and was astonished at how something associated with traditional Sunday dinners could be made into something cutting-edge, not to mention convenient and appetizing.  The spacious interiors of brick and wood are arranged such that I thought we had wandered into a sushi bar instead of a New American pub and grill. Regardless of IPH's poshness, there's a very casual vibe at hand, and the service was as friendly and enthusiastic as it was competent. I suspect that the staff knows they've gotten in on Floor One of an exciting establishment with an effulgent future.   I'm not sure what Industry Public House was before it became a restaurant and bar, but I do appreciate what it has become. May IPH and New Amsterdam forge a most wonderful rivalry that lasts long after all the neighborhood hipsters have approached middle-age.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A Coconut Milk Cake
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A Caribbean burger (chorizo/pork blend) with a garlic mayo and lobster claw meat

iScLG-Ow2PkAgXk1UzA1YA.text: I never realized how loud it was in here.   Sometimes I felt like I was yelling just to be heard across the table although I suppose that's indicative of people having a good time.    My boyfriend and I have varied tastes in dining and tonight was for him.  I'm not a meat eater or a whiskey/bourbon lover.  He was practically drooling over the massive beer list.  He ordered the chicken and dumplings off the features listing, and I went with the pumpkin ravioli.   Mine was good but not great.  I think it's the kind of place where you go for a sandwich or burger not homemade ravioli.   And to be honest, I'd go more for the beer and cocktails than the food.  I had the rhuby, rhuby, rhuby.   Sweet and delicious.  Also, had the Tesla's Coil, which was a bit too strong for me.  Our waitress knew the extensive menu impressively well and made some great drink recommendations.  Service dropped off a bit as the meal progressed due to some large groups coming in but overall a good experience.

lFqT9LPrymCwEu5cg_EqdQ.text: A very pleasant bar experience, with good bar selection and a fun atmosphere that encourages mingling with your neighbors. If I could, I would give 4.5 stars, but I think the drinks are overpriced comparatively. That said, the food is great and I am definitely planning to return for a meal. I really appreciate how each section of the menu has some vegetarian options. Stay tuned!

Fox8x5KIkygqihqojiWpPA.text: Let us start yesterday evening.  Here I was, inside my apartment, comfortable on my couch.  I was on my laptop whenever a noxious smell caught my nose which distracted me from the task at hand: catching up on work.  Trapped in this miasma, I realized my eyes have grown dull from the glare of the laptop screen.  A wisp of introspection curated a revaluation of how I spend my spare time.  My mind was set.  I am going to the casino.  After fumbling around my couch for my phone, I finally find it.  I attempt to pick it up, but the grease from my fingers makes it fall from my hand and into the cushions of my couch.  Defeat.  Now fighting an uphill battle, I frantically pull it up out of the cushions and fire up the Uber app.  I request my ride.  Then, like a guardian angel from heaven, a heavy-set man with a myspace-angled selfie, Lawerence, was on his way to save me from the tragedy and perils of time mismanagement.  I climbed upon his faithful steed in which he called "Pontiac" -- we rode west.  We arrive at the casino.  Upon entering the casino, I was immediately overcome by its energetic atmosphere. The lights, the sounds, the money.  My eyes glew green.  I headed over to a Blackjack table where I was greeted by the dealer, a man named "Khem" of an exotic descent.  What was about to happen would change my life forever.  He begins to deal the first hand and in a flash of hits and stands, I found my self with a five-card 21.  What happened?  Not only was my victory secured, but to my surprise, I also won a free t-shirt.  White, extra large, and with "CHEERS TO FIVE YEARS" written on the back.  I am in love.  Fast-forward.  I do well on the table, cash out my winnings, and head home to catch some sleep and bask in my triumph.  Next day, 8:00 am: I wake up.  The alarm on my phone rings like war drums.  Like a soldier on the front lines of battle, I am fearless, and my thumb strikes the "off" button with the precision of a trained sharp shooter.  I rub my eyes and they come into focus.  The rays of the sun pierce through my windows and illuminate my new favorite t-shirt.  The holy grail.  Excited, I quickly bathe, put on my new favorite t-shirt and run out to my car to begin my commute to work.  I am invincible.  I arrive at work and immediately everyone takes notice of my t-shirt - today is a good day.  12:00 pm: Lunch time.  After much squabbling and indecision between my deskmates and myself, we finally decide to just go to my car and start driving.  I am determined to find a place to spend my casino winnings while wearing my new favorite t-shirt.  A left turn, a right turn, another left turn - we dive head-first into an excursion of an uncharted frontier that would shake the likes of Lewis and Clark: Lawrenceville.  We park the car.  Unsure where we want to eat, we pilgrim the sidewalks until we discover our villa: "Industry Public House." We walk in.  After being greeted by the hostess, she guides us to our table and we sit down.  Long story short: It took like 40 minutes to get our food and there was like, only four other tables there.  The food was all right, but seriously, 40 minutes, wtf?  I accidentally spilled some water on the floor.

nMUg5SPDmfPK8tT2mDo5sw.text: Server was rude, food was bland ordered a medium well burger it came out still breathing and moo-ing at me I do not recommend this or the Robinson one

_jbipnQCheNLESYaGg3GHw.text: This is my second time here and both times I've gotten sick.  This most recent time was worse than the others.  My entire group was sick after eating here.  I will not return and would caution others to eat at your own risk.

ZWq0hOyOcw9Tu3xCtwp6Xw.text: I've eaten here a couple times and I've enjoyed it each time. Great burgers. Good bar food. Great drinks. and a really cool atmosphere. All of it is reasonably priced. Definitely a recommendation while in Pittsburgh.

wj1XEdvRkZmod0CcspWERw.text: I always enjoy stopping at IPH when I'm in Lawrenceville. It's got very cool decor & a large bar with lots of taps. They have a huge list of whiskeys & a craft cocktail menu as well. I've been here probably 4-5 times for happy hour & once for lunch & mostly recently for dinner. They have good craft beers, bartender attentiveness varies. I like their Buffalo Mac & Cheese flatbread, sounds weird but it's tasty. They have awesome truffle fries, but get the oil & cheese on the side to avoid overkill. Their burgers were good as well. Last night I had their steak salad which I enjoyed. Our server was great, I was meeting a friend I hadn't seen in years so we had lots of catching up to do & she didn't push us to order or finish quickly. It's definitely a place a take out of town guests for the cool vibe. Anyway, I'd definitely recommend stopping in for happy hour or just a drink & appetizer if you're cruising Butler Street.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak salad
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Main bar at happy hour
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Back bar

Qni40aePAdqlnT54ck5sew.text: What a treat. This super fun bar or maybe tavern or something had the best food and the best drinks. Huge portions of food and nice staff that gave good recommendations on what to get. The vibe in here is super cool and a nice place to meet up with old friends and share some food and drink. Next time I want to get the pretzel because that thing is huge and what goes better w a beer and some friends than a huge pretzel.

MvGAljthAo3mKCEm-omg9A.text: We had a terrific lunch here.  I had the company salad, which includes apple slices & carmelized pecans on a huge bed of greens. Yum!   My husband had the toasted cheese sandwich that's made with 4 different cheeses & 3 slices of bread including arugula. Good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Toasted cheese
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad

FgsH3lns0FO7tAhxV-X97Q.text: I would not suggest this place for a quality drinking or eating experience. In its favor is its large size and drink selection. One would expect Industry to be a good choice for any type of occasion, especially accommodating for big groups.  We went for a friend's going away get together last Thursday night; I arrived after 9 pm. There were only 2 bartenders in the main area and no table service. Other than long wait times, I had to remind the bartenders at each contact for my previous requests. Prices are unreasonably high for the quality of food. I ordered the $15 soft pretzel with beer cheese; it was completely over-salted, dry, and unappetizing.   Overall another one of several poor experiences at a place that has all the bells and whistles of your typical gentrified neighborhood drinking spot. Will do my best to avoid from now on.

X_d4Bq86fTncYuBziBio2Q.text: Industry has the BEST macaroni and cheese on the face of the planet--gooey and rich and everything you could possibly want out of mac and cheese! The burgers and salads are top-notch, and the pot roast is tasty too. Industry's atmosphere feels pretty hip and young, which makes sense given its Lawrenceville location, but every time I've been there, it's been filled with adults of all ages. The cocktails are good, although I personally think they're a little weak considering the price range, and it can be tough to have a conversation on a Friday or Saturday night because of the noise. Nevertheless, I've been here a few times and have even brought out-of-town guests and have always had a great experience--totally recommend!

KC4ulJNtsmtKmEwpHN_kVQ.text: I do not want to be the review of the day after their bartender was inappropriate.  I am extremely disappointed in this business as a neighbor & frequent patron.  I've turned a blind eye to their employees behavior outdoors and to have said to me what was said tonight is unacceptable.  Please remove my review of the day.

e8zG-wccy_I0UGmORo6wXA.text: Came here on a Friday night and wow it was crowded. We were seated in the dining area and it was still so loud that having a conversation was quite difficult.   I ended up ordering the buffalo mac and cheese flatbread. My friend had the Eliza chicken sandwich. Our party was relatively large, but the wait was unnecessarily long. Everything from getting water, to taking our order, to getting our food, to getting the checks took forever.   The flatbread was alright nothing special. They definitely could have put more mac and cheese on the flatbread. The chicken pieces were very small and there was barely any buffalo hot sauce. My friend's chicken sandwich was fine but a complaint with the sandwiches were that they were too small and not very filling. Overall, I don't think I will be back at least not on a Friday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo mac and cheese flat bread

A0XWWRZuxqMNWu6Us64QFQ.text: Industry is a favorite of mine in Lawrenceville for whatever meal I'm looking for! I've had amazing brunch, fun lunches, and delicious dinners there! Some of my favorites are their huge pretzel and dipping sauces that is the size of your head (or bigger!) their salads are so yummy, too and recently I've really enjoyed the Mac n cheese. They have so many great beers on tap and a great bar menu.   I think sometimes it's a little pricey for the style of food - but you're definitely paying for an atmosphere and vibe and I'm okay with that because this place is beautiful! Such a fun hangout that turns into a late night hangout that's crowded.   Definitely check this place out!

Y-lkjhcRKTplKh9UFUJQ1A.text: Showed up really excited to try out the beer selection, but little did I know that we would be left waiting for 45 minutes. We will never know how long it would take a waitress to take our order, because we got frustrated and left. No one ever said anything to us. Moral of the story, if you have anywhere to be, don't go here and the service sucks.

NzOWxLfWBwQXlaxCfpJJSg.text: Visiting from out of state so stopped in for a bite to eat. Great food. Best burger my Mom has ever had. I loved the lobster Mac. Our server James was very friendly. cool atmosphere. Just wish brunette hostess with long hair and mom jeans would have acknowledged us leaving when we walked out rather than just staring at us leave while she was standing there not busy with anything. Maybe I'm just used to southern hospitality?

tMgTY4DWJYSIknWEaZEVzA.text: The food and service have improved over time.  The price points on the menu continue to creep up. However the restaurant is always busy so probably just a case of supply/demand, and covering their (likely) ever-increasing tent costs.

LavpLIf2Fja2I-SJPE8_FQ.text: This feels right...like somewhere you wanna stay and drink. But, that's where appeal ends.   They make a smoked Old Fashion that's too sweet but good.  The service can be bad, like waiting cause ur in college and it's quarter pitcher night bad. It's not the bartenders fault entirely, the bars enormous and drinks can get pretty crafty and they like to keep staff dahn so people can actually make a buck. I get it.  The food, to me, for the price, it misses the mark. I would eat here, I just dont come here for the food.  They do have an impressive beer list, like one of the best in the city....now that i think of it...I'm adding a Star!

d72bNiTS6ofxO9Dwemr_aA.text: Writing this review as I am still waiting for my checks. It's a busy-ish Saturday night and while we were sat immediately, we waited entirely too long for every part of the dining out experience.  I don't know whether to blame the hostess or the waitress, but the service was terrible. We waited too long to order drinks, to order food, to receive our drinks, to receive our food, and to get our checks.   The food and drink selection, however, made up for it. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. I got a Porter beer and the Blast Pig burger. Reasonably priced for craft brew and a large, delicious burger, I was not disappointed.   I would certainly come back here, maybe for weekend lunch where the food is the same but the service has a chance to get better.

rFRpKRRkf1XosYvl_8HxfQ.text: We were in a hurry and stopped in here for the atmosphere. I would call it decent food, but nothing out of the ordinary. I had a burger with goat cheese and mushroom. Fried pickles were an entire spear which made it extremely hot to bite into. Everyone seemed to like their food, but it's pretty basic offerings.

POk-cvnTiiCTiDHV2DzK6A.text: Stopped by here tonight because we were waiting on our table at another restaurant down the road. We came for drinks and to hang out. We quickly found seats at the bar which was huge! The atmosphere was nice too. We were excited because we have been wanting to stop by....   The service was extremely poor on multiple occasions! We waited forever between drinks to even be noticed. The bartender told us drink prices when we asked specifically about two whiskeys, and apparently they were wrong. We had to ask three times for her to finally close out our tab, she kept forgetting. She was short with us and didn't really seem interested in serving us or really anyone for that matter. Very sad with the service here.   The alcohol selection was large! We had plenty of choices to pick from! Unfortunately, we won't be back and probably wouldn't recommend. We can't speak for the food though, it did smell good!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

C52o72raQ1CsomFUeOxP3w.text: Drinks were really good! We had the Tesla's Coil and the Ginger Beer Mule. Apps were on point too- if you like fish the Ahi Tuna was amazing as well as the Prosciutto flatbread. Nice atmosphere and good crowd. Definitely will be back! Also love the Digital Pour app which shows you the percentage of beer left on tap. Super cool!  Update to original review- totally different experience this time. They had a bouncer carding people which was kind of annoying- it took the hostess forever to seat us. The food was good but the drinks sucked and service was extremely slow. For a $100 tab we expected better service. Maybe next time but it will be awhile before we go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Out for drinks!

bva8V5vvSOYcZXGzhMoNzw.text: Solid food, good service, great environment & excellent beer selection.  I've been here a lot for lunch, dinner and late night check-ins and will come again. Burgers are excellent, must try any and all pickles which are home made.   Only draw back is Lawrenceville parking.

lbFd5iCxGvZ4jfObA6VRvw.text: Ali is the best bartender I've seen in awhile! My hunny and I were involved in a very serious conversation... Ali was so respectful knowing when to approach- so appreciative of her intuitiveness!! We will return!!

cM7AM88OrEdSZ4ImmBcGyQ.text: Really love this place; great atmosphere, gigantic beer selection, and Smoke Stack is pretty unique and always delicious. Place is pretty busy on weekend evenings which should be expected. The food is definitely what you would expect from a bar; I'd say slightly more upscale (and pretty good tbh). Really have never been disappointed and love make this my first stop anytime I'm going out for the evening.

m4a7hlGEm2MyZyTHE_0NvQ.text: The place is huge.  They have three bars from what I could tell.  The bartender at the back was super nice and entertaining. The old fashion was by far the best drink there and they have so many good drinks. The bartender smoked out the bourbon by setting it on fire. It was such a cool experience. It is definitely a modern twist on what is really considered such a hipster area. The crowd was a mix of 20s and 30s.  It got very crowded towards the end of the night but it was still comfortable.  This is one of my new favorite places.

0hNJjg8Qgy3Ez3_4T5VSeQ.text: First: this place has a lot of potential.  My experience was mixed, but it wouldn't take much to turn Industry Public House into a consistently awesome experience.  Pros: *The ambiance is fun.  It's a nice bar inside.  It's not to fancy, but not a dive either.  People have their space, and you could bring a date or a group.  *The bar is well stocked.  Some drinks are a little pricier, but others are fair.  I can't imagine someone not finding several drinks they like among the offerings (especially if you like whiskys, but there's plenty of alternatives as well).  *The menu has something for everyone.  And maybe more than one something.  It was hard to make just one selection.  *Good sandwiches.  I tried two, and they were both delicious.  In fact, I'm salivating for want of another sandwich just typing this review (and I take my sandwiches very seriously).  *Our server was delightful as well--friendly, knowledgeable, warm and welcoming.  Cons: *The service (and time to food delivery) was very slow.  I don't really blame my waitress, though, as they seemed to be quite understaffed.  Maybe it was a fluke, and maybe management doesn't keep enough people in the rotation.  If I go back and get more information, I'll post an update.  *The french fries were a disaster.  They seemed to be fresh cut, but mine were just drowning in grease and salt.  I could barely taste the potato, and I could only eat a few before downing an entire glass of water.  This should be VERY easy to fix, though, as soon as the kitchen is alerted to the problem (maybe even by reading my review...?).  *I think they could probably make more money by lowering drink prices in a few categories (like whiskys), as people like me would visit a lot more.  Right now I'd definitely love to return for maybe a sandwich and a beer, but I wouldn't want to spend a night of drinking at Industry Public House.  It would just cost more than comparable (or maybe even slightly better) experiences elsewhere.

FyZsvTbpTOQdiZK33sFwIw.text: . This was my first time eating here. Flavors were spot on. They combined the right amount of heat to flavor. There were suttle changes that would have made it perfect, but a solid 8/10. The smoke stacks are phenomenal.  Beer selection excellent.  And I thoroughly enjoyed the buffalo Mac n cheese.

2SyvmSWMp3PiFSHd3ShKKg.text: Pros: -Some good cocktails if you can get them  Cons: -Horribly slow service -Bartenders more interested in flirting and gossiping than actually making drinks -Mediocre food -Incredibly loud  This place is an absolute nightmare, I have gone several times since they opened constantly hoping for things to get better but they just keep getting worse.  When you want to order a drink you have to battle to get the bartenders attention and if you order a complicated drink get ready for a dirty look.  The food is very bland with even simple things like boneless chicken bites tasting off.  I have heard rumours they are planning to expand hopefully they start taking advantage of some noise dampening because everything in this place reflects sound instead of absorbing it causing the sound of other peolpes conversations to grow to a roar on a busy night.  Since Tender has opened accrosss the street I see no reason to ever go to Industry again.

pjfbOZo0iowRsQ7j3gPy1Q.text: Oh, Industry--you are so hit or miss. You have created an overcrowded monster by concocting the perfect harmony of "hip/ trendy" with suburban, mainstream appeal (think good music, factory-esque hanging lightbulbs, eclectic beer selection + sports on multiple tv's and tacky bachelorette parties). The happy hour special ($2 off drafts and way cheaper food) is pretty spectacular if you can make it there on a weekday between 4:30-6:30pm.   Other than the happy hour, the food is good but pretty overpriced. I have had one catastrophic experience with an incompetant server who did not know how to use the computer system at her own place of work. I have since forgiven the establishment, but it will forever go down as the worst service I have ever experienced.   A++ for the "Smokestack" cocktail consisting of smoked, flavored woodchips over a bourbon of one's choice.    ***Be warned: this is the ultimate in Lawrenceville "bridge and tunnel" on weekends***

RcvEmt7V9O2apVCHraHjzw.text: Showed up and had a great farmhouse ale. Everyone was friendly and we had two delicious Star Wars themed plates. French fries with buffalo chicken gravy and blue cheese (Vader taters) and nachos with cheeseburger sauce pickle salsa and chipotle cream (I'm nacho your father). It was may the 4th if you couldn't tell. I thought it was good value for the money and it was a lot of food! I will be back.

H6baWX20TdGuXbfvBjbbYA.text: I live right down the street from Industry and have been here a few times. When it's busy it sucks... A few weeks ago I was here with some friends, hostess said there was a 45 min wait and we said we would wait at the bar and to get us when table is ready... Went back an hour later and our name was erased from the board! I was so mad. The hostess was pretty snobby too. We finally got sat and had to wait 1 and half hours for our food! But when it's not busy, it's awesome! The food is great and I love the atmosphere... I have had the pierogi flat bread which is awesome and the late night bagel.. The macaroni and cheese is overpriced and really not that great...disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogi flat bread... To die for!!!

V1e2cq23tw58rjlaKiwqUg.text: Great bartender at the "second" bar - aka the one to the left after you walk in. Forget her name but was super friendly and helpful when trying to select a cocktail.   Fun and lively atmosphere without being obnoxious. Finally tried the food there on my last visit and was pleasantly surprised! Flatbread was awesome.   Great service and experience all around.

hQn1ngpjF4nqsarlMkfd-Q.text: Industry Public House is a few blocks from my residence in Lawrenceville so my fiance and I like to stop in here when we don't feel like cooking and looking for a quick bite to eat.   Industry sort of has this Jekyll and Hyde persona. On weekdays and nights it is sort of low key, not too crowded, with people sitting at tables quietly eating dinner and some guests at the bar watching whatever game is on one of their 20 or so TVs. But on the weekend its an entirely different story. Industry is sort of following the trend of what I like to call the Butler Street weekend; tons of young drunks flocking in to the neighborhood from the universities and other nearby neighborhoods looking for places to party. On the weekends places like Industry pack them in and keep the party going.  That being said, my fiance and I prefer the former, but understand the Industry's need for the latter.   The food here is really good. Think bar food themes, but amped up with top notch ingredients. You can't go wrong with the Mac and Cheese, Pot Roast, and most of the sandwiches are top notch. The only entree that I have been slightly disappointed with has been the IPA battered fish sandwich which was slightly too salty.  On the bar side of things the beer list is top notch with lots of local brewery selections and the whiskey list is one of the better ones I've seen in the city.   The only issue that keeps Industry from getting 5 stars is the service always seems to be so-so. Nobody ever seems too excited to take your order and the waitstaff isn't always prepared to answer questions about the menu. Some of the bartenders are very personable while others not so much. By no means is the service terrible, but making a little extra effort on this front could raise Industry to a 5 star sorta place.

UVgdPFGsRDoDBMvWR1G9nA.text: Beware the Pittsburgh Foodie-Bubble!  We wanted to like this place, we really did.  And we got off to a good start with their house Copper Ale, which is quite good.  The interior theme is also cool, if slightly hackneyed.  Had the wings and they were OK, over cooked somewhat, but otherwise good.  But then came the service.  Really annoying, employees more interested in each other than the customers.  All too cool to be bothered.  And that also goes to the management, which hovered and did their "supervisor"-thing with the employees, but didn't once scan to see how the customers were doing (would have found many empty drink glasses around the bar).  It never ceases to amaze me how talented some people can be at walking right past you and not engaging eye contact at all.  I won't bore you with the details, because I'm sure you've experienced similar.  Then I went to the restroom to find a large hoard of employees milling in the back, more interested in posing than actually doing anything.  I hope the restaurant scene in Pgh doesn't become too much of a "scene" as evidenced here. Remember restaurant owners and employees, it's not about you, a restaurant is a service business.  And your customers Yelp.

oHBY-MRb73IhuKR7fgOQQA.text: Oh yeah - I like this place! I'm a regular in Lawrenceville and I think it really needed a place like this.   I made plans to get there early prior to the Pens game 5 so that we had the perfect spot for watching the game. The walls are lined with flat screen TVs and the bar is also encircled with them. There isn't a bad seat in the house.  What I really love is the attention to detail on the food and bar menus. It's so sad when a place like this opens up and their menus fall flat. Industry has such a selection of 'artisan' bar food and drinks....including house-infused cucumber gin!   I like to think this place is a bit more mature and I'm hoping it doesn't lure the sloppy drunk college crowd from South Side.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menus
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Muddled Raspberry Whiskey Sour
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Farm Out Burger and Truffle French Fries

KiM0-50fH0eUh28gbIVhXQ.text: Decent bar. Consistently bad service. Probably been there 12 times and I would say one time I had great service. And I don't think the guy works there any more. It's a nice place to pop in for a beer or whiskey. But - don't expect to be waited on quickly or have the bartenders feel like they give a damn about you.

Aiqv-XhIyEWCZsxgsVCHIw.text: Definitely recommend! Any time any of my friends or family visit, I always make sure that we stop here for a meal. There is always an awesome selection of beer. As far as food, I have never really wavered from the "smoke stack" sandwich, which is awesome !  The service is good albeit sometimes a little lengthy because of the crowds.

FTR80vlg6QL66FzwX8Zz0Q.text: The pot roast is amazing!  Service was amazing on such a busy Friday night.  One of the best places to eat or drink in the Lawrenceville area.

R32Mn_YfzgFa7BEMmL3Nkw.text: Incredible food, will definately come back. Only took a star off because they sent my pierogies out frozen.

266nub7Fh-yLvb9j9o445A.text: Industry is a bit pretentious without the quality to back it up.  The drink selection and drinks are decent and reasonably-priced (minus the gin cocktail with rosemary, which is the most disgusting thing I've ever drank), but the service and food are generally lacking.  Stick with happy hour, otherwise you'll be sure to be disappointed with what you get for the price.  This place gets busy on the weekends too, so get a seat at the bar early if you can.  Steer clear if you have asthma or allergies--it gets extremely smoky at times and the ventilation is lousy unless the door is open in the summer.

LZxiPG4JwpsX8KIUAwgE8w.text: Sorry, but no.   I wanted to like this place so much -- my friend moved right around the corner and I had the highest of hopes this could be a regular place. That will not be happening.   Let's start off with the menu. Mine had different prices printed than my friend's. The menus had identical printing volumes at the bottom. We pointed this out to our waiter, who said "Which ever is higher priced is right!" and we were all "Oh, we weren't trying to get cheaper food, just thought you should be aware because people usually want to know what they are paying for food..."   Which brings me to service -- I wanted to like our waiter, but he was kind of weird. I don't know if pushy is the right word, but he wasn't congenial and almost seemed annoyed by us not knowing what we wanted the second we arrived. I mean, for real he handed us menus and was like "do you know what you'd like to order?" when we very obviously didn't. He left and came back literally 45 seconds later. After we ordered, my friend's drink sat empty for 20 minutes before we saw the waiter again.  I guess here is where I should note that this place was not at all busy, so the drink sitting empty is really inexcusable. Also, for 10 people being in the space, it was incredibly loud. I get that might be a product of the space, but what MIGHT help is not having several TVs blaring different things.   And now food. I got pot roast fries. They danced right on the "Wow, this is really salty" and "Wow, this is totally inedible" line. My friend's parents joined us and I didn't want to be fussy and hold them up, so I said nothing. Had it just been my friend and I, they would have been sent back. I rarely think things are overly salted -- these fries appeared to be coated in coarsely cracked sea salt. When I got near to the bottom, I realized that the gravy on the fries had basically made the paper in the basket disintegrate or dissolve -- that's when I just stopped -- who wants paper with their fries? Not me.   And now for the TMI portion of the evening. I have a pretty strong stomach with no regular digestive issues. I had the absolute worst indigestion, gas, and bloating after eating here. Worse than when I was 9 months pregnant eating pickled jalapenos on eggs covered in hot sauce with black beans on the side. Seriously. They use something in their food that is not kind to tummies. Or at least mine.

YfziQkO25TdInsXlGH9RUw.text: I've been to Industry a few times, and it's a fine bar, but nothing special. There are plenty of beers on tap and interesting drinks but I can't say that the service is that great. I've always sat at the bar and while the bartenders are friendly, they do not seem to be in any rush to serve people. I haven't tried much food here but from the looks of the dishes it seems like fairly good bar food, but if you're getting food at all - get the honey lime sriracha wings! They are some of my favorite wings in Pittsburgh. Outside of that, don't go in with many expectations and you'll get what you came for.

grcTNc8INbLRS67Vf3hRlg.text: I don't know what is going on with this place. Maybe they are getting lazy because it has become so popular. A year ago I would have given this place 4 stars but the last two times I went the food was a disappointment, particularly the sweet potato fries. They were undercooked. Even after sending them back they were undercooked. The salad I ordered was soggy from being over-dressed. I hope this place gets its act together!

wE_lFHhbDJHyU0benG_x5Q.text: Great place to meet friends for drinks and apps. Always an accommodating staff-service is impeccable. Have held a few events here and management so good to work with. Excellent service, food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mSRN3Nk9mltNMCysv5gH5g.text: I didn't write a review of Industry until I tried it twice. The restaurant is always packed which is a great thing, but the noise level makes it impossible to have a conversation at a normal level. I felt like I was shouting across the table when I was in the main room, and even in the side room I was still shouting even though I thought it would be a little easier to carry on a conversation.   The restaurant has fun vibes and if you're going out just for a drink, it's great, since there's so much room, unlike many places in Pittsburgh, and you can fit a large group. If you're going out for food, I think it's a little pricey for the food you get. The classic burgers and sandwiches aren't anything special. There are better places to eat, even in Lawrenceville that are better worth my time. Will probably be back for drinks and the huge portion of nachos but if you're trying to have a conversation, this is not the place to go.

K35CTC9V9e9pDSWAHEnOXA.text: Stopped by with a friend who had been  to IPH and wanted to go back. Very casual atmosphere with a big bar, long list of beers and many TV's.   Ordered a fall special of Smoke & Fire that is a smoked brisket with a pepper cheese (forgot the name) and an onion ring with hand cut fries.  The brisket comes on a bun that is large and very good.  It definitely had some of the smoke flavor and some spiciness from the cheese.  We definitely enjoyed our food.  The Smoke & Fire "Handheld" sandwich cost $16.  Thought it to be good but the price seems to be a bit high, guess you are paying for the ambiance.  Oh, Yea, the WIFI sucks.  Did not work for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoke brisket

5cfe_W6w1Uk8zbCL_3Nahw.text: Went in for drinks and a few in our party of 5 had something to eat. It was not busy. We were a bit confusing to the server because a few in our party did not speak English. Had our drinks and food, the Italians in our group paid the 120$ check leaving the server around 15$ tip. She commented to them the tip was less than 20%! Who does that?!? We were there less than 1 hour, had minimal food and drinks. Yea, the tip was not huge but for her to comment; I was so embarrassed for my out of town guests. We'll never go back!

va5-rJcjsKn1OxjW0JbwUA.text: Yesterday we had a reunion of 20 people there and it was a total disaster. Our reservations at 4:30 were placed over a week ahead. The service was non existent. The manager used the excuse there were 3 employees that called off. The real problem was they were completely understaffed and would not turn any walk ins away. After 2 1/2 hours we left without ordering dinner.

FhvOyyGXgMcsQV7f7UBiFg.text: How I do have a love hate relationship with this place. One of the stars of butler street nightlife, IPH draws on the 'cool cats' trying to catch the hipsters neighborhood vibe and who decisively pay too much money to stand squished together in a cleaned up version of a carson street bar.   However, for the money you pay in the 10 minute increments it takes to get a drink, IPH tries it's hardest to make up for the fault of its patrons. First, it has a fantastic rotating draft selection of craft beers and the gimmick of a blow-torch smoked cocktail. At least you're getting a show for your wait.  Second, they try a lot with their menu. Starters, flat breads, burghers and entrees and a brunch menu gives the patrons a lot of pick from. Now the price point is typical pittsburghese, meaning that it's slightly better than average tasting, $$ priced for a 2x meal. I like that. You definitely need to practice constraint on your own and take home half of it. Surprisingly, the food is better after taking it come and eat it cold. Unfortunately, there are many subtle flavors that are lost when the food is hot [such as the mashed potatoes that have been cooked in bacon fat]. Of course you could always settle for one of their delicious and underrated salads, which are definitely my favorite.  Third, they hit the nail on the head with their specialty foods. This is where IPH truly shines and the culinary specialty comes out. I am sad to have missed out on  the pumpkin stuffed with ground lamb, it looked delicious!!! Also, don't dare miss out on their bloody mary's, they are pretty much spectacular. [I think they are tinged with fresh orange juice].  Best word of advice is to come here during non-peak hours that don't fall on a Friday or Saturday night, as to avoid all of the pretentious people as to enjoy a simple meal and stick with the beers or come for brunch.

e7rNebpQy4Wi8dRWDeUfrQ.text: This location is near Sam's in Robinson Twp / North Fayette.    It is a tail of two visits.  My first visit was with a large group.   The appetizers were awesome.   Many have mentioned the candied bacon, flat breads - all are great.  They have an awesome beer selection.    The service was crisp at first.     As with any new place, our waitress was over extended which caused long wait times for drink refills from the bar and delivery of our meals.  My meal (ordered the Industry Pot Roast)  was warm / not hot.  My second visit was with a buddy.    Service was on point.    Food / drink service was great.   Food was slightly over cooked (Management Burgher) but arrived hot (this was due to larger tables all around us for holiday parties - my assumption was the kitchen was backed up).   Everything had great flavor.  This is going to be a great restaurant.   I hope they modify their service a little to provide extra hands for the wait staff.     I will be back and look forward to this location to improve.   There is a much need in the local market (away from the chain restaurants the area is known).

SPZXD8M43yl31SCvJLiEuQ.text: thank you for the better cheese!!!  Couldn't be happier.  I went back for the 15th time in 2 months, finally ordered the pretzel again.... ecstatic.   Muchas gracias!

lKWSmTyZz5POBpyvkV-D0A.text: Only 1 because they don't have zero.  Terrible service.  Restaurant waiters are awful.  Forget drinks, don't bring silverware, food comes out separately and some cold, etc. Bartenders are even worse.  Beyond general lack of urgency additionally they are fairly rude.  Used to be a great spot but has totally gone downhill.  Avoid and I live two blocks from here.

_6f44oOoTdkjrHE1RB9xyw.text: I really liked the decor of mix metal and distressed wood with Ediason lights over the tables.   Being Friday night it was a bit loud and hard to hold a conversation.  The service was attentive and the food was delivered very quick, almost to quick ... The appetizer and the entree arrived at the table within seconds of each other from different runners.  The food was average at best, the fried pickles were ok and my Reuben was average could use more of their home made sauerkraut.  Not being a beer drinker I didn't take part in any of the 60 beers on tap, but someone could have a good time sampling some. Over all had a good time, but could be a while before my next visit.

dvzobx69VAVWtVG2fC9Z2A.text: Perfect venue for a laid-back dinner, especially on a breezy summer night.  Everything about this space has such a modern and easy going vibe, it makes you want to take full advantage of its very visually appealing bar and have a few beers from the extensive tap list with which to slowly enjoy your meal.  Four of us were able to snag a corner table in front of the huge windows overlooking Butler Street.  I had an induction salad, and my partner ordered the Farmed Out Burger.  Forgive me for waxing poetic about a salad, but the zesty arugula was perfect with the tomato and watermelon chunks, which were plentiful.  It has ruined me for all other summer salads.  My S.O. enjoyed his burger, which was tasty in the way only cheddar and fried egg-topped beef confections can be.  It came out medium rare, as ordered (fearing overcooked meat, I never take this as a given).  Our friends greatly enjoyed their burgers and fries as well.  We thought this would be a great place to bring out-of-town visitors for a casual meal if you're not sure where else to go.  We'll definitely be back.

KOy4giNjaBYQUH_q9REXCw.text: Great restaurant in lawrenceville with good food and beer. Kind of pricy, but worth it in my opinion. I've had one of the best chocolatey stouts here, and their industry size soft pretzel is massive and can feed up to 4-5 people.  I will definitely come back here!

wwIYdBh2ZxRyqXBUZxaNRQ.text: I've been here twice. Once on a Saturday night, when it was very busy! I got the whiskey campfire smoke stack drink because it was recommended to me by a friend. Mine was some fruity selection. Watching the bartender make the drink was like having a mini-show and was really fun. The drink itself was great too. The show makes the price tag reasonable, although at $10+ does warrant a "once in a while" label for me.  Second time was a Thursday evening at the end of "social hour" (4:30-6:30pm). I had one of the standard ciders they had on tap which came in an interesting glass (kind of girly, lol). The buffalo mac and cheese flat bread was half off and DELICIOUS! finally some good mac and cheese yummmm. Their other flatbreads looked pretty yummy too. My companions got their fries with beef which they gobbled down happily.  Would like to come check out the other food here next time!

f4PA6jqHgdYOVNCOlzmA7A.text: Great draft list and great happy hour specials. One of my favorite spots in town.

8PD39_lquSsZxBy4HGqosg.text: This place has the worst customer service I have experienced in a very long time. Came here with a group and it was unbelievable how terrible it was. There was 1 bar tender from our first trip to the bar that was ok everyone else...  We sat down at our table and waited for 25 minutes for our drinks. The food was not bad. Waited 20 plus minutes for our tabs with no drinks. Went to the bar after dinner and waited 15 minutes to get a drink. Asked to have the World Series put on and was told that the games that are on are what stays on the tv. Funny thing was that the World Series was the only game on that night and the rest of the tv's were just garbage tv. This is not my first bad experience service wise and I will not be returning.

_3ZalnYDrMlA5hLPL9_Osw.text: Absolutely love this place, eveeything from casual drinks with friends to their food! Awesome service always smiling and checking in with you. I ordered the fish and chips and my boyfriend ordered the grilled mahi tacos. Yes, we love fried fish. Both were absolutely delicious.

eVrAYp_SeazhbQxBrYpQjA.text: All the hype was well worth it. I suggest going there whenever you can. Stopped in for a quick one while taking my mom shopping for shoes. It was lunch hour and the bartender was on point. I asked for something fast. His replay " beer or liquor? ". Of course my answer was liquor. I totally enjoyed the best old fashion ever.

1hN_vMmoGtmKSwyGgG5Fvw.text: Great food best nachos ever. Even my kids liked the place. Service was great and pretty quick even though they where slammed.

cMLvAjCc8E4HNHMla0iCFA.text: First time we went here we had a amazing dinner but quickly realized that the menu doesn't change much and we would be eating the same two veggie options every time. Please change it up!   Drinks are awesome and get 5 stars.

3FkAwcfyksfaP-2Gibar0w.text: Industry feels like more of a NYC village beer pub hangout with more tvs (can't lost the steel town sports crowd)than s hipster joint.  Good beer on tap and excellent pub food.  It's a little more upscale and expensive than most bars in Larwenceville but worth it if you are looking for that experience.    I was there on a date sharing my passion for Interpol's 'Turn on the Bright Lights' and she played the entire album.  Thats pretty cool.  I highly doubt that would work with Bon Jovi greatest hits but cool of the bartender : manager and would you really want to hear "Johnny used to Work on the docs..." Again?

Zcrd0FCF5qSgNPuTosrhZw.text: I went to Industry for the second time tonight (well, actually the third, but one of those times we didn't stay because the wait was too long). The first time I went, I only had cocktails. And what fine cocktails they were!  The cocktail list at Industry leaves NOTHING to be desired. Delicious!  I was amped to go back to try out the food.  A couple of friends and I went tonight and had a great experience.  Our server (Jason) was awesome - friendly, knew the ins and outs of the drink and food menus and was super quick and attentive. And adorable. I had the Smoke Stack which is a roast beef sandwich on grilled sourdough bread. It was so good! It had a nice horseradish sauce on it as well as some mozz cheese.  I was pleased as punch with the fries, too. Fresh cut and crispy.   I also have to mention that the prices were great. I got out of there for under $20, including tip (I had the sandwich, fries and a beer).

eQcV8Jo-RcZY0SEBpulGAQ.text: We stopped by here while out in Lawrenceville a few months ago, new to living close to the area & apprehensive of all the young hipsters swarming around. We were pleasantly surprised to find a urban & unique l (think microbrew that you would find in NYC) place to eat. Different menu, I got the Lucy (sandwich with tempura veggies) and it was great. We ended up staying there most of the evening because of their hundreds (at least that's what it seemed like) beers on tap.

tx-dEFJ_jUrJ5LnKwfVKFA.text: I love the decor of this restaurant, industrial lighting all over!  If you like to drink they have a huge bar and a large drink menu to choose from.  The only thing I don't like is we've been there a few times when they were really crowded, it gets very loud in there with a lot of people it was hard to hold a conversation.

1XaZps97qMZkW4KVzdU1Cg.text: Great beer selection, great cocktails, and good food as well. It is a little pricey and the bar stools definitely leave something to be desired. My butt hurt the entire rest of the night. Im not a whiskey drinker, but the smoked whiskey is kind of their thing and people love it. It seems cool, but its just not my thing. I give it 4/5 stars because of the beer list and the fact that I stop here every time Im in Lawrenceville. Only thing preventing 5 stars is the prices, the parking, and the bar stools.

QpozbtMdlRsc6yL_LuEv2g.text: Good drink selection. Been here to have drinks twice. Had lunch this past time and it was good as well. We had the Smoke Stack and the Pulled Pork.

1j2bEuSuyBjsHm4PhkGZDQ.text: Dear lord!  I feel badly for doing this, but after a negative first experience ( which, btw, was during Art All Night, so that I gave them the benefit of the doubt), I decided to give them a second chance. Not good, my friends, not good.  A late Sunday afternoon, it was. They were not busy. It was my pals bday. We just wanted some brews and sustenance. We were ignored, ill served (cold, icky food/several times), and left to fester. Their space and location are so amazing! Why?!?  Why, is the service so poor?  I shan't give them the "third times a charm" chance.

Cp3u9bOPEXWBFVwripeYgQ.text: This review is for the work of art that is the smokestack.  It's very unique, and very awesome.  The bad news is I now make these at home all.the.time.  Hangover city, but if you haven't experienced one yet, you need to get your ass to Industry immediately.    This is a smokestack:  Pick a bourbon of your choice.  I recommend something moderately price, non-bonded. Pick your wood chip smoke (mesquite, cherry, or apple.)  To assemble, 1.5-2oz of bourbon, .25-05oz of maple syrup, dash of Peychaud's bitters.  Strainer on glass, set wood chips, burn them til they smoke.  Cover with shaker, infuse for 2 minutes, then dump chips & drink into shaker, stir well, strain into glass.  Add a King Cube ice cube (big-ass ice cube that slowly melts.)  Congrats, you just made a kick-ass drink.  They also have an extensive amount of taps as well.  Their food, unfortunately, is still lacking.  Everything is made in-house, down to the sauces, but unfortunately it has all been pretty mediocre.  Not bad, but it doesn't hold a candle to the cocktails.

E7saaSrvoMcZKIJ9sBIpKA.text: Go in and ask for Jess as your waitress!   The Truffle Fries are AMAZING!!!!!!! Try them!!! The Farm Burger is very good! I also had the buffalo mac and cheese for a side and it was delicious.   My husband had the chili and loved it!  I recommend this place to anyone who lives or travels to Pittsburgh and wants a nice place to eat/drink.  Can get packed in the evenings and nights but late lunch is a nice time to go.   Lainie

Vqfrv3zfo6XC4iB9QHtFFg.text: Food isn't so great. Often disappointed. Drinks are overpriced. The atmosphere is nice when the front windows are open but otherwise it's loud and stuffy. I think this place is overrated.   Also they give you a really hard time about splitting bills if you go with a group.

r7piiLF4hLatFB34rO87cg.text: I went to industry public house for the first time today with a few friends. We were actually slated to go to another restaurant for Cinco de mayo but that restaurant was closed. I ordered a vegetarian sandwich, the Lucy I think it's called, and a margarita. The sandwich was pretty good and the drink was decent. What I didn't care for was the loudness. Definitely interferes with normal conversation.

Se3DUFMgDQxwJXHon-v7hg.text: After reading a review of Industry in the City Paper I knew I wanted to check it out.  We stopped in on a Saturday afternoon around 4:30pm for a cocktail and appetizer.  The place is a huge u-shaped bar, with a handful of tables scattered about.   Although the number of TVs hinted that this is the place to watch sports in Lawrenceville, the drink menu suggested way more than sports pub.  They have 40 taps with several local brews and an impressive drink menu.  I ordered the Robber Baron, which is made with vodka, vermouth, pickle juice, and a pickle spear. Whoever thought this drink up must have been reading my mind.  It was a perfect cocktail for someone who loves pickles.  The boyfriend had a cocktail with cherry infused whiskey, which was just sweet enough to hide the fact that it was whiskey!  We ordered a flatbread with fresh mozzarella, basil, and roasted tomatoes.  The serving was small for the price, and didn't really resemble flatbread so much as a pita with toppings.  Despite that, the fresh toppings did not disappoint.  I hope they start posting their food and drink menus online.  I will definitely return for another pickle cocktail...I can't get anything like it anywhere else!

IsU25kAomzGTes7SIGhG-g.text: Good spot for drinks. Sat at the bar and had good service. The beer list is good, but the whiskey and bourbon list is amazing.

txxmvsz6nafiLqkqJViB1g.text: Excellent drinks. Fun experience and atmosphere. Average (in a bad way) food and service.

ok2Q03rwqcCZQQccZW8M3Q.text: Industry is a new bar along Butler street. Having seen the layout in the windows for many months leading up to their opening, when I found out they opened I had to stop in and check it out. We walked in just before dinnertime and asked if they had a happy hour - they don't, yet, but assured me within a week they'd have one figured out. The hostess encouraged us to look at the food and drink menus, all printed on sheets that look like industrial part-order forms, each several pages long.    We had just gotten dinner at nearby St. Matthew's fish fry, so we weren't hungry, but decided we'd sit at the bar and grab a drink. The room is very nice looking, a wide open space with a very large bar in the middle, a somewhat open kitchen off in the back. Bright light shines in through the bay windows, but beautiful hanging light fixtures are all around the restaurant. There are high and low tables, semi-communal bench seating, and tables around the outside.   The bar contains a very large liquor selection, in addition to its 40 taps - 2 of them being house brews(With taps made of working lights). At the front there are many containers of various plant matter soaking in alcohol, which we found out was a Blood Orange-soaked Ketel One Orange, a Cucumber-soaked Hendrick's gin, and what ultimately wound up in my drink, a bing-cherry soaked Maker's Mark. What I ordered was essentially a manhattan made with this concoction - beautifully served in an oversized glass with a single, (nearly) crystal-clear, extra-large ice cube and a cherry. The taste was slightly sweet and with little bite, but the flavor of the cherry really came through and made it very pleasant to sip. The bartender told us about one of their sweeter drinks, the Confetti - something like a cake-flavored white russian with jimmies and a 'cake frosted glass'. What really interested me on the menu was the 'Smoke stack' - your selection of bourbon or whiskey with a touch of maple syrup and your choice of wood to infuse a bit of smoke into the drink.   While we didn't try the food, the bartender did encourage us to come back and try the bugers, advertising that they were pan seared in several varieties of rendered pig fat. The appetizers sounded quite good as well, along with things like truffe oil and gorgonzola fries, and several jerk-seasoned items.  The service was outstanding, especially given that they had only opened a day before. They were certainly well-staffed for it being early in the day, and the bartender was nice enough to talk to us about the place and how many of the items on the menu are made. The prices were on the above-average side, with both cocktails and burgers being in the $10+ range, and beers being in the $5-7 range. As I said, no happy hour just yet, but stay tuned - I'll certainly be returning to try the food(and more drinks!).

h540nW9nk_JiWe45enr5-w.text: Another new place in Larryville? I may never leave this part of the city!  Industry, along with Tamari, is filling a voided niche that Pittsburgh so desperately needed. I have lamented the lack of upscale pub/ lounge environments in Pittsburgh that you can either go to for some quality drinks or delectable bites and not be surrounded by affliction shirt wearing bro's slurping up bud light (why is that the bro drink of choice? less calories more taste? or prep for the redbull and vodka to come).  Anyways, I was really excited to check this out yesterday. Upon entry, the place opens up spaciously with a nice vibe that suits the name. I love the open brick walls which pay homage to the city's roots, embracing an architectural heritage instead of absconding it. Another plus is the bar which is open and rectangular, as in you look at people instead of yourself in the mirror, which may prevent the vanity and or depression that comes with drinking. Might as well look at someone else and strike up a conversation, right?  The drink menu is extensive, with a respectable tap list of many favorites, and a bottle list to supplement that. To me, what stood out, is the cocktail list. This is what reminded me of Tamari, and what alot of Pittsburgh bars miss. They all sounded wonderful, and did not disappoint. I had the industrialist, as I love whiskey and all things manhattenesque. It was a solid drink that was worth every penny. My girlfriend had the Carnegie ( I think thats what it was called) with the gin and cucumber and it was also very tasty.  The food menu was also extensive, and each item looked like it was carefully thought out as to how it could be unique and flavorful.   She ordered the farmer burger, while I ordered the steakhouse sammich. As usual, she ordered better than I did. This is not to say my sammich was bad, it was quite delicious, with a generous helping of steak on a wonderful sourdough bun.   Her burger was simply smoky, juicy and delicious, and better than many of the "burger" themed restaurants that seemed to be the in thing for 2010-11.   I will return for cocktails, food, sports, basically any excuse.

YixuK0SLh3HWt5ddv1icjQ.text: Lavender-infused absinthe?! I wish I could have purchased a bottle and taken it home. I'm currently trying to infuse this in my kitchen as we speak so I don't have to keep driving to Pittsburgh.  Seriously though their version of a Sazerac, while certainly not at all close to the classic, is definitely a fantastic cocktail.  Maybe one of my favorites ever.  Our food took a while to come from the kitchen (not an overly long time, though, and we were planning on having a few drinks anyway) but the manager came over and personally apologized for our wait and offered us a round of drinks on the house.  5 stars for customer service!   We tried several cocktails from the menu and they were all fantastic.  Quite a whiskey selection, as well.  I was slightly disappointed that the signature Smokestack seemed to be MIA from the menu the night we visited.  Just means we'll have to come back!

HqLuQMyLPBkA5akUyQyGqQ.text: Food is... Bland would be the the best way to describe everything. Stick with salads. Drinks are extremely over priced and the staff, while friendly, always seem either overwhelmed or rushed. I give this place a shot every 6 months but I've given up...

zN8OBdSthl-wQO0V7w29_g.text: I am writing this review as I sit in the new location in Robinson.  It is now 5.17pm, I ordered my cocktail at 4.55 pm. I have been seated since 4.34 pm. It is not crowded. Needless to say the only thing I can equate this wait to, is the line at the top fuel dragster, opening day at Cedar Point. Waiting for my cocktail is like waiting for Halley's Comet. The staff seems to mirror the Lawrenceville location hipsters with no direction from management, no sense of urgency, they are more concerned with playing the hits of the 90's at 90,000 decibels than their customers. Sad.

Lbfnc6AzdcvNJ54Kb85Olw.text: We sat at the bar on a Friday night and the bartender was attentive and awesome.  The food was really good - we just got an assortment of appetizers.  The nachos were good.  I asked the bartender to recommend a wing flavor - and we wound up with the mustard ones.  They were saucy and interesting.  Good, by all means.  Just different.    All in all, a good place, although maybe a bit too expensive.  Dinner and drinks for 2, with just a few appetizers for dinner ran us about $100.

7MQQ1ljAk8IwpZgJ6KW_0g.text: Overwhelming list of beer, bourbon, and whiskey. We ordered the mozzarella cogs (also known as circles) to start. My beef ravioli was spicy and didn't like me later on that night. Boyfriend had an old fashioned and thought it was the best one he's had in the burgh.

75KsV8EKNEvEnFcatGMSdQ.text: This is quickly becoming my favorite bar in Pittsburgh. The bartenders are a bit mixologist-like so there are some very tasty drinks (I especially liked the Smokestack with apple wood smoke). The food (appetizers) was very good too. I recommend that folks check it out.

tcfOYhiYGMOc86QgaKjHfA.text: Had a couple crown smoke stacks. Phenomenal. Cool idea. Didn't eat but menu looked great too. We will go back to try it for sure.

5HMskQYsfUBLETqcNYCHng.text: They have about forty taps.Good beer selection. Mediocre food. Avoid the cheese sticks. Tastes like a freezer, no flavor. It's great that they have the Arsenal Cider House on tap. The staff is generally friendly. Don't go on the weekend unless you get there early. Not sure how they can look you square in the eye and tell you it is over an hour wait without laughing. They need a better notification system.

HI9EHnX3mzR0ldcMq4KczQ.text: Surprisingly good beer selection, solid, quality food beyond what I expected. Big and clean. Can get a bit noisy but not a big deal. Only complaint is the prevalence of flat screens, but they're clustered around the bar and therefore aren't too intrusive. Prices are fair. Good place for an after work drink or weekday dinner.

Ym8h0FWTgdYMaJaz6ItPyg.text: Haven't had a bad meal yet! Great place to take a client for lunch or a cocktail after work. I have done both! Large selection of unique libations and a widely flavorful menu!!  I haven't had a client that didn't enjoy their meal yet!

VPgkzht7aGM7G5pQHoZtsA.text: Industry has awesome creative bar food and the selection on tap is great. Favorite dessert is their  banana bread with jalapeno cream - its too good! Great place to go if you are wanting to relax and mingle with friends. We have gone 3 times now since they opened in April and everyone I meet has really loved it as well. We are all raving to go back.

tnKuEfiCCF2Gygwt8E4K9g.text: It seems that most of the reviews here are very polemic, either you love or hate the place. I have to say that I lean more towards the former. I actually am a pretty big fan. I've been here 3 or 4 since it opened and have always enjoyed the cool, mature, sophisticated vibe here. I really enjoy the crowd that it draws in Lawrenceville, mostly younger professional people. The tap list here is quite extensive, and the variety and diversity of the liquor menu is incredible. You will find bourbons here that you probably can't find anywhere else in the city. I was actually here when the ball dropped on New Year's, and while the place was crazy, I still enjoyed the crowd and drinks, and the bartenders were still able to keep up (and even serve a free glass of champagne to everyone at the bar!). I have to say that I've never tried the food here, so I'm far overdue to sit down for dinner sometime. Unfortunately, it's become a madhouse on the weekends now because of novelty and word-of-mouth, so for a meal I'll definitely need to stop in sometime during the week. I love how this place has carved out its own niche at the perfect location on Butler.

R72ukxBr5NORuevRMh5_OA.text: Perhaps the best gastropub in Pittsburgh.  Industry used to be extremely crowded, but after the expansion, no more.  The menu has suffered after the loss of the habanero chicken sandwich, but for a shorter wait to get in, it is a fair tradeoff.

fV8ND6vmCizLEyKjymzqcw.text: People go nuts over this place and I'm not really sure why.. I'm not alone in feeling this way, either - everyone I talk to says the same, yet people flock here. There's nothing especially wrong here. The food is good, not bad, not great. The atmosphere is fine, not bad, not great. The prices are way too expensive for so-so food. I think it is good for people who need a lowest-common-denominator type place that everyone in their group will be ok with. Sandwiches are good (too expensive), fries are basic, don't bother getting the nachos.

kNNcfFo9A78EfmTppKjYSA.text: Terrible service. Never anyone around to help. Food was just ok  fries soggy. Took 10 minutes to get mustard for out burgers. Beers were flat.  Will never come back. So many other great places in Pittsburgh. This place is a complete waste of your time

LuHQ-XnaYBFKOuKeW9O4pA.text: I like the bar, the beer and like the food, but beware of the anti-kid attitude.  6:30 on a Monday evening.  They have closed off 2/3 of the restaurant, and all the tables are taken.  Hostess directs me, my wife, and my 10-year-old to the (3/4 empty) bar where we are immediately rousted with a "no kids at the bar!"  Discussion with the manager did not lead to any satisfaction:  they are happy to take our money as long as we sit ... there! Not there!  I suppose this might be a five-star review for someone objecting to sitting next to a 10-year-old (though he would have been pinned between us), but for us, it was clear that we were not welcome.  Fair enough: lots of other choices.  Ironic aspect: it was the 10-year-old who insisted on Industry due to the bacon appetizer. Families beware!

F5SAaVxE0pT1OiFi9BXu1w.text: Good selection of beers and spirits but one of the worst services in PGH. Food is ok.

1utBf4cGmyHksLyIRL8TfA.text: Worst service ever.  My wife placed an order for fish and chips, 25 minutes later our server apologizes they are out of fish and chips.  She stands at our table so she can place her 2nd order quickly and get our food to us.  She passes our table several more times and apologizes that we still don't have our food and that they will comp my wife's burger because it has taken so long.  No manager stops by to apologize, no appetizer offered because of our wait, nothing.  After one hour, we still have no food.  I guess it is easy to offer to comp food that you never receive.  We tell the hostess, on our way out, that we are leaving.  On our way home, my wife left a message for the manager to tell him or her of our experience, and no one returned her phone call.  I guess service isn't a big issue with this establishment.  We will make sure when we are in Lawrenceville next weekend for the Cookie Tour, that we will tell the shop owner that recommended this restaurant about the poor service we received and maybe save someone else from wasting their time.

ePPGiK4oxZd6MR_e68oIww.text: Food was excellent - I had the Sticky Pig Iron Burgher. Also ordered an Old Fashioned due to their vast Whiskey selection. The bartender made an excellent drink! Only reason I don't give it 5 stars is the fact the service was very slow. It was a Wed. evening and not very busy. I would return the next time I'm in town.

XJakYh6eVEXCXQl9NUUG-w.text: Decided to try out Industry last night since we were in Lawrenceville for RANT.  We were a group of 6, who were seated within 10 minutes of arriving. The guys were excited by the extensive beer list.  We ordered our food pretty quickly and the two couples who ordered appetizers were thrilled. Everything went DRASTICALLY downhill from there.  About a half hour later, our waiter came back, took another round of drink orders and told us our food was up next.  After another half hour wait, when we never saw the waiter, we asked to speak with this manager.  This was AN HOUR after we put our food order in. The manager apologized, said they were slammed.  While the place was busy, there never appeared to be a long wait to be seated and many tables around us who were seated well after us had already received their food and cashed out.  The manager bought a round of beers for the guys and said they would get our food right up.  After another 25 minutes with no communication from our waiter or the manager again, we were in the process of determining what we owed for the beers so we could leave.  As we were standing our food arrived. The food was good, but after an hour and half wait, I think peanut butter on cardboard would have tasted good.   We had planned to check out some other bands and clubs but everyone was in a bad mood after the wait and the amount of time that we all headed home. I am certain we won't be back because after all, who has more than 2 hours to wait for a fairly average hamburger?

EKEiPVngZoqEweYmkEsMYg.text: Just went here for the first time with a friend. No problem getting a seat, service was very quick the whole night.  The first thing you notice is that it is very loud in here. We got there at about 7 on a Friday night and it was already at shouting-level. The sandwich board outside was advertising Southern Tier's Pumking, so we both got one - if I had realized it was $8 a pint (with both glasses about a centimeter below full), I would have gotten one of the myriad other craft brews on tap for $5-6. We weren't super hungry, so didn't get starters. My friend had a salad and I had the Management Burger. Our food came SO QUICKLY. This might be due to the tablet ordering (and payment) system - your card never needs to leave the table. I loved the burger - it was about perfect. Great bread, great meat, toppings all worked well, came with fries.  We hung out a while, chatting over beers, after our meals. There is a nice lively ambience here. There are screens with sports showing all the time, but they were unobtrusive enough. Some sound masking could make it even more pleasant.  Overall, a decent experience. I think I'll be back!

TaXX6wUNj1qPCqXX9OrAQg.text: Food was okay - not terrible, but nothing to rave about. Not very kid friendly. They have a kids menu - but the Mac n cheese was gourmet Mac n cheese.  My kid is happy with Kraft. If they don't want kids there don't offer a kids menu. Atmosphere is nice and great beer selection.

axpVsYd7FVf-toN_yMtHEg.text: This is not the best burger in Pittsburgh.  That honor goes to Tessaro's, and I've never been anywhere that comes close.
