It's not the second best burger in Pittbsurgh, which is probably Burgatory.  It would be a tough argument to make for number three, but I think it deserves consideration in the top five and easily beats out many of the places I have heard mentioned as having top five burgers like BRGR and Eleven.  The burgers are juicy and almost creamy.  They do a pretty good job, which most places don't, of actually giving me a real rare burger.  The topping are phenominal: great selection of high quality cheeses, great bacon and sauteed mushrooms and onions.  The bun is also good.  They also have fresh cut fries, which they do very well.  This is very important, since many places (BRGR for instnace) will hurt a good burger with fries that aren't fresh cut.  Also, if you are carb or health conscious, you can get your burger with a side salad, which I've done before.  Their salads are nothing special, but they use good field greens with a nice balsamic vinagrette.  The salad was only greens, which I thought was a fine complement to the burger.  I really like the Industry Public House Copper Ale, which they presumably brew themselves.  At $4 it's a fair price for a good craft beer.  I like the atmosphere, but the chairs are defenitely a little uncomfortable--Henry Clay Frick would not have been happy with having to sit on them.  When I was there last they had many televisions, but not one was playing the Buccos game!  I asked our waitress, who was very nice and receptive to my request, and the game came on several of the televeisions in a matter of minutes!

X8vnBPNRptslS5gl9hsKcQ.text: Had a great experience dining here on a recent visit to my hometown. Really nice looking place - lots of space, very cool design that manages to look modern and industrial yet still welcoming. Attentive and friendly service from start to finish of the meal. Lots of delicious cocktails and a respectable beer menu. All the food was great and very reasonably priced for the quality.

eilROxg9Lehh7uwmuUjHhg.text: The food is good, drinks are unique, decor is interesting, but it is very loud and dark.  I'm all for a dimly lit dinner, but I had to use my phone to read the menu.

K1DyaujXPagyLTId9j2e7A.text: Industry Public House is never a bad fallback option for whatever your plans are, and I don't mean that as a backhanded compliment. It might not always be my first choice for a meal or night out, but you can never go wrong with it. It's a good fit for lunch, dinner, or a night of drinks with friends. The ambience is casual and in keeping with the neighborhood. The menu is diverse, but the emphasis is pub food or comfort food. I've tried multiple dishes and never regretted one. It will get crowded, but it's a big place that can generally accommodate the flow of people. For drinks, their beer selection is always fantastic, and if you're a whiskey drinker, be sure to try their signature cocktail, the smokestack (your choice of whiskey infused with smoke from one of three types of wood chips). Again, not always my first choice, but a worthwhile Lawrenceville staple.

osRawFYKsHZwK76fICPbrg.text: Decent bar in Lawrenceville. Its a pretty big place and can get crowded as the night goes on. I like the Tesla's coil cocktail. For the slightly grungy/industrial atmosphere and the crowded impersonal bar it was a little pricey; cocktails ranged from $9-$12. Tried both a loaded fry appetizer and a flatbread. Both were just ok.   A decent go to bar but nothing special and a little expensive for what it is.

WT4pEMFKXN0_JwXSTTmKiA.text: Great beer selections - 40 to choose from!  Very cool ambience, lots of natural light, exposed brick, beautiful.

Utz1BKh_E8pYhxUiDjknRw.text: Walked in with 7 people 3 kids. Was told we could be seated in 45 minutes checked at 30 minutes and at 40 minutes. Walked in after 40 minutes and was told we could not be seated (at all) watched at least 20 people walk in and they were given tables that clearly could have been pushed together. Horrible customer service!! We were standing right in front of the restaurant they could have come out and talked to us at any time but clearly were hoping we'd go away.

wV6N7yVMcsJ1kjHwQvvv6w.text: I came here for lunch with a large group, and the staff was friendly and accommodating even when we were coming late. It wasn't busy for lunch on a Saturday, and I suspect they do more business after hours because it's a bar, and Lawrenceville is a hip spot for bars. Anyway, the beer list was pretty extensive (as a pub should be), and the food had high aspirations. I and a few others ordered the pumpkin pierogies, and I'm sad to say that they were over priced for what you get and under-delivered on flavor.  A few ladies opted for one of the mac and cheese bowls, and those seemed to be universally liked. (Massive portions on that, too.) Overall, it was a fine experience.  Not something I would go out of my way to visit in this area, but not opposed to going again if other more interesting options aren't available.

kt1ts7py-dmmj7_XOpUfJA.text: Went here for ipa drafts and quick bite on Valentine's Day . The woman who seated us was also our waiters food runner . Told my waiter I wanted absolutely no mayo or mayo based products on my plate . The hostess brought me my fish sandwich and there was tartar sauce on the plate . I handed her the little silver cup of the mayo based sauce and watched her walk it back to the kitchen . She then proceeded to tell the Chefs "something " , I was too far away to hear what , but then I saw her turn around and look at me and snicker and give me a shitty look ..... which was so unnecessary by the way . I did nothing wrong . Stop being pissy to your customers .  I will come back here but definitely keeping an eye on her if she's working .dark curly hair and dark fraimed glasses .

wV9hLNrrRjRDEPIiREHzwg.text: Took my husband here last night for dinner at 930pm and regretted it the moment we approached the hostess desk. It took THREE hostesses to finally seat us. Mind you, there were maybe 15 cars in the parking lot and a sea of empty tables once inside. The first hostess bopped by, made eye contact and asked how many...then walked away, and never returned. Then, another girl appeared who eventually turned out to be our server and again asked how many while she stood there staring at her chart. Finally, the third girl approached and AGAIN asked how many. The two girls stood there and proceeded to talk...not caring that we were within ear range and it was coming off as we were an inconvenience to the entire staff for coming in. I at one point asked them if they were closing soon because it was apparent they did not care about our business and would rather us go elsewhere. She assured us that they were no where near closing and took ad to the smallest table in the restaurant. Rewind to when I said the hostess was our waitress...well, we sat and waited after our hostess sat us to only return later as our waitress.  To get to the point: husband ordered a side salad and a handheld. I ordered the coconut shrimp. Everything took awhile to come out and came out together. Husband was a little turned off that he had to eat the sandwich first so it didn't get cold. The bread was burnt on the edges and hard to chew, it had the thinnest layer of horseradish sauce you could imagine and the blandest shaved beef we have ever tasted. The coconut shrimp was borderline burnt and tasted like the furthest thing from coconut, the plantains tasted like they were oil soaked,and the summer couscous-very poor quality if we are being honest. I will not be back unless it's just for the drafts as they seem to a lot to offer!

ROAfaKyK-nf_cz4kx66ebA.text: After a long day of flights from California to Pennsylvania, we were STARVING. My aunt and uncle moved to a hip part of town that is walking distance to bars and restaurants. We had options but of course we opted for the burger joint.  We ordered drinks first. I wanted the ruby ruby ruby but they said it was discontinued ... remove it from the menu please!! Instead I ordered the transformer per the waiters recommendation. It was a lavender drink, with gin, came with a side of some yellow liquid which I poured into the drink itself. It went from dark purple -- to pink! It was good! And pretty :) Totally made up for the unavailable drink on the menu ....   I ordered a burger, duh. The blast pig burgher -- well done. It had delicious candied bacon, candied jalapeno, caramelized onion, fried zucchini. BOMB. the patty was fat! And the bun was buttery .. just the way I like it. I ordered sweet potatoes fries instead of regular. They were good too but I cannot say I've ever had bad sweet potatoes fries.   Service was ok. Took a while to order :/ not by choice.   I would come back next time I'm in town :)

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blast Pig Burgher // sweet potato fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Transformer

0x0_OcVgBBB_e_s0SVVrgA.text: This is a neat place. Very, very trendy and industrial - go figure. Our waiter was very caring. He wasn't annoying, just actually down to earth and cared. Seemed like a friend. But hey, anyone that serves me food is a friend of mine.   The water comes in a cute carafe.   The fried pickles but had an odd amount of vinegar for my personal liking.   I did like the prime rib sandwich. I liked the horseradish on it.   Sauerkraut was not that good, FYI.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gQ8YNmJxSZLB3yzOu2eV-g.text: Incredibly slow service. There was no bartender most of the time. I Was Charged for the  wrong beer, but couldn't even find a bartender to complain to.

VnE76z5nUA5AsGes8rPTUg.text: I came to Industry Public House on a Friday around 6:15. I immediately noticed how warm and rustic the appearance was which I love. We were seated immediately and told our waiter would be there soon. He quickly brought over our waters and introduced himself. We had told him that we were on a tight schedule and had to be out by 6:50 and he was so understanding of that. He immediately put our order in and also made the kitchen aware that we were on a time crunch. Our waiter even brought over our checks & boxes before the food came out to speed up the process. We waited maybe 12 minutes and our food showed up. Everything was right and wonderful! I had ordered the Fish & Chips and I was so taken aback by how big this piece of fish was! The dish came with a side of fries and coleslaw with a piece of fish. The fries aren't my favorite but they're ok! The coleslaw was finely shredded which I love. The fish was so crispy on the outside and nicely cooked on the inside. The sauce that came with it was phenomenal!  Overall, I was impressed with our service, how quick and attentive to our needs our waiter was, and how delicious the food was! I definitely will be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cNO86SZatl-ApWryf1BxwQ.text: Industry is a nice compromise; it's where I take my parents when I want a good beer, and they want food they'll recognize that isn't "too trendy". They often complain that it's too loud, and indeed sometimes it is, but they'll keep coming back with me since there's decent burgers, wraps, and fries. The food is fine, I've definitely had better elsewhere - but I've also had worse.  The drinks make it worth it, and the fries are good.  Last time I was there, on a Tuesday, the wait for food after ordering was over 35 minutes (dropping it down to 3 stars from 4)... I probably would take a break and not come back for a while.. but I'm sure it'll be the only place I'll get my family to agree on for our next family outing.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Falafel wrap

RF25UwikZojp7DRPxo-aVw.text: I've had multiple terrible experiences here.  The service is so poor that the food is not even worth it.  I will say that the food is good, although slightly overpriced.  The happy hour specials are really good.  Still not worth it.    On one occasion I came with a group of seven people, 3 of which were in from out of town.  It was a nice day and the windows were open.  We got seated next to the windows, which was perfect for our group.  We had all planned on catching up over drinks and lunch.  Drinks were ordered and in front of us, then we placed out food orders.  At this point, a person (who never introduced herself or who she was) came over and asked us to move our whole table in the middle of our dining experience.  She had stated that they had a reservation at this table who had requested to sit near the windows.  If that were the case, then she should not have sat us here to begin with.  I stated that no, we would not pack up our whole table, drinks, belongings and move to another table.  This is incredibly rude that she would have the audacity to even ask.  She had left, then our server came up to us and apologized and asked if we would like to speak to a manager about our experience.  I told her that yes we would.  The manager never came over.    On another occasion, my partner and I decided to go to industry for drinks and dinner during happy hour.  We sat at the bar, which actually was maybe only 1/4 full because we got there right at the beginning of HH.  We started with drinks and a flatbread which were on happy hour pricing, but had intended on each of us getting an entree.  So we received our drinks and our flatbread was delivered by a food runner.  The bartender did not make eye contact for the whole time we were sitting there until our drinks were finished and our flatbread was gone.  We could not get his attention to put in our food order.  He then proceeded to ask if we wanted our check.  He never came to get our dinner order, another round of drinks, or even to ask if our flatbread was okay.  We cashed out and went somewhere else for dinner.  There are other countless occasions where the service is just awful.  Unfortunately this place is in our backyard, so we've gone there too many times.  I don't recommend it to anyone.

g1Xz3wqmq2hRkCa4eVoFNg.text: When I've been to this bar for a sit down dinner I always had pretty good service. This time I was with friends at the bar. It was a Saturday night, so it was fairly crowded. But they seemed well-staffed with 3 bartenders at the main bar. After we ordered our first beer we were completely ignored for the next hour or so. The 2 female bartender mainly stayed at one end of the large bar. They continued serving the same group over and over, and didn't even look at our end where 5-10 guys sat with empty glasses for an hour. Tried waving and even asking, but they didn't bat an eye and walked past us just to run bills for the patrons at the other end. 3 bartenders only attending to one corner of a packed bar? C'mon. That's why I left "ZERO" as my tip on the one beer I guess I was fortunate to get.

wfLd8Ru5L-Y0V18Xx8yaNQ.text: I'm glad this isn't my first time here. The hostess looked pissed off and didn't even greet us. The service basically sucked. We sat at the bar and waited at least 10 minutes to be acknowledged. Then the beer we ordered had kicked and we waited a while before being told. And when we asked about it we were told it had kicked but did we want another beer. Let me think...yes, I'm at a bar and ordered a beer... Of course I want another beer. Then we were done eating at least 20 minutes with no one ever asking how things were. Empty beer glasses apparently aren't a clue that we might want more. Very Disappointed

izkkr4UNJzFKBhKe22vMZg.text: This place has giant portions! I definitely didn't expect to get so much food. They also have a lot of choices in alcoholic beverages. The kitchen does take a while before they get to your order, but the service is pretty good. The food is a typical American pub style food. It's nothing out of the ordinary other than the size. It's Definitely a place for groups during happy hour. We ordered a pretzel, nachos, fries and food. The pretzel was literally bigger than my face! It was cool since it also came with 3 dripping sauces: mustard, cinnamon sugar, and something else. They also have vegetarian options so your friends with food restrictions can pop by too. My opinion is that this place seems to be a popular trendy restaurant where young people meet and bond over beer on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hKobVr3qyjh3oYBLhtP7Mw.text: I always stop at Industry for happy hour before I go to my barber down the street. I always vary my drink choice, because they have a nice beer selection on tap and a pretty solid bourbon selection. However, with the happy hour special being half off flat breads, I always get the Buffalo Mac and Cheese Flatbread. I have always received great service every time I've been to Industry and it's never been too crowded. I usually stop by on a weekday around 5:00-6:00. What intrigued me the most about Industry was their Smokestack drink. If you are going to try one of these, make sure you get a mid-lower end bourbon. The smokiness is definitely interesting and they have a variety of different wood chips that add different flavors. Give it a try if you're a bourbon person.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Moscow Mule on draft
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoke Stack with Four Roses Single Barrel, smoked with Pecan wood chips

JiOVVI4zIPrCttuskUczag.text: So good!!! This place was so good!! It was packed early on a Saturday. The hostess was NOT helpful at all. Luckily I took it upon myself to find a seat at the bar, and I am so thankful because I would have missed out on a really good time had I not.  My whiskey and coke was made well. I love how it's not the typical bartenders there. Both my bartenders were men, and they knew how to mix drinks. I saw them lighting drinks on fire, finely peeling oranges, shaking up margaritas..I was impressed.  The nachos. Oh my, those nachos were some of the best I've had in my life! I was thrown away. I would absolutely recommend any group or single going to this establishment to try out their nachos. My goodness. So good. The couple next to me saw mine, and decided on some oftheir own... They also thought they were yummy. The pico de Gallo they put on it, by itself, is just so delicious. This place got it right! It deserves the business it gets.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yum!

VbRtB4cwNpmB2r3wpS8zgg.text: Industry is a really unique place in Lawrenceville, known for its wide variety of available whiskey's. I have been on multiple occasions for both drinks and food and have been pleased each time.  The space itself is quite large, but it fills up quickly in the evenings and especially on weekends. Recently, we went to celebrate my birthday and had to leave as the wait to be seated for dinner was over one hour at 7pm. Not ideal, but understandable. For a night out, the bar can become very crowded very quickly and it can be difficult to find seating.   The food is excellent and their apps are filling. Nachos are the way to go for something that pleases everyone.  I visited for lunch as well and was not disappointed in their Bloody Mary's! The drink selection is unique and not your typical mixed beverage. It can be a bit pricey but worth it to try a few of them.

6bjmMUDomXxjocwBuMpkXg.text: Industry's doorman and management are subpar at best. My party and I are all 22 years old, have been of age for more than a year, and they would not take one of our members ID's. The manager and the doorman were very rude and unprofessional, the doorman was on a power trip, and refused our business. We have been here 15-20 times, spent countless dollars, and tonight they have lost our business forever. Thanks for notj

Aq0V7TTmbSn67E3hW-GYYg.text: I'm not sure exactly what it is about places like this that attract me to them. Oh wait, I DO know exactly what it is. They serve craft beer - in large quantities and with a huge selection!! Over 40 on tap and I'm in heaven sitting there staring at the varied taps, trying to decide what I need next. Notice I said NEED, not want. Yeah, I need. And they fulfill my need quite well here! With their own Industry Public House IPA (YUM!) and a great mix of East End drafts, it's hard for me to get too far down the row of taps.  I know they have imaginative cocktails but I don't go there - I do beer. Period. So my review can't address those amazing sounding concoctions that others have referred to in their reviews. I trust they're accurate. But I can tell you that the beer is awesome. And, the atmosphere is so cool! HUGE central bar, brick walls, amazing space indeed. Hard not to love it there. And the food? Oh yes, I've certainly indulged! All that drinking tends to make me hungry! Sure, they have the expected selection of wings, build to order nachos,  even chorizo and jalapeno chili. Great salads and terrific sandwiches including a tasty shaved ribeye. But their "burghers" are what I gravitate to. And yum, they are awesome with some unusual topping choices. Want wild boar bacon? No problem. How about brussel sprouts, bacon and gorgonzola? You got it! I love the Outsourced Burgher with habanero jack cheese, roasted pablano and jalapeno peppers with some tasty lime aioli - you won't be sorry.  Love this place!

dh_sHfY7uRvgb0BNrRpF0g.text: I love this place!! The ambience on weekends is great and the food is very good too. I would give it 5 stars if the service was better but delay is kinda expected with that many people. Try the Steakhouse burger, it was gooood! Also, they have a couple of rooms that I think can be used for private partys.

g9e0sj9vTcyAaOUR5eW7Qw.text: Decent food, lots of beer options. The salads are my favorite - good portions and homemade dressings. Also love the cheese fries. It can get packed on Friday and Saturday nights with the late night crowd, so this is not a place to sit down and eat past 8pm on the weekends.

6S31JRvf5SqUx_qb3aVsMA.text: Fun place with great atmosphere. Gf got some stellar beers and I got a strange concoction called healing hands that had a foam top with activated charcoal!

_ANUCz1n3xu0IBsy2NlxLw.text: I would say that the food here was average. The waiter took about half an hour to get our drinks. The best dish I had at this place was the bread pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken nachos
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Farmed out burger with fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bread pudding

RDQX0U3pcjIdWm7UZT1t0g.text: This was not an amazing experience for my family. I'll start of with the good. The French fries and the side of fruit were probably the best. We ordered the nachos that were pretty good. Very messy but pretty delicious. Unless you like spicy, order it without the jalapenos they were super spicy! My brother got an amazingly small crab cake sandwich. It was delicious but a bit small. My mother got a chicken salad sandwich, it was a bit big but came with a side of fresh delicious fruit. Here comes the worst, I got the master lunch grilled cheese. It has Ramona, Muenster, and Parmesan cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, bacon chutney, and a balsamic vinegar. I know what you're thinking, mmmmmm or delicious, me too,but nope. I ordered it without balsamic vinegar and was excited for it. When it came out it had no bacon chutney and a lot of balsamic on it. We sent it back and everything was okay. But when came out again I tasted it but nothing tasted right. I set it aside and my mom tasted it and said it was okay but when my dad tasted it he really did not like it. Now for the service. Spoiler, it was terrible. We were there almost 3 hours, we sat there waiting for a waitress to get our drink orders for about 10 minutes. When we finally ordered them we said we were ready to order and the waitress said okay and then just walked off. When she came back she took our orders and then we said that we needed more water, she said okay then walked off without our glasses.my dad got up with his drink glass and then my dad got up and filled up his glass himself. After that I got up to go to the restroom. There are windows in there so people can see you. They also had cracks in the bathroom sinks so water would drool out of them. This was a 1 star experience and I would rather not go there again.

NDnd_PwUApfq2CnprGp6Xg.text: Got a terrifying bout of food poisoning here. Never. Again.

95owqoJo9QkTK2TJzVJHqA.text: It's cool.  A few $ but it was worth it.  Met the hottest dude I've ever seen there, so 5 stars.

nilCO4CmuQBLnbERTv87zA.text: I think it's hard to find a GOOD salad in the Burgh ... This place serves some good salad.  Highly recommended.

4Rs37lzARUW95DG9Uj7CbQ.text: Great food!  It's reasonable priced too.  I highly suggest their burgers.  They have some other creative dishes like buffalo chicken flatbread you might want to try.  Or the pumpkin beer with brown sugar on the rim of your cup.  Better yet, check online to see which of your favorite beers are on tap before you come!!

G5DZS30-eDeuEZvdbHRU3Q.text: Hipster Lawrenceville strikes again! I actually consider this place a 3.5, but yet again yelp has not made half stars an option (hint hint). I ordered the burger with cheese, an egg and bacon. Some places call it the farmers burger or the good morning burger, but no matter what you call it, this is all time favorite burger combo of mine and it's always interesting to see what different places do with it. Kind of a Pepsi/Coke cola challenge if you will. It was good, but I could have been sitting in Dive or Yard and had the same experience. They say the bacon is wild boar or something, but it just tasted like bacon.  The BF ordered the smoke stack sandwich and it was very good. It's a ribeye sandwich with arugula and horseradish, and I HATE horseradish, but I would totally order this sandwich next time. The arugula and horseradish gave it an interesting bite. I got the regular fries with mine, but he upgraded to the pot roast fries. Now, anyone who has read any of my reviews know I am a French fry elitist. And hand cut are always, always the best. These were hand cut but I found them to be a bit weird. They were kind of thick and dry. The BF's were better because of the pot roast, but because of my intense French fry love, they were docked 3/10s of a point or so. (a nod to the Olympics!)  Our waiter seemed newish and it was so cute to see how hard he was trying. And for the record, he was great. The prices were on par with similar establishments as well. A word of advice though, if you go try to get a table in the front window. The people watching is awesome; it is Lawrenceville after all.

aL9sg0gBL5RB7NqYNwDLjA.text: Like the concept and the Smokestack is off the chain! Went with Rye, Maple, a little orange. The flair of the bartender was perfect!  Had the pot roast fries and lots of savory flavor. It's pub/new American/not really gastro here and food came out   Lots of late 20's/30's here, so when in Steel City this place is definitely worth a visit. I would come back with friends at happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YJAf8pIooR7diUOqRE5w3Q.text: Went to Industry with a large group on a Thursday night- the place was packed. They were very kind in finding us a table and service was quick. The waitress was helpful with telling what is gluten free on the menu- if you' have celiacs I don't recommend going. There were a few drink options that were gluten free too. The atmosphere is on the loud and cramped side, but we enjoyed it. I highly recommend the nachos- enough to feed a crowd!

99gTMiH3DIJ0KHE0e3G_qw.text: Excellent draft list. Very good food. Priced right for a stellar happy hour.  My only complaint about this place is how crowded it gets, and how the layout of the place fosters the idiocy of humanity. Those are waitresses, people. Get TF out of their way and don't block the dang walkway to the restrooms.

ahFIpTSq55QJi8mVknm6hQ.text: 5 stars for the restaurant itself and 0 for the service. I've never had worse service in my life. It was as if the guy had never waited before. He didn't bring us napkins, silverware, get water, refills, etc. just Pathetic. The place itself is pretty sweet. I'd give it another shot to see if service gets better. So far, Yelp reviews seem to Be on point.

30LP983wQM_gpImW2E7LHg.text: My mom and I discovered this place as we were walking along in Lawrenceville. We gave it a chance, and man was I blown away. We started with the parmesan truffle popcorn. Super light and delicious. for her entree, my mom got the steak salad. The salad dressing, a tomato vinaigrette, was super delicious, and the greens were very fresh. I got a pulled pork sandwich, and it was the best I'd ever had. The BBQ sauce was a little different but so delicious, and the crunchy onions added an amazing texture. The fries were good too, a lot like five guys' fries. Overall, great experience.

qO3qvQXq2soYCsqf2C-Y-g.text: This was our first time here and will likely be our last. I knew it was going to be a bad start when our waitress never wrote down our orders. Not only did she completly mess up orders, but there were time we didnt see her again for at least 20 minutes. We had to flag down passing waiters and waitresses to correct her mistakes.   Its really sad because the food is really good here but the service was horrible!

DTE489cgrJBAgRkbKy3hdg.text: Great atmosphere and drink menu! Food was great...wings were incredible! Juicy and obviously not frozen. Wait staff was decent...but slow. Will definitely go back.

4QFmxfSrfqdAUh_-lspfcA.text: Stopped in for happy hour in the middle the week between Christmas and New Year's and was able to find a seat at the bar without waiting. Bartender approached us right away, but we waved him off while we perused the large draft selection. At the right time another bartender came over and provided some samples to aid in our selection. As it was happy hour for food, too, I ordered an "Entry Level Burger" that came out exactly how I ordered - rare. The fries, though good, seemed to be from the bottom of the bag of frozen fries as there were lots of little pieces and bits mixed in.  Will definitely go again!

qycM-46fTqAKqdu5JVEecA.text: There's better places to go in town. There's people shooting up in the bathroom and whatever song you play on the jukebox there's a obese bartender who comes over and skips your song. I'd rather get an IV with a rusty nail than come back

UokVIoE03bRvRE5BnpdWXQ.text: This place is great for a relaxed atmosphere and is usually not too crowded. I recommend the Blast Pig Burgher or the Presidents Salad - both are really good. Tons of beers on tap, and of course, the whiskey list can't be beat.

jz1iKTz7UmJNNc-xI2yvkA.text: Visited here for a paint nite event, loved the paint nite.. Just not the bartenders we had before the event. The woman barely said two words to us. She acted like it was a chore to serve us (hello that's your job). She didn't even give me a total for my drink, she just threw the receipt at me and walked away. If it wasn't for the paint nite I would've left right then and there. The food smelled and looked delicious, but I would NEVER go back due to the the lack of friendliness from the bartenders.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The drinks were pretty good though! Alabama slammer and Rhuby Rhuby Rhuby

lQkfQQgpYh9lyTfVhl49Sw.text: I have wanted to eat at industry for awhile now and finally had the opportunity to this afternoon for lunch. We sat at the bar And waited a good ten minutes before being acknowledged but honestly we were not in a hurry so although I don't think that's great customer service, we were not going to make a big deal of it. We both ordered the industry IPH (it's an IPA) which priced at 4.50 is one of the cheapest (and strongest) beers on the menu. If you like IPAs I'd highly recommend trying this. As for the atmosphere I really dug the industrial vibe-the bar was a really nice stained wood and the chairs were metal and of the "modern" look. As for food we shared two flat breads- the BBQ chicken and the buffalo Mac and cheese. My boyfriend ALso had a cup of the soup of the day-loaded potato. When he asked the bartender what was In the soup she shrugged and said she didn't know but it tasted good this morning. Well he says it was very tasty but I think any server or bartender should know what's in the soup of the day. The BBQ chicken flatbread consisted of chicken, bacon, fontina, and BBQ. It was a (very small) 4 cut pizza which is why we then ordered another pizza to split. And yes I'd categorize these as pizzas and not flatbreads as advertised. Although small it was tasty and each piece was loaded with ingredients. The buffalo Mac And cheese pizza consisted of buffalo sauce, buffalo chicken, and Mac And cheese. It was not overly spicy but had a nice kick . The Mac And cheese was excellent. Each of the 4 pieces was rich with ingredients. While this was also tasty nothing we had was really memorable . I'd like to come back and try some of their sandwiches or a burger. Also we saw someone getting a smoke stack while we were getting ready to leave and it looked very interesting- whiskey, various flavors, then smoked with wood chips. I'd give this place another try but I'm not rushing back.

VR3_DLMScj1_dktdKc7aeQ.text: I've eaten here twice.  The first time I had the burger and fries.  It was excellent.  Tasty and cooked perfectly.  I had a martini that was ok, nothing special.  I recently moved from San Francisco to Pittsburgh and until I had that burger had been unimpressed with the food.  Today I had a Bloody Mary that tasted more of hot pepper than anything else.  Other than the picante, it was bland.  I ordered the pot roast.  It came layered with a gloppy gravy on the bottom, then bland mashed potatoes, followed by bland, slightly dry pot roast all topped with crispyish onions.  Typically pot roast is cooked in its own juices and I was expecting that over the meat and potatoes.  On top of everything, the service was quite slow especially considering that the place wasn't very full.  I hope the burger is more representative of the food at industry rather than the pot roast.  Not sure if I'll eat here again.

_A5vHoFRXBcmBertTQgoRg.text: I'm very excited for their expansion plans! They are absorbing the property next door and adding a second bar and grill.    I had the brie flat bread with mushrooms and fresh basil on top and it was really decadent!  The drink menu is very impressive. My friend got the smoke stack which is really cool because they light bacon flavored wood chips on fire in front of you, if you sit at the bar. Then they mix the bourbon or whiskey with it and filter out the liquid. It gives your drink a smoky, bacon flavor.

a_IHkh2mMe-capCkEqWTpw.text: The beer selection is obviously the featured attraction, and the cocktail list is also massively impressive. Most users on here have elaborated much about the menu.   For Lawrenceville, it's a very modern and mainstream bar experience. There are about 6 flat panels, and all were showing sports when I was there on a Saturday night. The clientele is very un-Larryville as well. I find none of this to be a problem, but it's certainly not the typical "hipster" experience many think of having on Butler St. The staff and feel try to replicate that of an off-kilter place, but at it's heart, IPH is a very nice bar that almost feels out of place.

xAq91_C4hWsp3EEKiX8PiA.text: Great beer list. Check. Great whiskey list. Check.  Amazingly creative whiskey cocktail. Check.  Finger-licking burgers. Check. Nachos that use real cheese and no cheese sauce. Check.   Are you in yet? This is a great bar with upscale bar food. If you like bourbon you definitely must try the Smoke Stack. It's an absolute show stopper.   I've tried many of the new burgers joints in town. My favorite is Wingharts but industry comes in second for me - over others like BRGR and Burgatory. The Farmhouse is my go-to. I always love a burger with an egg on top.   Other tip in food - the nachos are made with real cheese, not nacho cheese sauce. This is always a big one for me.  Lastly - on the ambiance and decor. It gets really loud in there so be ready for that if you are on a date. Some tables it can be hard to have a conversation at.   And second, I really like the industrial decor and exposed brick. They've for a great setup for TVs if you are trying to watch a game.

NeRQZw8x51s7BEP-lZh8zQ.text: Great bar!  Went with friends for Pens game.  DO NOT run a tab if standing near the bar!!  You have to wait forever for your tab,  and for the 2nd time this week it was wrong!!!  Not one single drink was correct, but they did charge my card anyways.  Talked to the hostess who just asked if my tab was lower than I thought, and if it was be happy!!!   Only been open a couple weeks so far, but never going to last charging people wrong tabs!!!  Worst of all there just seems to be no manager in charge to talk too.

S2JHiJ7nt0patdD2LQ5VrQ.text: I thought this place was good. Loved the atmosphere. Although we went through three people before we were seated. Our waitress was very attentive. The food was very good. I had the 9th ward salad, the salmon was perfectly cooked, it was delicious. My husband had a turkey sandwich on thick Texas bread, he said it was also good. We will definitely return.

a7M-UcBH40cZE7f83kozfQ.text: My husband and I traveled to Industry looking for dinner, but we arrived during happy hour so decided to go for the specials.  We shared veggie tacos and a nacho plate, which were just "meh."  The nachos had fresh jalapenos on them and were SO spicy.  They were good, but nothing special.  Same with the tacos...just ok.  The drinks were worth coming back for, but not really on special for happy hour.  (That's weird, right?)  The husband had a smokestack, which is so cool--they actually infuse smoke into whiskey with a flaming wood chip.  (Don't try this at home, kids.)  I had the Industrialist, a cherry-infused bourbon, which tasted mostly of regular old bourbon to me.  I wouldn't get it again.  We'd definitely go back for drinks, probably not to eat--and next time, I'm SO getting that cake drink.  It looked amazing at the table next to me!

L1lP3YF0J9x56xbZ_meulQ.text: Stopped in for lunch and a beer with my wife. Draft beer was good, they have 60 on tap. That was the highlight. Service was very poor. Our waitress seemed busy despite not being very crowded. She was making very little effort to hustle and offered no apologies. She never once asked us if everything was okay nor asked if we needed anything. (We actually needed more drinks, more napkins, and more ranch) by the time we saw her again, we were pretty much ready to go. Perhaps they are under-staffed, and lack experienced management and wait staff. Our wings were served cold and were average at best. The manager ( or at least who we thought might be the manager) seemed to be walking around doing nothing. Hopefully they make some significant strides because I was hoping to make this a frequent stop as a local beer connoisseur.

rtKtHe26yZ72pzfxm_r4hA.text: We stopped in on a Saturday afternoon and it was pretty empty. My friends and I decided to share some of the food and ordered the shrooms flatbread and fries with blue cheese and truffle oil. The shrooms flatbread had the right amount of mushrooms and goat cheese and the argula on top cut through the creaminess of the cheese. The blue cheese and truffle oil combination was great with the fries. I also loved the feel of the place and the decor made me feel like I was in a speak-easy. The only one downside of my excellent experience was the service. My waitress was not attentive at all even though there weren't that many people there and took a long time to bring our check over.

4LUJAkxDCHEgoywejSP-ig.text: Went for lunch.  Interesting and appealing bar atmosphere.  Good & diverse beer selection!  Had the candied bacon as an app:  you can never go wrong with bacon!  Had the Rust Belt Ribeye, which is more than a meal.  I would order it again, but only after I try a few more items on the menu that caught my eye.  I want to go back and try the infused spirits and bourbons!  Cant wait to visit IPH again.

NWJ5xv1GvTR1EcBQLCFF5A.text: Interesting place in Lower Lawrenceville.  Good beer selection and decent food.  Nothing special though in terms of scene or character.  Seems like it has lost its character as it has grown.

kHPg0iIp0GK9o0mb80N3Ww.text: I unabashedly love Industry. Candied bacon? One of the best beer lists in town? Hipster Mecca? What could be better? It's a very chill vibe with a good menu and a younger crowd which is a nice change from some of the other good foodie places in town which attract the over 50 crowd en masse. Parking can be tough in Lawrenceville so give yourself extra time there. Recently brought a bunch of friends from out of town and they LOVED it. Will definitely be back ASAP.

8TiGL142HkSPFdYHmgU8tA.text: Came in for dinner. Food was excellent ordered a burger..and the green pepper soup..delicious. Drink selection was abundant

oW0mZ7TdPd8HePTUUDE_Jw.text: Still a solid 4 stars at Industry.  I had the Cluck House and I was nervous about the combination of pear, raspberry jalapeno jam, confit chicken, but it was done perfectly.  Fantastic beer selection, only thing keeping it from a 4 star was the sometimes longer than usual wait for your drink and the fact that the side salad I got with my sandwich was literally just lettuce.  Really, just lettuce and dressing.  For some reason this really bugged me.

z0FFN7hUce7Dh5VZkhhMQA.text: Nice to lawrenceville aside from the occasional obnoxious drunk-and-wild on a Saturday night crowd, this place is perfect for a good meal and cocktail during the week. any burger or item with bacon can't go wrong here.

O53bv9EaADVlA60icwbZDA.text: I ordered fish and chips. My girlfriend ordered a smoke stack. Everything was pretty bland, the food was cold but we were in a large group. The chili cheese fries were tasted like they didn't season it at all. Overall I wouldn't come here to eat anything, the drinks were good and so was the service.

h0lXFGiG1NuQMGTIh6ZuUQ.text: Very impressed with the atmosphere, drink selection, and (most importantly) the food. The roasted chicken breast was some of the freshest chicken I've ever had. A+ Industry, it's been awhile since I've been blown away by a meal.

CH-1xgpYpmXsRabN0zkTxA.text: It's so big and airy...so I feel like it definitely stands out amongst the more intimate style places that you usually see in Lawrenceville.  I like the feel of this place and let me just tell you they make awesome cocktails!  I had the Menlo Park (gin based drink with rosemary) - I was blown away by how good it was and how strong it was!  Even though you could tell it was strong, the taste was well-balanced between the gin and the rosemary.  I'm giving this place 4 stars on the drinks alone b/c I was disappointed in my meal.  I had the Worker Burgher which is a fairly simple burger with caramelized onions, tomatoes, mushrooms, and cheese.  I ordered it medium-well and it was prepared exactly as ordered and with all items as stated on the menu, but it wasn't that flavorful.  Maybe I just picked a bland burger from the numerous choices on the menu...but I couldn't get over it.    I'm not much of a burger person so when I order one it has knock me off my socks to impress me.  And while you could tell the meat was quality as were the ingredients it needed something...maybe some garlic, salt, or Mrs. Dash's seasoning in the ground meat mixture, but it was screaming for flavor...or maybe that was just me screaming at myself for ordering a bland burger.  I would definitely go here again and give the food another chance, but the drinks were awesome.    Oh I forgot, we had nachos as an app...that should tell you something they were forgettable - nothing that great.

HUl7V_gNx1HtwUzGOgU5lA.text: 3.5 - Burger: very consistently cooked juicy, great bun 2.0 - Fries 2.5 - Pot Roast Sliders: Mashed potato cake? Awesome.  Pot roast could have been more tender and less dry.  1.0 - service: often quite slow,  takeout recommended, but let the fries breathe

rcfaVZRzHYHNbgdLi6KRuQ.text: Just sat. Server served us food before our drinks. Then charged both of our meals to 1 tab without asking. Then came back and did it again. Not historically awesome.

0TgnOdy_2bzUOvoc0SaXhA.text: My husband and I had a delicious meal here last weekend. The only glitch was that our server forgot to put the order in for our appetizer, so it was served while we were eating our entrees. But they didn't charge us for it.   I love the ambiance and that Arsenal cider is on the menu! The noise level was high, but our table was in a slightly quieter area, which helped. We'll be back.

1no6BGBY0-zrCBUcByJpfA.text: I came here for a drink after bowling and decided, due to the recommendation of my date, to get The smokestack. They had a very big selection of whiskeys and about 10 wood chip flavors to choose from. I am a huge fan of whiskey so I was quite excited. It was really great to watch the bartender make it right in front of me as well. The drink was delicious! So if you are a fan of whiskey I would 100% recommend you try the smokestack.

L-Np0Fx5xRRqICxDIDazSg.text: Happening place and definitely a place that Lville has been starving for (or from what it seems). The food/service is what you would find anywhere around the area and atmosphere is what you could and would find on Southside at like a Local or Fat Heads.  I would recommend the Wings and go with a dry rub... so good and crispy (with good meat on them too).   Also, the food taking a while to come out of the kitchen seems to be a constant issue with this place, but I was never going to this place for speedy service and quick turnaround on my food, so I am totally fine with it. A lot of people always there when we go and always a solid experience from service and food.

QxvycxpgpU7g6pfpdqyXUg.text: Getting kicked out as I type this. A group went out for my sisters birthday. As the party grew the waitress got more and more annoyed. The manager gave us a time limit to be here. We were all buying food and drinks. I've never been kicked out for being a patron. We were ready to drop tons of money and enjoy the night. None of us are ever coming again.

aXvkBgE1aRd8lFFf5URdSA.text: Would not recommend this place.  Staff is arrogant starting with the hostess. Does not accommodate families.

HzhcprUW_yiny6G04oBCng.text: Ate here recently. Enjoyed the candied bacon and had a great burger! Not  a huge fan of the seating. It can get loud as they pack in a lot of people at small tables.

aLRdY1RnRe-oxXZxwbtHrw.text: Great drinks and beer selection. Also a great bar to watch games at. Unfortunately the night I went, the bartenders were very rude and cold. It took them ten minutes to ask us what we wanted to drink, when the bar was half empty. When I asked about the specialty drinks the bartender rolled her eyes and vaguely explained to me what the smoke stack drink was. All in all cool bar, bad service.

ygoPXkdUe8PKxppUHZ20aA.text: I am really impressed to see a place like this pop up on butler street. It reminds me of the bar scene in Chicago. I liked the atmosphere. It's modern with lots of space and a large bar in the middle.   We ordered the outsourced burger with fries and the electric cheese with the boar bacon Brussels sprouts. The burger was ok. The electric cheese was great and the boar bacon on the sandwich and Brussels spouts were really great.   I would definitely go back.   Oh yeah - I'm not into the fancy cocktails, but the cocktail list was impressive.  My gin and gingers were generously strong.

-0uBj_MAA3bem2p-E4jdGg.text: The food here is always delicious. However, the bar staff seemed unhappy and was extremely unfriendly and unwelcoming. My co-worker and I went here on a Sunday night. We both work at a bar in the North Shore that experienced an extremely busy July 4th weekend and we were exhausted and in the search of a good meal. It was impossible to get a smile from a single employee in the building. I ordered the Rhuby drink. The first one was delicious, but the second round was much sweeter and I couldnt finish it. The Shroom flat bread was amazing. My chicken sandwich and buffalo mac & cheese was great. My friend's turkey sandwich and truffle fries were also good. But the lack of friendly or attentive service or even a simple smile was disappointing. The bar was not very busy and the half the restaurant was closed. As workers in the same industry, my friend and I are very aware and understanding of the stress of working in a bar. But I couldn't even bring myself to tip as well as I normally would because the experience was so bad.

RK3MCC_HzI6CXqO461Y1Xw.text: Came here for Valentine's Day brunch with my girlfriend. Food was mediocre and cold. $7 "speciality" house bloody Marys were flat out bad. Server was rude, inattentive, and overall poor.

CSa9JHBHo17Hqo92aIKd1A.text: This place sucks. I have had consistently poor service from snobby, shitty bartenders who would rather stand around talking shit than help a thirsty and hungry patron. Avoid this place.

O1KwjU_wbp9UTtBf2Pi9Yw.text: Just awful.  First of all, I had a terrible-tasting hamburger here. Do you know how hard it is to make a hamburger taste bad? Making them exceptional is an art, sure, but use any kind of decent beef and it'll taste good. That means they're using sub-standard beef and trying to mask it with fancy dressings.   Their cocktails are wildly overrated. Oh, so there's smoke in it? Cool - if it didn't just drift away instantly. Their draft list is impressive, but the place is so packed and loud that you can't enjoy it. The design is nonexistent, and whatever cool the brick walls and edison lightbulbs contribute is obliterated by the gigantic TVs covering every conceivable surface. Another instance of a sports bar masquerading as a gastropub, only with terrible food.  I also know it's not really fair to judge a restaurant by its clientele, but the day that Industry opened, the tenor of that stretch of Butler street changed. Now on Fridays & Saturdays it feels like the South Side, and not in a good way, with loud drunken arguments and dudes arguing over parking spots.  I will say that the staff has always been very pleasant, so good for them. But this place is the worst, and it makes me fear for the future of Lawrenceville (and Pittsburgh) when this is the kind of restaurant that succeeds here.

OvPdGiYL6KLluD-_T-OjjA.text: I've been to this place twice. And it has a New York feel to it. If any of you have ever been to a bar in NY, then you know that type of atmosphere. It's more of a chill, relax and socialize type of bar. I've only had the burgers every time I've been there and it is pretty good. especially after you've had a few drinks consumed. Drinks aren't too pricey because they are bringing in a certain atmosphere and technique to how they craft and serve their drinks. I would recommend any drink they offer where you get to watch them burn wood chips over the glass. Really cool looking and quite a unique flavor is added. Don't listen to the haters on here complaining about this spot. It's a nice place to chill.

-TaITDSy-5EFDLmfOFNsMg.text: When Industry first opened, I was excited to try it since I'd watched it being built for almost a year... My first couple of visits, I was excited by the awesome atmosphere and drink menu, but the food and drinks were a little expensive and the food was just OK - I was worried it had a little bit of a chain-like vibe, even though it's not.   But after my visit last night, I concluded that Industry is getting better with time.   I wanted to try one of the burgers, made with a veggie or turkey patty, and was disappointed to find this wasn't an option. But their menu has many other options, and I chose the Foster's Chicken sandwich. It was delicious - great flavor, juicy chicken, and wasn't too greasy. My friend got a burger, which was unique and looked great. In summary, I would describe their menu as your traditional bar-food menu with a unique twist that seems slightly healthier (or as healthy as bar food can get, I suppose) and good quality.   Our service was good, and the drinks and atmosphere are great. It's cool that they have TVs for sports, since there aren't many sports bars in Lawrenceville.  I love all the beers on tap, and they have a wine list as well as an extensive craft cocktail list and infused liquor.  Try the Carnegie Cucumber, and make sure take a bite of the gin-soaked cukes (but prepare yourself)!   I'm ready to go back already!

1l7ejyZKd6CQqQFsF4bKPA.text: Located across from arsenal  lanes.   You should be able to park on the street or nearby parking lot.   Brick walls,  metal bar stools,  decent lighting.   The bar is located in the center of the  Floor.  Tables and  booth seating along the walls, and front windows.  ladies , there are purse hooks at the bar.  Decent beer selection both domestic  and import.   I ordered pulled  pork sliders : Pulled pork BBQ on top coleslaw ( mayo based )  on little buttered rolls.  Plated up on a  mini metal speed rack tray .   If your going on Friday night you might have to wait a few minutes for seating.  I believe we had about a 20 minute wait.

H47NJs0SApQAModTLuc4KQ.text: Another night in Lawrenceville spent watching sports and this is the place to go.  They have a great beer selection and tasty menu.  The bar is huge, the seating area is spacious and there are lots of big screen TVs!  It can get really crowded so I recommend making reservations. Our waitress took about 15-20 minutes to come to our table to take our drink order however it was very crowded with many parties getting seated at the same time. She apologized profusely claiming there was a mix-up with servers and made up for it the rest of the night. The beer menu has a great selection of drafts and bottled beer. I choose Blue Point Pumpkin and the waitress was kind enough to ask if I would like cinnamon and sugar on the rim-yes please!  The menu slightly changed since my last visit and I was disappointed that they took off the pot roast sliders but a pot roast entree is still on the menu. I went with the roast beef sandwich which had gruyere cheese and came with a delicious au jus sauce and I was not disappointed!

xIUv4l_-BG4bHez_Uk4K5g.text: A group of 5 of us visited the North Fayette location on a Monday evening. Our total bill was well over 300 dollars and we spent about 5 hours in the establishment. The service and food left something to be desired. However, the waiter was still tipped over 25% on the tab as I don't believe in poor gratuity on a such a large check after being in a restaurant for that period of time.   My experience:   The restaurant wasn't busy but I wouldn't say it was slow. Our service was sub par for the first hour or so which caused us to miss the appetizer special while we waited for the rest of our party to join us. We were going to let them know about this but didn't because we typically aren't a group to complain. No big deal at this point.  Ordered a bottle of wine and a beer. No problem. Appetizers came, Pot Roast fries and Bacon. All good. Slightly salty, livable. We contained to carry on and enjoy the evening.  We were sat at an 8 person table with an initial party of 3 and then asked to move to a smaller table to free up the larger table for a larger party. We obliged but the waiter changed his mind about moving us so we stayed where we were seated. Shortly after we advised him that another couple would be joining us to make a total of 5 people so the table dilemma was over. At this point, still okay, not a big deal but maybe a little unhappy.  Service got better at this point as the crowd died down.   At this point the party of 5 is all here. We all decided on another bottle of wine a few more beers and that appetizers will be the meals of the night. We order about every appetizer on the menu.   As we get through the menu, the food quality got a little worse and much more salty. The popcorn was bad, the crab cakes were small, oily and super salty. The flat bread was good with the tomato pesto and cheese was probably the best of the bunch. We have a buffalo chicken mac n' cheese flatbread that had under cooked chicken but the manager fixed that and didn't charge us (kudos)  Our thought on the saltiness was that it was an attempt to get us to drink more... maybe?? They do have a large amount of drafts on tap.   Overall the food was very subpar and doesn't live up to the menu. The beer and spirits section was great but the knowledge of that selection by the wait staff was very subpar.   The best par of the evening was after the meal we went to the bar to try the signature cocktail. The bartender was great at explaining the different Bourbons and Whiskeys. The smoked chips were a cool little show.   My final impression: Go there for the beer/spirits, not the food. Everything was overpriced for what we received. The space was nice but the feel wasn't all that inviting, The space was not all teh friendly nor was the crowd that the restaurant seemed to draw. But then again this is a hipster kind of place with a built in too cool for you attitude.

XE7VVR7n_VbXMwCZaNzcpA.text: This place has the best food ever I had a regular burger with no cheese and it was literally the best burger I ever had! The service is great and there really nice if you want to customize your own burger. The waiters are so nice. I wish I could get a picture of my food but I already ate all of it! But seriously best burger ever and there is almost never a wait!

te-Pec53IPBt27bP4g9e-Q.text: I went here for happy hour yesterday and it was worth every penny.  Happy hour = $2 off all drafts and $6 burger ($1 xtra for cheese or bacon).   We sat at the bar and Ordered a couple of local beers.  I was glad to see that they had Grist House and East End beers on tap.  The bartending staff was very personable and made for speedy service and good conversation.   I ordered a burger which was cooked to my liking (medium).  I also had a cup of their chili which had a unique savory stout flavor to it.  My girlfriend ordered the buffalo Mac and cheese flatbread - which is a must!    Nachos and pot roast fries also looked solid.  I'll definitely be back.

ldkLYOKzE8Wz_CZyUaVFtg.text: Went for a late dinner Saturday at 9pm. Service was pretty slow and boarder line nonexistent. Our waitress walked by our table numerous times without even acknowledging our table. When she finally stopped by we asked to make sure that she was in fact our waitress. Thought maybe that would help the amount of attention we got but service continued to remain pretty pour. Forgot to put drink orders in as well.   Might try to go back since it's close to home but the whole place just felt pretty "meh".

f77FDgl3hExOzotooRlkJQ.text: My last stop in my Pittsburgh neighborhood tour while home for the holidays was this place. It is a late night spot if you want to eat and it's open until 2 am. I have to say since I have moved they have really built these neighborhoods up and this place is one of the new additions. It is a big restaurant all wood inside like a log cabin feel. We were seated immediately even though it was crowded. The only thing is it took a long time for our waitress to come to our table. The menu looked delicious and they had a lot of different dishes. From flat breads to salmon burgers. We got the chicken nachos for an appetizer and it was huge. Luckily it was three of us sharing it and it was very good. I ordered the brisket sandwich special and I wanted sweet potato fries but they ran out for the night. Which is a good sign that they make their own stuff. I was disappointed because I love my sweet potato fries!! Anyway the regular fries were good too you can tell they are made from scratch because they tasted like real potatoes. The brisket was good too but since I have moved down south I have had better brisket but this was fine for the pittsburger pallet lol. I also got a side salad which was $5 for like lettuce and a couple tomatoes not really worth it...overall a great restaurant very loud atmosphere so I would t recommend it for a first date lol

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken nacho appetizer
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brisket special pretty good!

T5dPjP-4dt9p9eYuOUxcWA.text: Service - 5 stars Food - 4 stars Experience - 2 stars  Well, I had heard about this place for some time. I was really pleased when my friends booked it for an event, and was even more impressed when our hosts "comped" us when the plans changed, thanks to the "Pittsburgh Young Professionals" overwhelmed our meager table - hey, I won't complain... I got one of their trademarked SmokeStack beverages out of the deal.  I did, however, feel bad for our server, who had to keep running around and making sure that everyone had what they had wanted and paid for - Jesus - that's a drag.  Lose the "bar" feel, and jump on the "restaurant" train. Don't let people freeload and stiff the wait staff!!! If you do, I, myself, will patronize other places with our fellows and residents, because I think it sucks to get the short end of the stick!  Strive to be better! You have a lot of positive buzz - yearn for improvement!

xVb_DPWNjBkam93YGBM_LA.text: I have tried to give Industry a shot multiple times but it just never seems to work out and I end up leaving very unsatisfied.   First time I went I sat down with a group that was already there for my sisters birthday just getting drinks, server came over once and asked what I wanted, when I said I wasn't ready to order, the server never returned and I had to go to the bar to order. Which was a feat itself.   Second time I went in, the bar was empty and I stood at the bar being ignored for 10mins while the bartenders had a lengthy conversation with another server. So I just walked out.  Third time I was dragged there by friends wanting to go there. We walk in and sit at an empty table, to be rudely told by a server that it was not ours to be had. So we walked right out the door.   I refuse to go back here and have only been told bad stories from other people that have gone.   My sister who is 26yrs old, was told her I.d. was fake and they demanded a second form of id which she gave and the bartender said that didn't work, so she even showed her debit card and they laughed at her and would not serve her.   Service alone is a reason to never come back. Never been served and i don't want to be by that staff.

EijkdrbqfTz0linf83D49g.text: Industry has a great beer selection and I'm a huge fan of their truffled gorgonzola fries and pot roast fries, both of which are half off during happy hour. Some of the servers have been a bit unfriendly, but still attentive. Weekend evenings they tend to get very crowded despite being a large bar. Definitely would recommend coming here for happy hour!

OKnpQeebKBWOtnqGUJsxHg.text: Went for drinks & appitaziers last night. The service was A+ the food was amazing. Reasonable prices.  Great atmosphere.  Can't wait to return.

dd5ox0DhuM-wjW9SS7Vk-A.text: I love going here when I am in town. I lived in Pittsburgh for 2 years, didn't frequent it too often, but as soon as I'm getting ready to move, I discover that it's one of my favorite bars. It's great at any time of the day, whether you are going in for lunch with a friend or grabbing a light night drink and snack (note: nachos are a shareable plate ... too big for one person). Highly recommend if you are in Lawrenceville!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos ... Too many not to share with your friends!

ab-8jHtMmWVmq9XtbASfmg.text: The hockey review (Penguins vs Rangers)- see our review of Piccolo Forno and Tender Bar and Kitchen (penalty box). This was not in the nyt article, however, we were fortunate to have skated over to IPH for happy hour.   Drinks: the Barrel aged Manhattan was the biscuit in the basket. Smooth like a Zamboni, big block of ice, wicked puck (luxardo cherry). This drink was the power play of the game. Seriously, if we didn't have the 17 yo with us, we'd have gone three full periods with this drink and gotten a major misconduct. Thankfully, we didn't go into overtime.   Chili cheese fries were a slapshot. Chili was quality- not that Hormel stuff.  Fries solid like the puck hitting the goalies face mask. All in all a playoff win. No joke.

hnFh8Nt-tsJyvFMzOc5epw.text: Love this place, even though I've only been twice  (so far!). Take your time perusing the menu; it's got lots of hidden gems. I suggest ordering the popcorn with truffle oil to munch upon while you decide what else to order!

eghumnZ3FjrUsZj9-8GMZg.text: I was really happy with this place.  I came in around dinner on Sunday. The place is beautiful, and it was so clean.  It felt like I stepped into a cozy Lodge somewhere. We were seated quickly, and received friendly service right away.    I love how they do menus, it's super unique but clear and concise.  The selection was great, but I was feelin' Mac and cheese. The way they serve water us really unique - it's in a big glass bottle for you to open and refill as desired. The meal came out very quickly, and it was delicious. The gouda really shines, but what makes it special is the crispy onions on top. I don't even like onions, or much vegetables- generally they're the last thing eaten, and begrudgingly. These were so light and crisp, they were a perfect addition to an already yummy dish.   Price is also reasonable, with the Mac and cheese at 12, so in all we have a unique experience, tasty food, and a good price. My wedding anniversary is next month- I'm going to start dropping hints. :)

eJIemrdhgmLR9LVPrBx4nw.text: I really want to like this place, but, until they get their crap together, I will stick to establishments with faster service, food that is delivered hot, and better service. 20 minutes to pay my check? Really?

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Decent scotch selection...

JY1NDqJAjYrdmNOnx23FvA.text: Such an awful experience.  I am actually appalled by the lack of respect displayed by the staff.  First, we had a reservation accepted earlier in the week for Saturday.  We're told when we arrived they had no record of our reservation.  We asked to be placed on the list.  Went to the bar to wait.  Wait staff spilled a beer one of our guest.  We had to ask for a towel to clean her up.  They walked away and did not offer to refill the drink they spilled on her.  When we asked for a refill they were very hesitant.  One wait staff member spoke up and said she saw the other spill it.  So we moved to the other bar on the other side of the restaurant.  Went to check on our seat and saw they moved past us on the list and never called our phone like they said they would.  I asked for the manager and was told he won't talk to me because he is too busy, but yet they made no attempt to even asked him.  Then the hostess told a member of my party they don't need our f**ckin business and to leave.  The manager finally came over to offer us free drinks.  It was the most amazing display of disrespect and ignorance I have ever seen.  The staff is an embarrassment to this establishment and obviously not skilled or educated to understand their role in delivering customer service in a service industry.

QifpT5ceuW69UAUhLeDp_Q.text: I love industry! It is fun for adults and kids! I especially like when the windows are open

p2kEEsUV3aTbCnv07oWaNg.text: If i could give it 2.5 stars I would.  I come here a couple times a month and its very hit or miss.   Its a place where at 10pm on a weekend is so packed its uncomfortable but is completely empty by midnight.  At night its mostly people in their 20s and 30s with a trendy/ hipster vibe.  They have a about 40 beers ( all craft) on tap and a selection of bottles and screens that show you whats on tap.    I would say their signature drinks are smoked whiskeys.  They are cool to watch being made but its basically JD with some fruit and smoke on ice for $12 so nothing special   In the summer this place gets hot, unless you are lucky enough to be sitting by the huge windows that open onto the sidewalk you will be sweating.  Happy hour is really good here all their beers end up being $3-4 as opposed to $5+.  Food is bar food nothing more nothing less  The biggest inconsistency is the staff some are super nice and attentive and some just should not be bartenders.  You would think that if u were living off of peoples tips you would try to be friendly as much as possible, but apparently not.  Some of the bartenders ( the ones that i have been seeing there for years) are flat out rude.  So much so that if they are working i will not go to their section for a drink.  I come back here from time to time, but if the staff was better i would come more often

h5NWZOdqKvAXiX-saccVEw.text: Industry was one of those places that everyone in PGH seems to have eaten at except for me (what can I say, I'm not one of the cool kids, I guess).  When CM and I visited Lawrenceville on Sat. afternoon to see a movie at the Row House Cinema, we decided to go to a local restaurant for dinner.  Since I had a City Dining Card for Industry, I suggested that we give it a try if it wasn't too busy, so we stopped by to check it out.  Upon walking in at 5pm, the first thing that we noticed was the high noise level, despite the restaurant being less than half full.  Although the weather was pleasant, only one of the garage door-style windows in the front was open, which exacerbated the ambient noise from people's voices bouncing off of the exposed brick walls.  The music, which consisted mostly of early 2000's hits and struck me as outdated, rather than retro or hip, was also a notch louder than I would have liked, presumably to counteract the volume of the ambient conversations.  As if all of this auditory distraction wasn't enough, multiple TVs playing various sports (including rodeo, which I haven't seen televised before) were unavoidably visible from everywhere in the restaurant, adding a layer of visual distraction to the atmosphere.  Having heard about the smoke stack from my lab manager and having seen its popularity according to the Yelp reviews, I had to order one.  The smoke stack consists of whiskey that's imbued with additional smoky flavor through the burning of wood chips above it.  Each person creates their own version of the drink by choosing the whiskey base and then choosing the type of chip they want added.  For my version, I decided to go with the IPH rye whiskey (i.e., the house whiskey; $8) and the mesquite chips ($3), since our waitress told us they provided the smokiest flavor and recommended them for first time drinkers of the smoke stack.  I must confess that I was rather disappointed when the smoke stack was brought to the table already smoked--based on my lab manager's description, I thought it'd be brought to my table and smoked in front of me. The flavor of the drink wasn't very complex--it just tasted extra smoky to me.  If I came back and ordered this drink again, I'd sit at the bar so that I could see it smoked, and I'd choose a different flavor of chip next time (other options included maple, cherry, and other fruit flavors).  For our meal, CM went with the lamb burgher special ($15), and I went with the inside out cajun chicken sandwich ($13).  For the sides that came with the meal, CM had the standard fries, and I had a side salad.  Additionally, we ordered a side portion of the summer pasta salad to split ($4).  My side salad was your standard version with lettuce, a couple tomatoes, a slice of cucumber, and a few red onions, dressed with balsamic vinaigrette, and was thus rather boring.  The cajun chicken sandwich, which I ordered in hopes that it'd be one of the more flavorful options on the menu, unfortunately fell quite flat.  The seasoning offered very little heat, and it wasn't evenly spread across the chicken, such that some bites were completely bland.  Furthermore, the bagel that served as the inside out bookends of the sandwich was pretty greasy, which I wasn't expecting.  CM described his lamb burgher as quite moist, but reported that the bun wasn't high quality, such that it easily crumbled.  The fries, which I tried, were fresh-cut and were seasoned perfectly with just enough salt, but weren't quite as crisp as I would have liked.  Surprisingly, the pasta salad was the most flavorful dish that we ordered, and was quite tasty.  Overall, I must confess that I was rather disappointed in my experience at Industry.  Neither CM nor I were fans of the atmosphere, and the service wasn't great, either.  For the price we paid ($35+, before tip, even after the $10 dining card discount), the portions were smaller than I expected, and the execution was disappointing, even for casual bar food and drinks.  In these respects, the comparison to Harris Grill is quite apt.  For bar food and drinks done well, I recommend Fat Heads or Burgatory, both of which have a better atmosphere, as well.  Although I can now say I've been to Industry, I doubt I'll be back soon--I just don't understand the hype.
