_P_H7C_5JXFLRCJ0omYUfg.text: Well I've eaten at the Industry in Lawrenceville before and enjoyed it. Find this location was open and wanted to try it out before a movie. Called when we were by IKEA to see how wait was. We were told that it was no wait or at most 5 minutes if they started one. It takes all of 5 minutes or less to get there from IKEA. Pull in and walk inside to be told wait would be 35-40 minutes. Wife questions that because we were told moments before no wait on the phone. Front of house staff not the nicest tonight. Ended up waiting 20+ minutes despite many, many empty tables. Waiter was a nice guy and did a good job. Lots of service complaints on Yelp about this place but our guy did well. Food took longer than what I thought it would. My fish and chips came out cold but was still tasty. If we weren't wanting to get to a movie I would have sent it back. Not a but if heat in the fish. I did notice someone walk past a few minutes before or food came with a fish and chips then after trying to deliver to a table take it back, wrong item I assume. My thought is that this ended up being my fish. Again many people waiting and tons of empty tables. Everyone else liked their food and they have a nice draft list.  Need to work on front of house staff and ensure food is served hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two of the many tables that remained open while people sat waiting. Nobody was seated in these the entire time we ate.

-UvFW9bKlUieqlD2MwTGkw.text: Wow. For a "tavern" this place has great food. They accommodated our large group in the side room. We had nachos, veggie pizza, macaroni and cheese, macaroni pizza (!), wings. Of everything I tried, only the popcorn disappointed (couldn't taste the truffle oil; it needed salt). Server was friendly. Drink list is long. Parking is hard to find.

6aeUca6__bfVM_yhe3Ia0Q.text: Great quality food and drinks! I wish that I could have their signature smoked cocktails at everyplace I go to eat. More than just a fancy pyro presentation, the signature smoked cocktails are bursting with oak flavors. Bold but balanced aromas and tastes are what make the drinks here grade A.  Ok I know you came here to hear about the food so here it goes. All of it, amazing! Each time I come here it seems like they find a way to outdo themselves. We ordered the Shrooms flat bread with truffle oil, chevre cheese and crimini mushrooms. Oh did I mention how the delicious the gooey, cheesy industry cogs (deep fried mozzarella) were. The marinara has been on my mind since we left.  Industry is good for a reason. Awesome atmosphere, great food, better drinks and terrific service are all reasons to get here ASAP and try it for yourself!

2cKDF0KThHWw8Fib22ijyg.text: Stopped in for lunch the other day.  Can't say I paid much attention to the decor, as we were meeting friends.  But omg, TURN UP THE LIGHTS.  NOT EVERYONE IS 17 AND HAS PERFECT EYESIGHT.   Our server was really nice, and was quick with everything.  This is something I REALLY appreciate.  I ordered a Megabus cocktail -- it was good, but a little bitter.  The ice melt made that easier as the meal went on.  For my lunch, I ordered off the brunch menu and got the Liberty Tubes.  The menu basically describes it as a breakfast burrito, but what you get is more like a fried, greasy wrap filled with a couple scrambled eggs and various other vegetables.  It was ok.  It got greasier as time went on.  And it was served with what I assume is sausage gravy?  Didn't make sense, and was cold and bleh.  Not a fan of that.  I'm glad I ate my friend's fries because I may have left hungry if I hadn't.  By the time I got to the second half of the "burrito" it was greasy enough to leave an oil slick on my hands.  No, thanks.   I'm being generous with my rating because of the service, and just because I didn't like what I got, it doesn't mean that everyone else was disappointed.  The beet salad, for example, was huge and looked really good.  She took those leftovers home.    If I'm ever down in that area again, I'll try again.  But I'll remember to order something completely different.

g5FaWuhJBA-lCCFZUZbhEQ.text: Great place to enjoy a new beer and grab dinner.  Industry Public House has a truly extensive craft beers list! I had a hard time narrowing down the choices since I hadn't heard of so many of them (and also haven't tried enough beers to know what I like). The servers were great and brought out small samples, which helped tremendously.   I ended up ordering the HITCHHIKER Cultured Creature Boysenberry Sour (4.2%), which was nicely tart, light, and refreshing.  Deep Fried Pickles || $8  Beer battered pickle spears. Not quite the fried pickle chips I'd expected, but still pretty good with the dipping sauce. Not as crunchy though since the spears retain quite a bit of juice!  Tramster Mozzarella Cogs || $10  Deep fried mozzarella slices served with marinara sauce. Wonderfully melty and crunchy.   Industrial Size Soft Pretzel || $15 HUGE soft pretzel that comes hot and nicely salted. I highly recommend getting a side of beer cheese (an extra $1). It's a savory, delicious cheese sauce that pairs fantastically with the soft pretzel bread. Great appetizer to share.   Truffled Filament Fries || $9 Fresh cut fries with white truffle oils and blue cheese. These are delicious! Loved that there was a truffle fries option :)  Macaroni & Cheese || $12  Generous serving of spiraled pasta covered with a cheese sauce. I was craving cheese, so opted to try the mac. Didn't find this dish quite to my liking though-- not very cheesy or flavorful. After a few forkfuls, I was wondering to myself how in the world I would get through the bowl. Probably better to skip this entree and try something else!  Brussel Sprouts with Bacon & Gorgonzola || $4  YUM. These roasted brussels are heavenly. Perfectly toasty and creamy. Highlight of my meal. Honestly, next time here I'd probably just get a couple sides of these brussels to serve as my entree. Yes. They're THAT GOOD :)

359UG7R1Yqt4d1o0qknumw.text: Best Mac and cheese I've ever had in my life. Awesome atmosphere. A little hiccup with time of service because of a storm they were extra busy and our group was rather large but their fantastic management rectified the situation promptly. 10/10 recommend

NoczKmMR8NeFfvsEfZSgaQ.text: We had a great experience tonight for our first time.  We grabbed two sandwiches, the turkey and the shaved steak and had bbq pork Mac and cheese as a side dish.  Everything was quick and hot especially on a Friday night.  Will dine again in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ROnmgsO6bd3e5tcfnraD5A.text: Order the "Smoke Stack" - just do it; I promise you won't regret it! If you're a whiskey drinker, having the option to select your whiskey of choice then choose a flavor for it to be smoked with (apple, maple, hickory, etc) is truly a treat! The show itself was well worth what I spent on the drink which wasn't too bad at all ($10 + tax) for Gentleman's Jack!  Happy Hour: - Lawrenceville Location is Monday - Friday from 4:30pm - 6:30pm ($2 off all draft beers, $7 cocktails, $7 wine by the glass, $7 flatbreads, $6 filament fries, $6 starter burgers) - North Fayette Location is Monday - Friday from 5:00pm - 7:00pm  Parking: I was able to find free street parking on a side street off of Butler  Crowd: There is a mixed-age crowd ranging in age from about 25-55

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Smoke Stack&#34; Old Fashioned - $10 using Gentleman&#39;s Jack as my liquor of choice

y_eGzvvpxAOc_Ojw8dT6ag.text: Really comforting and delicious pot roast on top of a mound of mashed potatoes. So filling too. Perfect food for a cold night in Pittsburgh!   Pretty hip atmosphere with great service too. It is really nice Lawrenceville is getting renovated and refreshed with such great restaurants!  I look forward to continuing to try out new places in this area.

KDYOiicfs9wld81V8whyeQ.text: Cool place Dirty and burnt fries and chicken sandwich 2 stars because the server give us good service but it deserves 0 stars for the food

UO6FjeJbdFbYN71P_nZZ6Q.text: I've been here a handful of times while visiting Pittsburgh, and this place has been amazing each time. The burgers are fantastic and so is the mac and cheese. I also really enjoy their extensive beer selection.  It's a very nice place with a lot of seating and outdoor seating is available if the weather is right. The service has always been great, too.

u-X8SOE4NHPN4tCt71FXwA.text: This is the worst service I have ever had.  The 2 male bartenders tonight we're taking over 20 minutes to get to customers.  Last week when I came in they called last call at 1220am when there were approx. 15 people in the place.  They said they had things to do and the manager co signed it.  Unreal.  I hope the owner sees this.  100 percent terrible

H8P1_oCBBi0BD75mR0H1Tw.text: Industry is one of the largest spaces in Lawrenceville, but it's still extremely crowded on the weekends. I arrived around 9pm with friends and was originally told it would be about a 30 minute wait. Thankfully a table quickly opened for us. The menu has a wide variety of food and beverages.   Our table started the night off with the chili cheese fries and drinks. I had the Rose Sangria. The appetizer was super good. The chili on top is one of my favorites. My sangria was also good, but different. With some many tropical flavors it had somewhat of a sour taste. For dinner I had the President Salad. It's there take on a Caesar salad. Very good portion size. Our server was very attentive even with the large number of tables she has.   We hung out a while after drinker having another round of drinks. The atmosphere is a perfect fit for young professionals looking for a great drink, conversation and music.

ZisZy6GnJy1YkHZxT8cTBA.text: Nice happy hour, roomy.   Sometimes can be loud so be aware.  It's a chain so it has all the basic American foods. Pretzel is a great app to share.

bkZsmk-pDO59QG0imXepqQ.text: We stopped in here to watch the second half of the Pitt / Penn State game. We were going to Row House for an event but my boyfriend wanted to see the rest of the game so since this was close we figured it was a good place to grab a beer.  The place was packed, which wasn't surprising but we were able to grab a table near the bar with good views of the TV. Despite the crowds, our waiter was attentive and we weren't left waiting too long.  Now onto the beers... they have a pretty long tap list so we figured we should definitely be able to find some good options. Unfortunately the actual variety of the list wasn't as great as we would like. The list was extremely IPA heavy. As non-IPA drinkers our options were limited. We had a few beers, none of which blew us away. Prices can be a little on the high side and considering the lack of good options on the tap list I think there are better options.   All being said, if there is a cool event at Industry it may entice me to go down. I had previously attended a Pumpking flight even here. Also if I am doing something else close by I would keep it is a possibility. However, there are so many other options for beer and cocktails close by in Lawrencville that it probably wouldn't be my top choice.

_ZCKUWQXpHhJwqHPut-g3Q.text: Losing money by the minute. Bartenders working hard but not enough of them. Everyone wants a drink and they can't serve fast enough. Owner either doesn't understand economics or never visits at night.

j8EOyDDbKgJAHIHjULCMng.text: Watch your bank account! Overcharged $25 and it's been almost 3 weeks and no credit to my bank account yet. David the manager was initially responsive but now refuses to return my calls.

HLT5bD6gOhJFqLHFZh7UmQ.text: Industry is a great spot in Lawrenceville. I like the location and atmosphere. I have been there when it's super crowded and now choose to come in more of the off hours or make sure to get a reservation.  Last night I met up with some friends for some drinks later in the evening when a friend arrived in from out of town.  The bartenders and drinks were great. Started with some beer and then decided since it was our friend's first time in Pittsburgh that we had to get the whiskey smoked. He was absolutely enthralled with the presentation. I highly recommend doing this at least once, just for the experience. So Industry nailed it on the drinks.  My disappointment came with the bar food. At this point in the evening I realized I had not had food since lunch and the bartender recommended the tomato mozzarella flat bread.  I am not sure if the kitchen staff was just careless at that point in the evening at around 10 pm or if no one bothered to check the flat bread but it was burnt. The kitchen serves until midnight so I am not sure why this happened, but instead of making a big deal about it and having to wait another 20 min for a new one I ate the center pieces that were not hard or burnt. This hasn't been my experience before and the last time I had their food it was pretty solid to pair with the great drinks. Therefore, I am optimistic this was a one time thing and plan to not take Industry Public House off my Lawrenceville restaurant rotation.

hXS6ffaVvmVyeqWO-wxIrQ.text: Kind of interesting location in a learning lot but still has great views. Inside they have quite a few beers on tap, but didn't have the ones we wanted. The food is ok. Nothing is really special but the portions are huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and cheese with cajun chicken and candied bacon

Z_vKiZhrjdKM0QxWf6UV-w.text: This place was tasty! I love the drinks. The ONLY issue I had is it was awfully busy and we did not get good service. However the server took 20% off of our bill due to the fact of us waiting and him being behind (I get it Im in service industry as well) other than that I love this place good food and good drinks! Will be back since its not too far from my day job!

JEzRTju3OujGFYO6PV3w7Q.text: Regretted this place. It's all about the employees. How should we, as customers, accommodate them? Our job is apparently to order stuff--even if incomplete--and to assume that they close their dining menu nearly 15 minutes early, and doors an hour early. You get a $7-8 burger meal for $15 (test this if you want), but the beer list is okay (have to hunt for a beer menu, since server won't bring one). Server may forget about you once or twice. Main thing that caused me to cut my evening short (worth 2 more beers) is the "music" (all about the employees: hip-hop porridge--but this is not a club: format should chill-friendly, not play up to staff interest in JV clubbiness). Meat-head bartender can't pour a full pint, and passes time munching on house food while idling behind the bar. Shame, because it's physically a nice setup, but the experience is soul-sucking.

FVnrXdOEhWjU6C5byyndcA.text: Was here in the fall on a weekday afternoon and enjoyed it. I had a flatbread with some chicken and cheese which was good, but nothing special. But my friend ordered the Farmed Out Burgher with fries and it was soooo good. Very large, filling and flavorful.   We just came back as a group on a Saturday night. We split a giant, but overpriced, soft pretzel with dipping cheese and mustard. I personally thought it was great but $16 is a little steep.  While the food here is decent, the beer list is really what I like about it. There are many things to try, including a few of Industry's own beers.   I stuck with Industry's IPH (house IPA), because it was good, and one of the cheapest on draft at $5.50. If you do like beer, definitely check out what nitro beers they have available.   During the fall they had a nitro pumpkin spice latte stout - and as basic as we felt ordering it, it was worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fall special - flatbread

ROoevuJCPF1IUN6_Q7epLQ.text: Great beer tap selection. Great food. Love the industrial Pittsburgh atmosphere. And they've just expanded their space!

9g_Yfy4Vxoz0UpqvAz-I3g.text: The worst service ever. I have left twice after sitting at the bar and waiting for service for over 25 minutes. I politely asked if I could order and was met with a huffy, "IN A MINUTE"

MPmcxp1ZQ_DqfKxs4UKJ-A.text: We visited Industry on a busy Friday evening, looking for some of the exciting drinks and food we'd heard this place does. The place was packed--had a 25 minute wait for a table, which was fine. We took a couple of spare stools at the bar and ordered some drinks. The beer list is good and the cocktail list sounded interesting. We tried some cocktails. They were okay but nothing special, unfortunately. We then moved to a table and ordered some food. My wife ordered a salad and I ordered a burger. I'd heard they do some great things with burgers, so I was pretty excited. A good "fancy" burger in Pittsburgh can still be hit or miss (more miss than hit). This was a total miss. The burger was way overcooked (ordered medium), the beef did not taste top quality, and the bun was stale. What a shame. The only positive were the fries, which we ordered with pot roast gravy. That was a tasty topping that elevated otherwise boring fries.  The service was so-so. The hostess dealing with the table wait list was pleasant and helpful. The bar staff were affable. Our waitress was friendly but pretty aloof (or indifferent?).   The ambience of the place on a busy night was great, though. Really felt like a happening bar in a happening neighborhood of Manhattan (actually the way the place is decorated reminds me of The Smith in the East Village).  This is a good bar for beers and maybe some basic snacks. Food was unimpressive but depends on the occasion I suppose. Two stars because they are trying to be something more than a bar with average bar food so they could do better. Hopefully they will as this is still a relatively new place.

HFhaJJrbymuLitkdz4Eeaw.text: The food is pretty good, especially the bacon, which is flown in fresh everyday.  The beer selection is excellent.  The atmosphere is fun.  The bar is huge, fully stocked and the bartenders are always quick with a drink.  The best part is that I live super close and I can walk there on a Saturday evening and not have to wait too long to sit down and eat.  However, the reason that I give Industry only three stars is two-fold;  first, the music is sometimes so loud during dinner time (i.e., before 9 pm) that i can hardly hear myself think.  Second, there have been several occasions that the waitstaff has been incredibly rude.

X9r65HbUyIFRTelPmpuw8Q.text: Industry Public House is AWESOME! Darren and I came here with my friends from VA, and they loved everything as much as I did. The Pot Roast sliders have mashed potato cakes and gravy in them and are superb. I shared them with my friend along with the delicious Charred Flatbread and Truffle Filament Fries. The Coconut Cake was really good too. Loved the decor and the service also.

vijYilkAFPwJwBLsQIiFEw.text: This place is very hipster and I am not. With that said, they have good food, good beer and good service so what is not to like? It's a good place that I will continue to frequent. If you don't like hipsters then just go with a group of non-hipsters and enjoy and food and beer. Problem solved!

ekLuVzuYq5gq-4bChh2asg.text: Rude. Unsanitary. Disgusting.  What did me in here: I saw our waitress take a sip of a beer that was intended for a customer. Yes, that happened.   She was indifferent to us but totally rude to the table next to us. Eventually, after she literally threw a drink menu at them, they asked for a manager and left. We were a bit off-put by this, and then of course when we saw her SIPPING BEERS INTENDED FOR CUSTOMERS we immediately got up to leave, asked them to cancel our orders, and won't be back.   With how aloof the manager seemed to be, this place is straight up dangerous. I highly recommend staying away.

tNX-MR85EpDVR2CJ29I6Dw.text: Food is pretty good, drinks are excellent but pricey, and service is good if it isn't packed.  When its packed its hard to hear and hard to get a drink. However, the atmosphere is fun and inviting. I say go if you have some dollar bills to spare and are looking for a good time.

nz9vPAN2Nn9BK_TN2pagYA.text: First off, I eat and drink at Industry Public House with company between 3 and 4 times a week as I live less than a block away. The restaurant has been open for a little more than a month. It's understandable that a new restaurant has initial growing pains - server issues, menu issues, billing issues, etc. I'd like to break my review out to explain the 2 star rating. Food I would rate 4 stars. I've had the burgers, the pot roast, the beef sandwich, the bacon, the mac and cheese, the electric cheese, etc. The food overall is not only creative but also VERY good. Bravo. Service via servers I would rate 3 stars. There still seems to be some confusion upon arrival and at times when seated. The host is not always present and it is somewhat typical to wait in the front of the restaurant wondering exactly what to do. I've waited on more than a couple of occasions for more than 5 minutes before even being acknowledged as a patron. The serving staff is very friendly albeit somewhat aloof at times. From delays in greeting you, to letting dishes pile up on a table, to bringing appetizers and entrees at the same time, to taking a significant amount of time to bring your change or the credit slip you should sign. Very apologetic in almost all instances, but, in retrospect it should not be happening as much as it does. Management I would rate 0 stars. On my visit of May 08, 2012, I was treated with total disrespect by the restaurants chef. As I mentioned, I have eaten at the restaurant countless times. And on 6 of those occasions, I have ordered the bacon appetizer. While the menu does not indicate the number of pieces in an order; I have received 6 pieces each time. At $6 an order, I think it is a little expensive but boy is it good. Tonight I received 5 pieces, and I told the server that I was light 1 piece. No big deal, my sandwiches had missing items on a few occasions, I said something and it was corrected promptly. TONIGHT WAS THE EXCEPTION. I mentioned it to the server and figured it would be taken care of. Just another oversight. What happened was not what I expected. The chef came to our table and beligerantly informed me that an order contained 4 pieces and that I had not received 6 pieces prior. I pointed out that I received 5 pieces tonight and was told that the order I received was wrong. He went on to explain that the cost per pound was X dollars, and in essence that I should be happy with what I got. He ROLLED HIS EYES AT ME and walked away in total DISGUST. I told the server what happened, went over again that in prior visits what policy was, and that I expect to spend close to $1,000 this year there. In essence, try and make it right this time. What happened instead was that the chef returned to our table, brought 2 pieces of bacon, and said I gave you 2 but next time you're here the order is 4. He dropped the tray on the table, ROLLED HIS EYES AGAIN, and walked away in DISGUST. So the meal didn't start out so good. A simple here is another slice, followed by an "our policy is actually 4 slices", but I'll make it right this time would have been enough to satisfy me. I made the customer happy, I let him know the policy, and now he knows for the next time. Problem solved. But... Then I order the Management Burger which is explained on the menu as the Worker Burger plus bacon and a peppercorn rub. Check industrypgh.com. The Worker Burger includes your regular toppings plus mozzarella cheese. I receive my order and it is missing the cheese. So, I tell the server and he returns the burger to the kitchen. Well guess what... The chef returns to explain that the the Worker Burger is actually the Factory Burger and that they print their own menus. What?! I think... He then tells me in an aggressive tone that I if I want cheese there will be a $2 up charge. He asks that I confirm my understanding of the charge, ROLLS HIS EYES AT ME AGAIN (3rdTIME mind you) and storms off in disgust AGAIN. Now I am a business owner and in a prior life was involved with the public. Cardinal rule number one is that the Customer is ALWAYS right. If the customer is misinformed, you make it right first, explain the policy and move on. Enough said. You DO NOT ATTACK the customer or in any event EVER ROLL YOUR EYES AT THEM. You treat people as how you would want to be treated. And I wouldn't be making such an issue of this but it's not the first time I have seen this interaction between a customer and the chef. In fact, I have seen on two separate occasions where the chef was not only disrespectful but also aggressive with the customer. It's just bad business. PERIOD. So to the owner and/or manager. I've said my piece. I hope you don't take this comment with a grain of salt. Make sure the staff knows that they are in the food SERVICE INDUSTRY. Treat people with respect and dignity. And they'll keep coming back. You've got a good thing going there. Make sure the customer is happy, it's as simple as that.

O8gK751Ms249XhWnEgLjzw.text: I find myself coming here much too often as of lately.  It's been very cold and frosty and nothing warms me up better than a smoke stack.  This is a whiskey drink that makes me want to just sit there in a sweater and wool socks and watch all the hipsters pedal by while sitting in the comfort of this cozy gastropub.  Every attention to detail has been paid.  From the lighting and decor to the unique menu and classy cocktails, this place is fancy but it's not, because it's still in pittsburgh, so you can go and relax.  If you go, ask for Jess as your server because she's super nice and patient.

3_NZ2Nv4fyvVoRVVZz6slw.text: I have been here a handful of times to grab cocktails with friends on busy "drinking nights". Whenever I enter Industry I feel like I am transported into Shadyside as soon as I walk through the door. For those who are unfamiliar with Pittsburgh geography/demographics, I can only say that this relates to the high concentration of yuppies and preppy students/professionals who frequent this bar. In addition, there is this unavoidable air of snootiness present that I can't quite put my finger on. The bar is impressive and they offer a variety of specialty drinks. The bartenders are more standoffish and you really need to thrust your cash out onto the bar to get any attention. The drinks are priced high which is somewhat painful considering that you can get them for half as much across the street. The design/interior of the building is nice (exposed brick, hip industrial feel, large open garage door windows). There is usually a large grim bouncer that stands outside on busy nights. The area within this restaurant/bar is ample which makes it nice for larger groups of people. The bathrooms are clean and inviting (this is always important to me). If you like hanging out in places like the Walnut Grill, Marios, Harris Grill, etc. Industry would probably be a good choice for you. If you enjoy a vibe that is more artsy, laid back, eclectic and cool, try somewhere else on Butler St.

uWBw34FWlInUx8HwftcRtQ.text: Smoke stacks. Enough said. Highly recommend these whiskey drinks. Great beer selection and good burgers/pot roast fries.

IOzacjw2xFJ0USK8h7XWmQ.text: I have only been here twice now and both times the service was not bad it was horrible. To have 2 bartenders on and not be that busy I shouldn't have to wait 5 minutes to be greeted or waited on.

uDpjTChwVOPm_FyEAJpmlw.text: I can't believe I am going to say this, but I wish I lived in Lawrenceville so I could be at Industry every day.  What a great place!!!  I frequent Industry Public House about once a week and am never disappointed in the food, service, beer selection, and overall experience.  I was first attracted to Industry because of the beer list.  Being a self acclaimed beer snob, I was so excited to see a plethora of different craft beers.  When I found out they rotate the selection as well, I was in heaven.  I have eaten there numerous times - from a full meal to just appetizers - and have yet to not clean my plate.  (Plug for the lobster sliders which will absolutely rock your world).  The service at Industry is second to none.  The bartenders are always friendly and attentive and put on great shows while making their signature cocktails.  The ambiance of Industry is a great mix of classy meets industrial meets modern meets bar next door.   Two enthusiastic thumbs up.  I was there last night and am already pumped to go back!!!

ClErUimNMU5pdnhk2RW62A.text: Was going to try them again, they do not even bother answering their phone, it goes straight to voice mail.

DpSThkhDsQ8HcycFu8G-wQ.text: i was both really impressed and really unimpressed when i went here the other day. ok, good before bad: the atmosphere is awesome. so much industrial detail, it's perfect. and the menu is pretty interesting. caribbean burger? lobster mac and cheese?! and they have a pretty big list of beers on tap too. i personally had the caribbean burger which was pretty damn good (gotta add the lobster though!) and the chili which i was also impressed with. oh, and our waitress was so adorable and helpful! but now, the bad: i also had the management burger (my "date" and i split them both) and i was pretty disappointed. i mean, it wasn't bad by any means, just really bland. the description sounded so good so i was pretty caught off guard. i also had the industry copper ale and again, not bad, just really unimpressive. the prices were kind of ehh.. beer was about average, maybe a dollar more than a cheaper place, and the entrees were so-so. the burgers were priced well, but i had to hold off on the lobster mac and cheese because of price. i'd still definitely recommend the place, but don't get too excited and be disappointed!

wm8xZvJJNSMKbx5BLMKhbA.text: I really enjoyed this place and the scenery. We had a group of ten of us and the waitress was very attentive and the food was awesome. Really nice drink menu as well. My friend got their special the artic char and he complimented the chef and the chef came out to meet him and talked to our table. I liked how they brought filtered water to the tables. Even the bathrooms were really nice and modern looking. had a great time with friends here and would go back!

VxOecml5ViI0LG63JnOSag.text: Good food with a fun atmosphere, unfortunately  non of that can make up for a rude staff. Came in with a group of 7 and the hostess was clearly annoyed of our table request to push tables together. My server was also extremely condescending when we asked questions, and made it very clear she did not want to have to repeat the options for side orders. She rushed through telling us about a bunch of options that sounded delicious, but I ended up just going with the French fries because I did not feel comfortable asking questions and didn't catch everything she said. I should also add that it was no busy while we were there. I'm a server myself and a very easy going customer, but nothing is more irritating when you feel like you are annoying your server/hostess with simple requests. My group Of seven go lucky, friendly, and understanding  friends didn't really know how to respond and it made for a very uncomfortable experience. It wouldn't have made me so angry if it was one rude employee, but it started with a hostess with an attitude and the server was just as bad (if not worse). Way to kill the beautiful Saturday afternoon vibes industry public house!  Great food and beer though

2x-JM1kGFLrZil0LJ3VSeQ.text: Smoke stack is amazing. I recommend this place for drink outings, always. It's very clean and a little bit more upscale than some other more dive-y options that I also adore in Lawrenceville, and whiskey selection is great. Love the decor. Food is a bit expensive but good.

xewn-HHvoQ-PiNfjsfXVSg.text: I was excited when this place first opened in Lawrenceville because we were in desperate need of a non-smokey dive bar. Industry definitely delivers on that regard with a really nice ambiance that isn't too overtly upscale. I've been to Industry about 10 times since it opened and the service has steadily declined since the first week. The bar tending staff is frustrating, it takes FOREVER to get their attention. The young lady who waited on us last night took literally 20 minutes at every step of the drink ordering transaction and rather than giving one or two customers her full attention she proceeded to wait on 10 different people at once while fumbling around and clearly losing track of what she was doing. Another bar tender will just blatantly ignore you and he used to do the same thing when he worked at AVA.   This place is still a great concept with a lot of potential and I think it could improve immensely by getting rid of a few of the weak links in the bar tending staff.

DhlceaXGVyDcW3xLcDk7Og.text: Bacon? Smoked whiskey? Sold.  If you're going to dine at Industry, you cannot *not* get the smoke stack whiskey.  You choose the bourbon/whiskey and drizzle it with a bit of maple syrup.  You choose fun flavors what to infuse it with, and they torch some wood lightly over it to give it a nice smokiness. Pair that smoked whiskey with candied bacon and you've got yourself a deal.

bwByxgJClULbvyjgnPFfKQ.text: I rarely give out five stars, but this is 5 stars and a bag of chips. When we walked in the place it was half full plus a party of 50 upstairs. The young lady who greeted us was very nice and seated us quickly. This used to be a Don Pablo's but you would never know it. Both the exterior and interior have been remodeled. The decor is very industrial yet warm and inviting.  The beer selection is outstanding-40 taps plus bottles. They have basic beers, a ton of craft beers, and even some hard to find beers. If you use the Untappd (not a typo) app and check in your pic will pop up on the Digital Pour Electronic Draft Menu board. I am not a big beer drinker but I tried and liked the Altec Peach Burbon Barrel Ale. If you ask they will give you samples. They even use the proper beer glasses.  For dinner we ordered the Pot Roast with Mashed Potatoes, Fish and Chips, and Ribs. The ribs had a great smokey flavor and we're falling off the bones. I thought it was a great price for the amount of ribs you get. The ribs comes with a side of coleslaw. The coleslaw is not overly vinegary or overly sweet. It is a nice compliment to the ribs.  There were 2 big pieces of beer battered fish. You could taste the beer in the flaky batter. It was cooked perfectly and the fish was moist and delicious. It sat on a bed of fries and had a small side of coleslaw. The fries were good as well. They make their own tarter sauce which looks like Thousand Island dressing.  The Pot Roast came in a big bowl. The Pot Roast was some of the best I have ever had in a restaurant. It sat on top of homemade mashed potatoes and had a brown gravy poured on top. It was the right amount of gravy-not too much, not to little. It was the perfect consistently. It was topped with crunchy fried onion rings. We all pretty much liked our plates.  There were all ages of people here enjoying a beer or a meal. We will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

sU90Z52LvdVKvYS53-tT-Q.text: The best part of the food truck roundup this past weekend? The long lines that forced to change our plans and walk to Industry Public House, where getting food was a much more pleasurable experience!  We were greeted by a nice hostess and got a cozy hightop immediately...during dinner hours on a Saturday! Our server was also really nice, and I loved that they bring you a big bottle of water to refill your glass so you're not constantly waiting for your server to stay on top of it.  The atmosphere was pretty nice, although the music was way too loud, which had my wife and I constantly saying, "what?" to each other. It was also a little too dark towards the back of the restaurant to see the menus, but we managed. Other than that, we liked the place. The solid beer selection on tap doesn't hurt, either!  We opted for a pretty simple meal: fried mozzarella and the cheese & bacon fries for apps, and two burgers (the top two on the burger list; their names escape me), and mac & cheese and a salad for our sides.   The apps were both good, but with apps like that, it's hard to say they're remarkably better than a lot of other places. I will say that the marinara that came with the fried mozzarella was the best part. I'm pretty sure they use honey in their sauce, which threw me off a bit at first, but grew on me quickly. I would order it again just for the sauce.  The burgers were good and cooked properly to-order. Of course, it was so dark, it would've been difficult. to see. Haha. Regardless, the flavor was good. The side of mac and cheese was also really good, and the chili-style seasoning they mix in adds some nice interest to a dish that's quickly getting too trendy and overplayed these days.  Overall, we had an excellent experience. The staff was great and the atmosphere was nice. The only issues are things that they can control, literally, with the flick of a switch or turn of a volume knob! Add in the reasonably-priced, delicious food, and we're left with nothing but reasons to return!

4aL9GmqlzjG37sQDNTYgGA.text: Food is very good.... service lacks a bit.  We ordered drinks, appetizers and dinner.  Server did not write down our order (this is often not a good sign in my experience) so we did not get our app.  We both had the Potroast  which was excellent.  We did have to wait to be asked for another round of drinks well after they ran dry.  Overall I like the place, hopefully next time the service is a little better.

PA6YB_0cUs9qc0ogAQpg5Q.text: I actually feel kind of bad. Our waitress was a gem and it really wasn't her fault, and I've been assured that this was an off day, even by her, but this place just missed the mark on just about everything.   We walked in around 1:30 on a Sunday. It wasn't busy by any means. A few tables filled, 5 or so people at the bar, and I think only 2 waiters were on the clock. The hostess seemed confused trying to find a table for 5 people, in the chaos of pushing 2 tables together (?!) she forgot to bring menus or silverware, which I noticed the couple next to us were also missing.   Finally our waitress came over to take out orders. Waters took some time to come out, so I should have noticed by that, that the rest of the meal may not go as I'd hoped.   We didn't order any drinks as we already had arsenal cider at home. But we did start with the country fried chicken livers, then ordered our entrees. 4 burgers, 3 of which were the blast pig and one farmed out, all rare, 3 with specialty fries (one of each) and a cluck house sandwich. My brother also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese.  So we waited, and waited, and waited some more until we finally asked someone to find our waitress as it had been about 45 minutes without us receiving our appetizer. She came over and apologized, comped the app, and finally brought it out. They were okay. I wish they had cut them smaller so the batter could have cut through the richness. The aioli paired with them were good.   After about another 25 minutes of waiting, all of our entrees came out. All 4 burgers were overcooked. And not by a little bit. 4 rares were more like medium wells. Not a spot of pink in a single one. I had the farmed out with a fried egg and the egg wasn't runny. Like, what's the point? The fries weren't even edible. 3 out of the 4 of us who ordered burgers, upgrades our fries spending another $4 on top of the already expensive burger, it was just insane. The blast big burgers didn't have the candied jalapenos which is mostly the point of ordering it, and my sisters pot roast fries didn't have those delicious onion straws that were supposed to accompany them. My chili cheese fries were just sad.  My fiance actually enjoyed his cluck house (and for good reason, it was delicious) but his side of Brussels sprouts ($5 additional) left a lot to be desired. Weird, barely boiled, smelly sprouts that immediately brought you back to childhood when you hated them. Strange cheese sauce and burnt bacon didn't help either.   We asked for our waitress to come so we could tell her the problem with 4 out of our 5 entrees. She was sweet, told us she'd bring over the manager, and came right back. They comped our meals, gave us boxes for the food we wanted to bring back with us, and apologized profusely. But, the manager never came. I thought it was rude. Certainly not her fault, but embarrassing for the establishment. We tipped her quickly and left.   Between the manager not really caring and the fact that it wasn't busy brought it down to 2 stars for me. I really think it was an off day, and I'd come back on a weeknight next time I visit, but this situation just wasn't ideal.

Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cluck house sandwich
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blast pig and a side of Mac and cheeses

AvQXmUinP332nm_TBaBl9A.text: I'll keep it short and simple. The place has a cool vibe. The A/C sucks and it was hot.  The mixed drinks are very good and lots of them to choose from. The bartender with the Joan Of Arc looking arm tattoo was not very friendly and the only time she attempted a smile was when she handed me the check.  I would probably visit the Robinson location next time and skip Lawrencville.

yFO2NyQMjM94ajGUmB3XNw.text: It isn't often I venture out to this area of North Fayette, mainly due to the fear of forever being stranded in traffic. If you share a similar phobia, I would recommend you overcome it and head on out to this Don Pablo's reboot.  They did a fantastic job of transforming this joint to fit an industrial pub theme! While I wouldn't expect a warm welcome (the service leaves something to be desired), the food was spectacular and the drink wasn't bad!  If you're out and about in the Robinson area and want to try something new, I recommend giving this Public House a try!

oWPA0Bq4ew5yW6HQx4sIhA.text: I wish I could give a 4.5 stars but I cant . I am missing the half star and really its not even a half (it's less than that) because the music would got loud, really loud, a few times it did that but they did turn it down for good as we were finishing our lunch. And the street parking stinks although we got lucky. On with my review...after walking around the zoo me and the hubby had worked up quite the appetite and after a short deliberation chose Industry. I am very glad we did! Yummy! We found a parking spot on the street a few doors down from the restaurant (it is street parking here). We stepped out of the car and were instantly greeted with the wonderful aromas of grilled burgers and tastiness. Oh, did it smell delightful! We stepped into Industry and were greeted by a friendly hostess who promptly sat us. I found the atmosphere very inviting and lofty. I am a sucker for wood floors, tables, and bars with beautiful, brick walls and exposed duct work. I told the hubby if we ever are lucky enough to have a bar in our house I want it to look their smaller one. It was gorgeous wood with the wall behind it a rusted metal, wow! They also had their windows open yet it was very comfortable in the dining room and the road noise was not an issue at all. Now the food...we were waited on immediately by our wonderful waiter who got us water right away. We looked at the menu and made our choices. I picked the Model "T'urkey sandwich. It was a huge, thick, slab o' turkey on bread with lettuce, tomato, Guyere cheese, & garlic aioli. The turkey was succulent and delicious. I also got the pot roast fries minus the onion straws. The fries did not need them. The pot roast was juicy and the gravy, oh my goodness! I would go back just for the fries. The hubby chose the Farmed Out burgher minus the cheddar and minus the BBQ sauce. He thought the burger was done to his standards :) and said he'd go back for it. He got the regular fresh cut fries. He liked those too. Oh, how did I forget...the bacon they had on both of the sandwiches, need I say more than Bacon. And how could we go there and not try a drink. I got a whiskey sour with their house Bourbon whiskey. It was very good.  The hubby chose their copper ale. He liked it a lot. It was fresh and light. We enjoyed our stop at Industry and will visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The view out their open front window
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Whiskey sour
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oh that wonderful bar and rusted metal wall:)

icKGFZT5o-RLeENNCc8hdw.text: I went here for the first time about a month ago and fell in love! They have the best blackberry kale salad that you can add salmon too and I swear I've been dreaming about it since! However, I'm giving four stars because my friend and I went in for apps recently and ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and it had absolutely no cheese on it and the lobster tasted under par for the price. When I brought it to our servers attention (I tried to be personable and nice although we were bummed) they brushed me off rudely and gave me attitude. I guess it depends when you go/what you go for! Have always had great service in the past.

7CNi3VGcSFMP8TZKalT7YA.text: It's actually a really spacious restaurant for Lawrenceville. There are larger wooden tables and cast iron-looking chairs. The place is decorated in Thomas Edison-age/industrial revolution stuff.   I enjoyed a black bean burger and a dark and delicious beer. It's impossible for me to tell you what beer it was because they have literally hundreds on tap. For some reason I want to say it was Arsenal, although they're kind of known for ciders.   At any rate, it's moderately pricey but if you want to get a unique experience -- go out and spend the extra buck.

BkqAZvcNd2-VzWsKzncQJQ.text: if there was an award for worst bartender service then this place is your winner. 3 bartenders and all terrible. They don't run the bar in sections, you can order from any of them at any given time which is chaotic because you have to repeat your tab to them every time you order. If you wait for your bartender he/she may be on the other side of the bar and you'll be waiting to get a drink.

A2KxdWZyIoPTg2B5xm3j2A.text: Had dinner here Saturday night. Was told 45 minute wait so we went to the bar to have a drink. Luckily we only waited about 20 minutes but in that time no one took our drink order.     Our server was very nice but had little knowledge of gluten free options for my friend.      We started off with the truffled fries and they were fantastic! I love that they made a sauce out of the truffle oil and Gorgonzola instead of just tossing both ingredients on the fries.   I ordered the Electric cheese. It was a pretty good sandwich but I think I'll try something else next time.  At first I was a bit displeased with the tiny glasses of water until our server brought us our own chilled jug of water. I think this is a fantastic touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great touch with the water jugs!

E2ONjWLulJpkIjHpi2G6gg.text: Awesome place, great setting. Made up for giving us a wait by giving us complimentary drinks and money off our check. Like this place a lot!!

DLarX76B557oCUdH9hh15w.text: This used to be our favorite place to go but the last two times we went the food was bland, over cooked and I felt like we could've been at any airport chills to go. That actually may have been better.   This place has become way more popular and busier than when we started going so maybe they just can't keep up with that or just don't care anymore. We finally decided it's not worth the $40+ for subpar food when there are so many more better places to eat in this neighborhood! Sad too, because it used to be so good!

ARVsi5G_yBLkztTPY0KvMQ.text: My wife, son and I ate dinner there for the first time. The restaurant is in Lawrenceville, which is a vibrant place. The atmosphere in the restaurant was also vibrant. There were many people from all walks of life who seemed to be enjoying themselves. We also enjoyed it. However, the food was only so-so. There was an adequate list of selections on the menu. I chose the chicken dumpling pot pie. It was good, but was more soupy than anticipated and with lack of much texture. My wife had nachos, which she disliked. She could not eat many of them. My son had a burger and fries covered with pot roast meat. The burger was OK, but the fries were very good. The service was OK, but could have been more attentive. The prices were reasonable. Overall, we enjoyed the visit mostly due to the atmosphere, but the food was not memorable in a fantastic way. We would consider returning, but would likely consider trying someplace else before making that decision.

w0MfwQOkGxbwMt2dVoPLfA.text: Farmed Out Burgher in the truffle Parmesan fries are really good.   This is a nice trendy place in Pittsburgh A must stop if you're in Lawrenceville.

pTqbCfTeoYompAJWi4xvZw.text: I came here a few days ago while visiting Pittsburg and there were some highs and lows to my lunch. First off, the truffle fries were AMAZING. Like I will dream about them amazing. The bar was also quiet trendy and there was a game on while I was here so there was a good atmosphere. The good kinda ended there though. The ceviche was so bad I couldn't eat it - ceviche isn't the easiest thing to make and the ingredients need to be super fresh so it might make sense for the kitchen to stick to the bar food that it seems to do really well. The service was also painfully slow, which was surprising because it wasn't that busy.

-BDmdzcugJXkmZV10CvOEA.text: Was a bit disappointed as this was my 3rd visit to industry and the first 2 times everything was done very well but the 3rd time wasn't a charm. Going on a Sunday may have been an issue but there was no consistency and the food was very bland. The service was ok but no where as good as if you go on a Thursday thru Saturday.

rGWS97DHxqmpwQf5XqeFow.text: Probably overrated as I came here off a week in Iceland living off glass and dust, as Iceland is super expensive ($30 for a soup) anyway, service here was decent, ok knowledge of beer, food usual comfort fare. They also set fire to their drinks with flamethrowers... I don't know why I didn't start and finish this review with that previous sentence.

BZ-rF36Zp1mMOi9x4nz45g.text: Ok, I've tried to give this place a chance.  Orders are ALWAYS wrong.  Appetizers come out with entrees.  Quality of food is hit or miss.  Black bean burger is not eatible.  It's like refried beans on a bun, mushy, really horrible, not to mention the order was not how I ordered it.  Replaced that with a burger which was tasteless.  Table of 8 ordered apps and burgers.  One person ordered a salad.  Everyone was half done with entrees before her salad even came out.  Friend ordered a medium rare burger and it was medium well.   I want to like this place.  Really, I do.  The potential is there.  Manager did take some things off bill and gave a few gift cards but honestly, I'd rather just have a good experience without poor quality food and excuses.  My advice would be get a food expediter on the kitchen window and if something comes out incorrect, send it right back.  They can't even get drink orders to the table in a timely manner and mistakes on those too.    Management needs trained properly.  Hostess had no idea we made reservations as well. Imagine our surprise with 8 people and reservations made and they were clueless.  Seriously, I won't go back unless every restaurant nearby is closed.

YX0cxwOsYUuPWQ6NpX6Fqw.text: Came here for a friends birthday dinner on Friday and was so impressed with the atmosphere. The brick walls, exposed pipes, cool lights, and chill music make Industry Public House a must-go-to place. The overall vibe is very chill and perfect for drinks after work, birthday pre-game, and everything in between.   I didn't have a chance to try other things on the menu but was not very impressed with the calamari appetizer that I got. The portion size was way too small to be shared and the calamari itself tasted like it had been sitting out for a while and not made fresh. The other people in my group did like the food (but also had small portions besides the giant pretzel) so it may have just been my luck on getting a bad plate of apps. I am excited to return and try some of their other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. giant pretzel!
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. calamari app
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cool ambiance

eD0m-IQCLpZ-ZbUqxZ6iVg.text: Hit or miss on my first visit. Nachos were great and the pretzels are huge! But my pulled pork and pot roast fries were a major disappointment. Everything was soggy and a little sad. We had a group of 11 and our food came out at different times too. So half the group was done eating before we were. My individual bill was $26 and it just wasn't worth it to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac n cheese with candied bacon, galvanized pulled pork with pot roast fries

Sk_ujZyN8TPmPVL6bFjeuQ.text: 3.5 Stars for this place is a crime. The food is actually quite good for pub fare. You won't find a better draft list and the whisky list is fantastic, too. If you came here expecting gastronomy, you're the one in the wrong, not IPH. My only complaint would be that the wait staff (not those tending bar) need better informed of kicked taps.  I frequently have to reorder because they are out.   Sandwiches and fries are done quite well here. Recommend the Smoke Stack sandwich with gorgonzola fries 4.5/5 but giving a 5/5 since there were jackassed who caused the rating to go to 3.5

dFo-BIgZTMePXEnKn4aCMw.text: Huge, inviting space and a nice crowd.  I had a flight including two house brews, something called an IBH which was a good IPA and their Vernal IPA which was weak and watery. Those were the only house brews available.  There was guest tap chocolate mint stout which was True to style and name. Wonderful dessert drink.  Lots of beers on tap. Really nice.  I bet the parking in Lawrenceville can be challenging but we lucked into a spot quickly.  Wife had fish and chips.  Huge and she enjoyed it.  It looked delicious.  My hot turkey sandwich was also very good and filling.  Both of our fries were dark and looked over cooked but tasted alright.  But did not look appetizing.  We sat against the right had wall as you enter and the televisions on that wall are way too high fo some sitting at the table facing the wall.  Everyone was moving to sit next to their dining companion as I did   Good experience and I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot turkey sandwich
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beer selection digitized.

3cyUoC0U9p61f7xMsWRdWQ.text: Great restaurant/bar in the Lawrenceville section of Pittsburgh. Many choices of micros, if your a beer connoisseur. But for me, the food is the star! For me today, the Farmed Out Burger. White Cheddar, Wild Boar Bacon, caramelized onions, fried egg, and bbq sauce. A 5 star burger, fresh bun, burger was juicy as can be, dippy egg, cheddar flavor was very prominent, the caramelized onions were perfect and delicious, the bacon, delicious, your sensing a theme here, yes, the burger was awesome!!! Its up there with the best the Burgh has to offer. Side of fresh cut garlic fries, with the skin on, sooooo yummy. A great meal to say the least. Just go, is all I can say.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

S0Cbx3MKIQT2dpN2Z7EGAw.text: My friend's parents were in town so he made reservations here with a couple of our other friends and it was a great choice. We were seated right away, our food came out fast, and they have a wide range of drink and food options. Fries are bomb - I usually don't order reubens but having tried this one makes me want to go back because I'm craving!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reuben

00nxLNt7R5ySXARdsV2r9w.text: Great place to go out in Lawrenceville. This place is packed and has a great selection of drinks. They do not have a cover which is nice.   We came here at 11 pm and they have two different seating areas with two bars. The bartenders are very attentive and it does not take much to get their attention for a drink.

fzffR7OUZ_-r24ARIQJOOA.text: I've been to the Industry Public House 3 times now and have enjoyed it!  The food is great pub grub. I highly recommend the Mac and cheese and their loaded fries. They have a nice draft list each time I visit.  I've usually sat at the bar on my visits.  The service has always been good!  This is a good place for groups.  My group of about 8 friends came on a Saturday evening and did not have issues getting a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chili cheese fries

z9NFXCB1FfKK3azzsZstbw.text: Cool atmosphere, gratuitous whiskey selection, neat smoked upon request options. Hipster menu, friendly service, decent Bloody Mary bar.  Overpriced in my opinion, but worth a check out!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pnGfDkSWcd3Pp4Tia6B9gA.text: Stopped by here for dinner this evening and I had a great time. We ordered a bunch of food. We started with an order of the truffle fries and the spinach and artichoke dip. Both were delicious and the truffle fries are a must get. The spinach and artichoke dip came with chips and pita bread.  For our entrees we got the Mac and cheese with wild boar bacon, fish and chips, and the pot roast. Mac and cheese was HUUUUUUGE, such a large portion, definitely enough for two; super delicious. The fish and chips weren't bad but I'd probably pass on that next time, just because there are more exciting things to order. The pot roast was also very good and another large portion.   The service was good and the atmosphere was really casual and nice. I had a nice dinner and enjoyed it. It's a little pricey but they're pretty typical for the lawrenceville area. I'd come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach and artichoke dip
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac and cheese with wild boar bacon

4rWRIgftjC2huqpx0aqIqQ.text: After a brutally long wait since our first visit in 2015, we were once again treated to an incredible experience at IPH in Lawrenceville.  Everything from the service to the food and drink was outstanding!!  Here are some of the highlights. First, and most importantly, the infamous smokestack. While I have tried to recreate this bourbon campfire in your mouth with moderate success, it's always better here.   We ordered the soft pretzel which was bigger than my 5 y/o's head and quite delicious to boot.  Great cheese sauce and mustard for dipping.  The Blast Pig burger was cooked perfectly and orgasmic, just as I remembered. Those parmesan truffle fries though.  Other highlights to round out our meal and my waistline included the Brussels with bacon and gorgonzola as well as the quinoa burger (wifey).    Although my attention and thirst were focused on smokestacks, they do have a solid beer list. My wife enjoyed a few of their beers but I got to sample.     Our waiter (the name slips me but was a shorter, thicker dude) was awesome.  Great personality, friendly, and helpful.    Yes, I consumed at least a few days' worth of calories in just under 90 minutes, but after the short stint of indigestion followed by a loosening of the belt moment, I felt great about everything. See yinz next time we are in the Burgh.

X5VGUh5VM4k9D_S2Z-rkrQ.text: I've dined at Industry Public House at this location a few times, as well as the other locations. I always have a good experience there. This time around, I went with a craft beer (they have a fantastic selection) and the impossible burger. I was so happy to see they were serving this plant based option on the menu, as I tend to go with a plant based burger over a meat burger most days (it's lighter feeling and it tastes just as good!). It came with an onion kaiser roll, roasted garlic, and some veggies. I went with a salad on the side. The side salad was pretty big, fresh, and tasty. The impossible burger was great. I did order it "medium rare" and it came out more well done, which was a little disappointing. However, it was still delicious. The roasted garlic was literally just that, which made for very flavorful punches throughout the burger. Overall, it was delicious.   One of their signature drink is a smoked whiskey drink (the smokehouse)- lots of people were ordering them when I dined here on a Saturday evening.. meaning it smelled like a campfire in there, which was QUITE enjoyable :)

RWxX058VHIQ5YiP-0-WH0A.text: Industrial look alright!   What did I get I got the skirt steak salad. I asked for the steak to be medium rare but it came out well done... not sure if it is cause they cut the steak then cook it... but it was very cooked to me. It was also quite salty.... apart from the steak the salad was regular. I like the cucumber slices on it. Nothing too special about this salad. I also got a beer which I don't remember... it was amber something   Environment  I love the look and feel of this place. High ceilings, very industrial looking, yes yes I know it's in the name. There is plenty parallel parking spots outside that's paid parking.  Niceness of the staff I didn't complain about anything. I did ask for a beer recommendation, which I know it's hard since she doesn't know my taste. But she gave me a beer in the end and I liked it, thank you!   Dollar About $6 for the beer and the salad was around $12... decent yes?   Yes?  Eh, it was so so... maybe another time.   #WendyWanders

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skirt steak salad with beer
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The skirt steak salad
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. These sample cups are the cutest

kJHJAwz1djmWvL7jYnjXyA.text: YUM! One warning: the amount of food they give you is *humongous* so you better be HUNGRY if you plan to go here! I LOVED the "mozzarella cogs" and "company salad" and as a girl with an appetite, I generally appreciated the bigger portions on some of the menu options.   For some of the entrees, however, I would even argue that they give you too much food. The Nachos for instance, while although good, I'm never going to order something that big! The chips got cold before we came even close to finishing them and it just seemed like too much on one plate. Regardless, the toppings were fresh and yummy and it could be a nice snack to share with a large group of friends.   I also must say that, looking at the menu, I can't help but wonder why they would price their "industrial sized pretzel" at 15 dollars...  I mean, it's a bit much, you know? I never actually ordered the pretzel and I do think the amount of food they give you for the price is generally quite generous so I can't imagine how large this pretzel would have to be to justify charging customers 15.00 for one. Does anyone really need that much pretzel?  Anyhoo, with reasonable prices, satisfying serving sizes, and friendly staff I give this place a solid 4 out of 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iW8dsLZUa-jJakfqjVyABw.text: Something I really want to note is that 5 years ago, this would have been a 5-star review. In fact, this used to be one of my favorite places to get together with friends! I lived in Highland Park and worked in Friendship and my coworkers and I would stop in for lunch, it would always be my suggestion for dinner, and I held my 24th birthday party here.   In recent years, I've gotten married, moved to the suburbs and had a son. My time spent in bars has been cut down drastically in place of trips to Chick-Fil-A. But in the last year, I've made three trips here, and I have to say that It's just not as good as it used to be.   First of all, it's insanely loud and crowded. I know this means it's popular, but it's basically impossible to hear what other people are saying around you. It's also really difficult to get the bartenders' attention. When it first opened, it would be busy, but now the number of people have started to affect the atmosphere and service - which is much slower.   This review isn't based on the cocktails or beer selections. Of my last two trips, once I was the DD and once I was pregnant.  As far as the food, I was incredibly disappointed to find out they took the Lucy Furnace, a portabello-based vegetarian sandwich off of the menu. I'm not even a vegetarian, that sandwich was just SO GOOD. I typically got it with the mixed greens and I'm not sure if that is a side option anymore either.   Both times I went recently, I got the flatbreads. They are on the happy hour special and are a great deal. I got the tomato once and the buffalo mac and cheese once. They were very good!... pretty much like any other restaurant in the same price range. Nothing really unique or out of the park.   I really wish that I could still give this place a 5-star review, but I am definitely not planning my 30th birthday party here.

Ys41kZ15KXY6gidsHMepNA.text: Industry is one of my favorite places to eat/drink in Lawrenceville.  They have so many good beer options that it makes it tough to choose.  However, you can't go wrong no matter which one you go with.  In terms of food, they have some very unique and delicious options.  My favorite item is the buffalo chicken Mac and cheese flatbread.  Despite all the ingredients the dough is crispy and holds up to everything.  The flavors all come together perfectly.  Make sure to get some of their delicious ranch dressing as well!  The only bad thing is that it can get super crowded at times.  This is mostly True on Friday and Saturday nights.  If you don't want to be shoulder to shoulder with others, it is probably best to avoid it on these nights.

satR0ibzSRsLYXuEaC0xcw.text: Went her the other night for diner with wife and friend. The place is pretty big and has lots of seating. We got there around 5:30 and where seated immediately. The Waitress was extremely friendly and helpful. I had the pot roast over mashed potatoes. The food was ok I would say nothing special. I probably would not go back again atleast not for the pot roast. I might try a hamburger.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bWugYSs__Mme-kfxVZ-lEA.text: I was only in here for a couple of drinks with friends one evening during our visit to Pittsburgh so there really wasn't very much I could evaluate them on aside from drinks and service.  It's a large space with that rustic/industrial aesthetic that's common with any bar that has the words; Public House, Gastro pub/lounge/house, or craft. A large bar splits up the venue into two halfs with ample seating on both sides. Additionally there appeared to be at least one private dining/event space that remained empty during our visit, but cool nonetheless.  They've got a decent selection of craft beers displayed on a TV screen above the bar, I ordered a couple beers I can't remember and they were good. Cocktails were kinda meh, nothing to write home about.  As for service, it wasn't overly busy so I'm surprised it took as long as it did to get service when we were just getting beers - and we had a table but still had to order from the bar which was odd.  For me, it felt a lot like a college bar, and while that's great for some, it's not somewhere I fell in love with. A-OK for me, nothing more or less.  Eatcrest Out

R-ObBOcHRn_0Yo-URQckXg.text: I've never had a bad meal at Industry. The brussel sprouts are delicious and the burgers heavenly. Don't even get me started on the beer and cocktail selection! There's something for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Pig Burger with brussel sprouts.

xxCGIALl28mN7Bhgez3p6g.text: Industry is one my new favorite spots in Lawrenceville. You gotta know when to go, so you aren't waiting for hours.   We hit up Industry on a Tuesday night and got seated right away. Unfortunately, their happy hour is from 4:30-6:30 and we missed by about 10 minutes. However, they a great selection of brews on tap. Many different kinds for all types of beer lovers. We also sat in the bar section- their tables are tight but luckily the food is good.   To start, we ordered the giant pretzel. They have beer cheese, mustard, and cinnamon butter to go with it. This big guy is about $15 but it's worth it to share!   For my entree, I ordered the fish & fries. It was very good - however they were out of cocktail sauce, but our did apologize a few times. I would definitely order it again.   I'll be back to Industry again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3FIjfZJgyT9V_APzObl3vw.text: Looking at the mixed reviews here, it seems I caught Industry on a good night. My general thoughts: "This place is serious business."  Started off with a Smokestack. If you're a whiskey drinker, this is a must. Choose your whiskey, choose the wood, and let them do the rest. I just had Maker's, but the drink was fantastic. If we were there for beverages and not dinner, I easily could have spent the evening experimenting with various combinations. I have to give props to a place whose whiskey list rivals their beer and wine lists.   The gorgonzola fries are also a must. The fries themselves were excellent. Well seasoned, crispy, cooked through. But the gorgonzola on top? As Myron Cope would say, "Yoi!"  I had the Lucy Furnace portabella sandwich. It was tasty, fairly standard (let's be honest, there's only so much you can do with a portabella sandwich). The only problem was that gravity worked against me, and I ended up having to eat the sandwich with a fork. C'est la vie!  We were there on the earlier side of dinner, but were quickly seated and I have no complaints at all about the service. I will absolutely go back.

2GZP1HfUfOMupZ9kPHa75Q.text: Finally tried this place out last night. Had a beer on tap Lakefront - pumpkin lager, ordered the eggrolls and green salad. I love all types of salad. so it doesn't take much to impress me. A little over priced for quality of food. Eggrolls weren't spectacular for $4.50 each, cut and served on a fancy platter. We were served by two bartenders. The guy bartender became impatient with us - being this was our first time there. We needed to peruse  the menu. Many selections of beer on tap. Fairly priced. Atmosphere was a nice place. Love the open brick look.  Our food was handed to us by, I believe the owner. Of course, he was very nice. I would still stop by for a beer. The food can wait.

qIh9bE1REW8qCWL-ymUluQ.text: I recently visited Industry Public House in Robinson for a much needed girls night, and I was very pleased.  They were really busy, but thankfully we had a reservation for 5 of us, and they were able to seat us within 5-10 minutes of our arrival.  I had the fish and chips, it was hands down, the best fish and chips that I've ever had.  The service was good and the beer selection was insane.  There are so many choices, it's hard to choose just one!  The others had burgers, salads and flatbread and they all looked equally as good and everybody said they were!  I would recommend this place, but possibly during the week, not a weekend due to the lack of parking and how busy they were.

rKoZqoeN7ieCqo-ko0NnQA.text: Went with our work group for Christmas lunch on a Thursday 2 weeks before Christmas.  Most horrible wait times.  Took our non-alcoholic drink order wrong and after 10 minutes of no waitress we took wrong items to bar and waited another 10 minutes for bartender.  Some food cooked OK.  My sandwich was cold.  Complained to manager at checkout and didn't even get a response or an I'm sorry.  My time is better spent elsewhere.

hLZx6viROBYTNhT9BTSUrA.text: Love this place! Never had a bad meal or drink here. I make it my goal to try something new to drink and eat each time that I come here. I've enjoyed all of their flatbreads, the arsenal salad, the poutine style fries and their nachos with chili added are divine!!

6vizEIVCYdM1AMIaXJojmA.text: It was so noisy that it hurt. Walking out of the bar to the blessedly quiet (by comparison) sidewalk was the high point of the evening.

DyYGynSV8U8eLvFVGB8gNg.text: Neat place. Great drink list. Poor service. Ordered onion soup and a Caesar salad. Broth tasted watery and my lettuce was partially iced, the Caesar dressing had no spice.  Husband ordered a farm burger, obviously good ingredients but again, bland. His fries were mushy.  Our Waitress was a nice girl but way more interested in the table full of single men next to us than clearing our table.

63po8OEhJ7V_hC6lL8-61A.text: Went on a Thursday for happy hour, light crowd, bar seating not nearly a quarter full.  The bar service was horrendous, getting a bartenders attention became a joke with the six people in our group.  The food, delivered by the kitchen, was great, the smoky whiskey drinks we begged for were wonderful, but the bar tenders were abhorrent.  The ceiling must be impeccable because that's all the bartenders looked at when they occasionally graced us with their  presence.  I'm being completely serious, it was that bad.  Industry must do one heck of a business to get away with treating patrons this badly.  So if you like pleading for service and being treated like sh.t, by all means make the trip out to industry and quickly learn your place.

kC9jGVwqNoGmcYNXJUT7Cw.text: I will start by saying the food was good and not in massive portions. I got the management burger and a starter of the fried apricot mozzarella. For desert the bourbon bread pudding. All a solid good. Our server was also good. The music was also good. If your still reading this Industry is a good spot but I have to say not great. I find it annoying that on a Monday it felt like they were out of half of the items on the menu. I also found that for the price it was just a solid good. The bread pudding was laying in a apricot sauce. It was good but not how I have had bread pudding in any form before. My fries where good but greasy. The apricot mozzarella was good but for 9$ all you get it 4 small peaces. I would say oh well they had to spend a lot of time making it but I have made it from scratch before so that would be a lie. I will stop there. I'm giving 3 stars for good service and my burger was cook perfect and with lots of good toppings. But apart from that it was only good. I have been a few times before and every time it's different. Ranging from great to good. But in the end a little to pricy.

tgLIxMf-SUQJqWUymBt74A.text: This is my favorite burger spot in Pittsburgh. I love the beer selection. My only complaint is that sometimes the burger isn't cooked consistently--I always ask medium rare (juicy) and sometimes the inside is raw (rare). I will still keep coming back, but maybe ask for medium- juicy.

72p_KKEuB-FgvMrWjb_kjQ.text: Industry why do my experiences have to be so flaky. Garsh!  Anyway, this visit I went with a boy. Yes Sheryl T. had a date. Anywho food was ok I could've passed on the bacon cheddar fries. Andys' bacon cheddar fries beats Industry's any day. The server was my only problem.  Overly attentive to the point where it became a nuisance. I think he might have been trying to go home and wanted us to hurry up and order. That's still no excuse for being pushy.

iHsG6_WgiXnJRiWukGeP2Q.text: This place really sucks. Wish it would get out of Lawrenceville. No character, terrible food, and rude servers. Belongs in Station Square with the drunk suckers.

2GZMu5w6PRmLmgMPi6HtNw.text: How long is too long to wait for food? 20 minutes? A half hour? An hour? What about an hour and a half?? What if you waited that long, got crappy service, and the manager was totally unsympathetic? I went to Industry Public House with a group of friends (6 altogether) for hopes of a tasty meal and a few drinks. The atmosphere is fun, the decor is very cool, and the drink list is humongous. However, the service is absolutely abysmal, to the point that I will not go back.  It was a Saturday evening during the Rock All Night Tour, which is a very cool music festival that took place in several venues with several music genres. The idea was to showcase local music and the Lawrenceville neighborhood, so we thought it would be fun to eat local as well. When we put our name on the list, the wait was supposed to be 40 minutes, but we only waited about 15 minutes- a plus. The hostess was considerate and sat as down right away- another plus. Our waiter came running over with menus and took our drink orders, which were brought to us in a relatively short time- great so far. Then, he took our orders- on a Samsung Galaxy Tablet- and promised it would be quick and efficient, thanks to the electronic ordering- very cool.  And he was right, the appetizers we ordered came out very fast. My wife and I had the pot roast gravy fries, which tasted like Kennywood Potato Patch fries only smothered in pot roast- yum. Another couple in our group also enjoyed their appetizer, and frolic and joviality ensued. A great start to our evening. But then, it all went downhill. Maybe I'm being too hard on our waiter- perhaps he was kidnapped by aliens, or was wrongfully incarcerated, or had to deliver a baby in the backroom. Something must have kept him very busy, because 30 minutes after we finished out appetizers, there was still no entrees, no drink refills, no new beers, and our waiter was MIA. This was about the time we all started commenting on the length of our wait. We watched as other patrons were sat, ordered, waited upon, and paid their bills as we waited an hour after our appetizers to finally inquire what was happening.
