I like to believe my group and I are pretty laid back in these instances, but this was ridiculous.  We finally flagged a manager over to ask what was happening, which was about the time our waiter finally reappeared. I guess he must have stopped the asteroid or disarmed the bomb, or whatever important thing he was doing that he finally got away from to come running over upon seeing us talking to the manager. When we asked the manager what was going on, he stated that they were slammed and our food would be next. When my friend asked him why everyone else seemed to be getting their food without waiting, he looked over at a table and snapped back "that guy's eating nachos, which takes like 2 seconds to make." He then promised to buy us a round of drinks and that are food was already ready and would be over right away. We waited. And waited. A couple sat down near us, ordered food, ate, and were paying their bill as we waited. Finally, a half hour after the manager promised our food was coming, we gave up and proceeded to leave. After all, it had been over an hour and a half since we were sat, and this was unbelievable. I could have gone to the grocery store, bought the items needed, made the meal, served it and washed the dishes in the time it took them to bring out two hamburgers, two grilled cheese sandwiches, a salad, and a cup of chili. Unfortunately, our waiter reappeared with our food as we were standing up to leave. Arrgh, now we're eating after all. Despite the wait, the food looked good. My wife enjoyed her chili, and my burger with goat cheese looked yummy, but it was room temperature when I got it and I wasn't about to send it back. Everyone else commented that their food was good, but maybe it was because we were hungry, angry, and just wanted the evening to end. Amazingly, the waiter was quick to bring our bills and take our payment. We left a 15% tip, despite my objections that that was too much. Later that evening, I was visited my Montezuma's Revenge. Of all the times I've been sick from food, this was easily in my top 5. The next morning, I was still tasting goat cheese and bile in my throat.  It's unfortunate that such a hip place in Lawrenceville would have such poor service. I guess I was wrong to assume that a business with a menu would actually want to serve food, and not try to be a night club/bar. If you are going to have a full menu, then serve it. Otherwise, serve tapas and appetizers and focus on the drinks. And if you are the manager, be a bit courteous and listen to complaints- we really tried to be understanding and support a local business, but we won't be going back.

HlnhhGS9uGYFiEPy9xd46g.text: This place never disappoints.  A very cool space.  Great drinks.  Even better food.  My favorite is the flatbread with chorizo, goat cheese, carmelized red onions and arugula.  Yummy for sure.  They also have tons of TVs, so it's a good place to watch sports.  Check them out!

fYtsuN8qU0p90rWA_M_7pg.text: I've been here over a dozen times.   The food is always good, really good actually.   The cocktails and draft list are solid. Really good bourbon cocktails if that's your thing.  This place would be a 5 star joint if it weren't for one thing - the service. The service is terrible. Out of the 12+ times I've been here I think I've had good service maybe once. - bartenders seem annoyed mostly anytime you place an order - they don't have enough bartenders on staff given the complexity of some of their cocktails (this is probably why they are annoyed when you ask for them) - servers are meh. I was there once with a friend who gave a server a $20 to pay for a $5 beer. The server never returned with change. - food is sometimes really slow, the pacing also isn't right if you get apps (things some out at the same time or apps come out after your food).  I do like this place, and I'm sure I'll be back. However, if you're a person who gets annoyed easily be lack-luster service just avoid this place. Everyone who works here gives off a bad vibe.   Also, avoid this place like the plague on Friday and Saturday nights. It's slammed.

7fHy4UgO7610AqluJWEsog.text: $2 for an ice cube. In fairness, I've heard they chopper that ice in every morning from Maine.

ieqNRB9-XFdLu40hangK9g.text: I went here on a date on a Thursday night. It was so so loud, we could barely hear each other without screaming. That is definitely my biggest complaint. It absolutely has to do with the high ceilings, which just makes everything seem louder. But the food was awesome, and the drinks were so good. I got the truffle, mushroom, and brie flatbread. It was the perfect size for me, but then again, I was not very hungry. It was the size of a tiny personal pizza. My date got some fries that looked good, but I did not try them. For my drink I got the rock and rye. It came with plenty of ice (I loooooove lots of ice in my drinks!) and it was delicious. It was perfect. And I had two, so I had a little buzz going. Which is great for a date. Ha. But we decided to leave and go to another bar to keep drinking because of the noise. The staff was courteous, but it really was annoying that we had to scream at our server to be heard. I would have liked to have stayed and kept drinking, but oh well. Maybe it is better on like a Monday.

HNi2_TERmnbA7_T92vPWzg.text: This place is weak.  Decide what you want to be....a restaurant, cocktail bar, sports bar, lounge..the drinks are pricey and although they have put forth effort toward quality it does not work for me.  Prepare to spend a lot of money and have loud rock music and espn on the televisions.  BLAH!

XufnY94AsMxRhh71hIAV_A.text: For the first time ever, I had a horrible experience at industry.  We were seated in the new room off to the side, which was nice looking, but cramped.   The place was busy as usual, but the service was horrible. Our waitress barely acknowledged us most of the night.  What would normally be an hour-long meal turned into two and a half hours of sitting around.   Just about every beer out party requested from the list was gone (we were told that the list was very outdated). With a selection like theirs, the draft list should be updated daily.   When our food came, mine was barely warm and. My fries were tiny scraps of cold leftover fries. Another person at the table had a hot meal with normal-sized fries.   The waitress barely stopped by and we ended up only getting two beers each. Two beers in 2.5 hours? I couldn't even maintain a nice buzz.   There were no apologies for the delays and, in fact, we sat there with the table cleared for the last half hour and finished out jug of water before she came back and asked if we wanted the check.    I know she was busy, but that service is unacceptable. Especially after noticing the wait staff sitting around bitching about how busy it was and one of the kitchen staff was standing around at the urinal in the men's room talking on the phone about how busy they were.  If it's so busy, get out there and get things caught up.    Is Industry getting too big for its britches?

j41uA0jvdMXHBwFegbAVIA.text: My wife and I thought this place looks really cool from the outside when we looked and so we decide to give it a shot. We both ordered burgers. The burgers came out cooked to extra well done and super dry but we ordered the burgers medium rare of which they asked us the temperature of the burger we want to cook so we were very disappointed about that. The burger ingredients were also very very odd. zucchini on a burger? The taste just didn't go together. We told the server about the burgers being very overcooked and she didn't seem really do care she just said OK.

D_L4-ywA4Cxj8_0W2bg7YQ.text: Fantastic drink selection,  a well thought out cocktail menu, and reasonable food.  The supper dishes are a bit lacking in vegetables, but the 20 some things here don't need the carrots.  They have dual walls of TV screens for sports games, but it isn't trying too hard to be a sports bar.  The staff are attentive and are not overly hipsterish.  Good place to take a date who enjoys cocktails.  The place is medium loud but not so loud you need a cochlear implant to hear your dining partner.

gZ6PSQOUStYnlKd5jSIgkw.text: The place has a big city vibe to it, but the service is as unpretentious as it gets.  I've been there twice now (both this week), once for cocktails, and went back three days later because I wanted to try their food.  The beverages:  I've ordered two manhattans, whatever the last drink on their  drink list was, and their own Copper Kettle draft.  You can get any of their whiskeys smoked with your choice of mesquite, apple wood, and like three other woods.  I prefer the apple wood, its not as heavy but flavorfull.  Note:  you will get ash in your drink, but it won't kill you.  I had one manhattan smoked and one not.  Their's are different here, they don't use bitters, nor cherries.  Instead they use orange zest in which they heat to bring the flavors out (very important) and a secret ingredient.  ( I was really suprised we i was told what it was, but you'll have to ask)  The signature drink i had was pretty tasty, but i'm not a sweet drink guy.  The beer was pretty good...Full Pint does their brewing so it can't be bad.  The Food:  I had a prime rib or steak sandwich with horseraddish and truffle fries.  The fries were great, but the gorganzola masks the truffle oil, and the sandwhich had great meat, but was missing the kick that i was hoping for from the horseraddish.  the bread was also really buttery so I would order something else with company.

nZKX4RxiZfafWs4gfuzO0w.text: Can't be beat in Lawrenceville. Food is terrific, staff is friendly and the tap list is insane. Great place to catch a game or chase tail.

FYCsUdl1M3283l_jJjQs1A.text: We found ourselves once again  celebrating the holiday season with my husband's colleagues at the Industry Public House. My last review ranted raved about the service and the food, and I gave them a well deserved 5 stars, but we weren't as impressed this time. Not that anything was WRONG, but just not deserving that coveted 5 star rating. Our sever, while friendly, wasn't as good as who we had last year. We waited FOR EVER for just about everything.. food orders, drinks, boxes.. everything. He forgot to ring in one persons order and they sat there empty handed until we were all long finished our meals. I got the Brussel sprouts once again because last time I was hooked on them and anticipating my next opportunity to have them, and I was so terribly let down. They changed the way they make them, I guess, and it was such a disappointment. I truly just didn't like them.. and it was sad.  My husband wasn't crazy about his burger, he said the aoli was way over powering. He didn't eat more than half of it, which is not normal, haha. I mean, not to say we won't return, but I'm hoping that last time wasn't just a fluke.. we'll see what happens the next time we go, I guess.

zTcAWgXskuYBHYVBrRaiWQ.text: Food was ok but it was a great atmosphere and service. Excellent beer and whiskey selection.

D_RqeVXXeGGSjqGVI3yE3w.text: I can never decide if I really want to like Industry or really want to hate it.  PLUSES:  +Good food.  Try just about any sandwich. +Excellent beer selection +The best bourbon list in Pittsburgh.  If I didn't like bourbon so much, I'd never go back.  The Smokestack is super amazing. +Like pretty much every bar in Pittsburgh, the game is always on.  There is especially good TV placement here.  CONS: +The service is spotty.  I've had to wait 45 minutes for a drink at at 5:30pm on a Wednesday when there were maybe 8 people at the bar.  I've also had a server profusely apologize for food took a few minute longer than expected when we weren't even all that concerned about it. +The crowd.  Seriously, the crowd.  There are a lot of my-loafers-cost-more-than-your-car bros here.  I absolutely never again will go here without at least one male in the group to repel the bros.

kuWQoMLo6aSK785iLEvxkg.text: 60 craft beers on tap? i'm in heaven............bartender Fife and can't remember the guy's name were very knowledgeable and the nachos were fantastic........love this place, too bad  not closer to home!

4ud9QQZDZxvT93pt-yBq2g.text: Two words:  Candied Bacon.  To die for.  Comes in a basket with lots of strips of candied bacon.  Whoever invented this is a genius.  This place has an AWESOME selection of craft beer on tap, and a massive selection of bourbon, which they will prepare in a very special way - SMOKED.  No kidding.  They smoke bourbon right at the bar, so the place smells awesome when you walk in.  I give this place four stars instead of three just because of the great selection of taps and bourbons. (and the candied bacon)  But as far as the rest of the menu goes, it's kind of a mixed bag.  The soup was obviously homemade and pretty good.  The nachos plate was huge with lots of toppings, but there weren't enough chips to support all of the stuff on top, and they turned to mush rather quickly.  The pot roast fries were homey and reasonably priced, the french fries served with the burger were mushy.  But they are so new that they are working out the bugs.  There were so many people in the place and the staff was so new that there were many problems with the kitchen.  (including sending out the wrong burger to our party.  Yuck - who puts fresh spinach WITH the stems on a burger?)  The staff was enthusiastic and trying hard, but were just getting their feet wet since the place had only been open for a week.   I'll visit again - hopefully the kinks will be worked out.

ulge0sLEsYO40wW4VtV_Qw.text: Really cool atmosphere but the food was just ok and borderline bland.  While I won't go out of my way to eat here again I wouldn't be opposed to give it a second chance.  I will definitely be back for drinks.

1IrtpKR51bnGqiZ5nI9yqw.text: Came here for a bachelor party. Both the atmosphere and the food was top notch. Our server was also superb and accommodated all of our needs. I would recommend this place for large groups!

1xAIirG1QUZIicKvxLS9Dg.text: Good beer selection (stick with beer-the mixed drinks I and my sister found to be pretty adventurous but a swing and a miss...yucky actually).  The food is actually trendy and on par with other cities, so that was great to experience in the Burgh.

q973ICCdGP15KUga8oPjvA.text: Awesome! Food is delicious, especially the buffalo Mac and cheese and the boar bacon. Drinks are creative and well made. Atmosphere is chill and trendy without being obnoxious. Kind of expensive, but worth it.

BehJ4_9roCCe9nLna5DucA.text: Service was below average.  Food was ok, nothing exceptional. Prices were high for portion sizes and flavor. I probably won't be returning to give it a second chance.

P-l9WjR4oud7hKO9Z85aiw.text: Tavern food that's decent but not much above a chain like TGIF or Chili's. The salads are tasty but ingredients are sized for mouth of mammoth - requiring professional knife skills to retain everything in the serving bowl. Too much work offsets the enjoyment factor. The lamb wrap was just not good at all. But decent beers on draft. And loud so good for both big (drinking) groups and small children alike! Service was very friendly but everything took a long time to get to the table, probably not the servers fault but likely a function of how everything in the back of the house is set up.

H1S9N9LFSkI6yR97LtqTqQ.text: I am sitting at the bar as I type this. I have never posted anything on Yelp before until now. That is how ridiculous what just happened is IMHO. I ordered a glass of Glenmorangie neat. The menu says 11.  The bartender says "That it will be 14." I point out that the menu says 11. She then informs me that they "up charge" for neat. I am confused and the look on my face shows it. I say, "You charge for no ice?". To which she says, neat means more alcohol. I'm dumbfounded and we go back and fourth about the meaning of neat and she insist that's what bars do. That is not what "bars" do. That is what this place does.  I have had Scotch neat in a hundreds of bars and restaurants (dives to very fine dining) across the country and never once has anyone charged me above menu price because I don't want water down liquid gold. Big time disappointment.    After paying, I looked at the menu a second time and it does mention it at the bottom under "Up Grades".  There are several so called up grade items that were unfamiliar to me and nondescript.  The one she hit me with was listed as "Rocks/Neat +2", which implies both are a 2 dollar charge.  With there already being a large mark up on alcohol, is it necessary to add 2 dollars for not wanting ice?  It is if your "on the rocks" pours are so small, that pouring a drink neat would show how much you are ripping people off.  I would rather you establish a consistent pour and charge me the same rate than flim flam me.

Pz5B8LYrK63wNUnTCOvWOQ.text: Love their cocktails! I eat their burgers without the meat, and they still tasted good! It felt very new yorky

pebqLPgLaJXGOFiZATH3vg.text: Very loud, but sometimes that not a bad thing. Beyond that however, it doesn't get too much better. The food was good, but not what you'd call hot. I think they must be working through a bottle-neck at the kitchen from their expansion. Waitstaff was friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Workerburger is awesome and fries are good. Don't expect a quick in and out. Great drinks. Will probably return in a few months to see how/if they've worked out their growth issues.

EWnk6MxnnCZvbMXB-vmdIw.text: I LOVE the beer selection!  The happy hour half price flatbread was really good. We had the southwest flatbread. My entree ordered the Reuben. Not so impressive. Very hard to eat and chew. Also ordered at the table was the pig burger. They ate it all and said was very tasty. Now on to the ambience. Everyone was taking their cell phones out and using their flashlights to read the menu. Lightening is very dim. I felt sorry for an older coupler that was seated in a corner. I personally don't know how they even ordered. There was no way they could see. The waitress gave them her cell phone to use to read menu. The bar is promising. Need to do something with the lighting. And for goodness sake take the Reuben off the menu.

Pcbysm_c7ypdZZhbq73--Q.text: TL;DR: Bartender increased my tip without my knowledge, twice.  Went to Industry twice while on a work trip. Service and food were okay, not outstanding but nothing to complain about.  While filling out expense reports, I found that on both occasions the bartender increased my tip. On the first occasion by $1, and on the second by $2. I was not being cheap with tips just under 20%.   This is actually criminal activity. Anyone who goes here should check their credit cards.

-vtFE1tbcbOoMoBR7vuizg.text: Really good whiskey and beer selection to choose from along with a unique menu. Definitely try the smokestack cocktail if you like smokey flavors and an awesome experience service was good and environment was just what you would expect from a public house! Don't miss if you are in the area!

SkFkZ0LydF04C5rOJT8Bmw.text: I've been to Industry a couple of times now and I am unimpressed. While their beverage selection is fantastic, their service, and their food leave a lot to be desired. During my last visit, I ordered the Worker Burgher. It looked pretty fantastic. On the first bite I didn't care much for the bun. However, the meat patty was amazing. Perfectly seasoned, properly cooked, succulent. the onions and the goat cheese were perfect complements. I felt like finally I had found something I could get on board with food wise  at this place. (I had the Reuben previously and I'd never order that again.) then it all when downhill. On my third bite, I found a twsity tie inside of my hamburger. While our server and the manager both apologized and my hamburger was comped, I found little enjoyment finishing my meal. Perhaps it was my psyche, but I didn't feel so great later on that night. I was experiencing some pretty terrible stomach cramps for the rest of the evening. While I find the ambience of the place to be pretty cool, I think I'm gonna be passing up on future visits. What a shame. I was really trying to like the place.

sQGT3wrRQYyJG5sptm8gbA.text: This review pertains to the doorman only. I've been there previously and taken both clients and friends and have always been pleasantly greeted by Angel and the other great bartenders. That being said, I will never set foot in the establishment again. While perhaps venturing to offer some downtown verisimilitude to a newly and thankfully re-gentrified Lawrenceville, the proprietors of Industry Pub House have made a sizable error in judgement with their choice of low-brow angry urban door guy. If what you're after is what I think it is: upwardly mobile young professionals seeking a quality setting for upscale food and drink, then staffing your otherwise attractive space with a cretan incapable of proper social interaction who exercises a blatant disrespect and a chip-on-the-shoulder kind of contempt for the very kind of patrons he is ostensibly hired to make feel welcome seems a self-defeating proposition. Chase this peasant out of there and relegate him to fields he may properly plow, namely scummy 18-and-older trash warehouses in some other dilapidated part of town. He deserves no quarter in this setting. Good burgers though, shame we won't be back.

tzTQT1ZITVw56fcJvBkaOw.text: we went here on a weekend and we couldn't move around at all.  a drunk fratty clientelle seems to be the niche market here.  it was just kind of trashy like carson st unhingend.  I love the look of the brick and lightbulbs but it just seems like a corporate interpretation of something that used to be cool, applied to an unfortunately gross clientelle..  i hate to be so harsh but it just saddens me to see a place like this emerge in lawrenceville.

VaauOAekIorQ6RXipE7Alg.text: Industry is great for a late night bite, the boneless wings especially.  Their beer selection is extensive as well as their whiskies. You can rack up a hefty tab pretty quickly but the drinks are well made and the smokestack they even set on fire.   Weekends can get crowded so if you want a table make a reservation or get their earlier. The bar fills up fast too even the second bar is usually packed so seats are a hot commodity.  Overall Industry is a trusty go to when I want some appetizers and a good beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. This is the cutest thing I have ever eaten. Lamb in a pumpkin w/ pomegranate seeds, arugula &amp; a delicious cream sauce.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Feasting out of a pumpkin and it was delicious!

0_h-MRwaKz8ZOD73xCCzDQ.text: Always been a good choice. I generally get a burger and trick out the fries with one of the specialty options: truffle, chili & cheese, or pot roast fries.... #YOLO!     Love love love that they carry Arsenal Cider House Ciders, my favorite.     Service generally leaves something to be desired, but it's not that big a deal.      Heads up, the menu listed online is different than in the restaurant, not seasonally, just like they made some subtle changes and forgot to update.     Def recommend

ztL1zWMeXUqCaFElRRDg8Q.text: Industry is a great place to grab a cocktail, beer, or some really good food.  I recommend going down for lunch or dinner rather than late night as it gets pretty crowded and very loud.  Went over the weekend and our group grabbed some amazing cocktails. I got the Carnegie Cucumber, a wonderful gin cocktail that was amazingly refreshing. The only one I remember someone getting was the Peachtree Street, which was also very good.   Their beer selection is very good as well, and I've definitely had some solid choices on that front in the past.  The food selection is vast and they always have really interesting specials. This week it was a duck burger (awesome.) I opted for the Fried Green Tomato Caprese salad, which was fantastic. Apricot bacon basil mozzarella topped it off, which was heavenly.  The service at Industry can be a little slow and its kinda loud on Fri/Sat nights. Otherwise, its a solid choice in Lawrenceville that I need to remember to go to more.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

cqhY4xXdp53iFug7jQzH-w.text: I stopped in here on a Wednesday night around 11:30 after a concert. The place was pretty dead and we had a seat at the bar. It took a few minutes for someone to notice us which was surprising because there were plenty of people working and there weren't many customers there. The atmosphere is pretty cool with the lighting and exposed brick. I also had to venture into the bathroom to "assess" the situation there. Looked pretty clean.  It was late, so we were craving some pub food. The only menu given to us was an appetizer menu so that must be all that is available in the later hours which is understandable. I opted for the pot roast filament fries after seeing a good review about them on here. I also went with the parmesan pop corn because I was pretty famished.  Pot roast fries were everything I had hoped for. The gravy had soaked it's way into the fries and the onion straws added the perfect crunch to the soggy fries. Definitely something you have to eat with a fork unless you want to make a mess of yourself.  The parmesan popped corn was bland though, There really wasn't much flavor and I had to salt it up quite a bit to get it to my liking. Even a quick spritz of sprayed butter would have helped tremendously.  All in all, not a bad experience for 11:30 on a Wednesday night. After we were noticed and given menus, the service was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Parmesan popped corn and pot roast fries!

Nr02jHExjx84lDfmdFYUjw.text: Five of us went for dinner for my son's bday........it was wonderful!  We all enjoyed our meals and the server was excellent!  We will definitely go back and have already told friends and family they should go.

NuDu619M7zuFSnOugfBnmg.text: Located on Lawrenceville's cool Butler Street, Industry Public House looks great, very industrial-rustic yet comfortable.  I especially liked the light fixtures.  The huge garage door-style windows are also really neat and unique for the area since, let's face it, PA weather ain't so temperate and thus I imagine the number of days per year the doors (windows) can remain comfortably open is limited.  Lucky for us, the weather during our recent Lawrenceville outing was just right for sitting at a big open window with a sweater, a meal, and a couple drinks.  Food was good, not fantastic but good enough to probably bring us back at some point.  Burgers were tasty, though my burger--or "burgher" as they call them here--was ordered medium-rare but arrived with very little pink.  My guy ordered his burger medium and got well done instead.  Overcooking aside, the patty seasoning and toppings and quality of beef were solid.  Husband's fries had an impressive texture, and my simple side salad--greens only; came with no tomatoes, cucumber, etc.--with a sweet house balsamic vinaigrette was satisfying enough.  The best part of our lazy Sunday lunch experience was that our food was free.  After more than 45 minutes of waiting the manager appeared and explained that our ticket had come in behind a large party, presumably the group in the private room nearby.  Manager handled everything professionally and satisfactorily, and we were happy to only have to pay for our drinks, needless to say!  And speaking of the drinks, Husband was impressed with the $4.50 house IPA (said it tasted similar to Sculpin), and at $7 each the couple mimosas I ordered were a decent size and price.  I think it's worth noting that the bathrooms are dark.  Nice, but really dark.  We overheard others mentioning this as well.  Good luck if you have something in your eye or need to fix your make-up.  3 stars for now.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Management Burgher &amp; Fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Worker Burgher &amp; Side Salad
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Out Front

V0DIyc51JODTjeN0ta6rUA.text: We stopped by on a Sunday at 4 pm in the afternoon. The place was fairly empty. We were seated and then waited and waited and then waited some more for our waiter... after 15 mins passed I walked up to the hostess to very nicely enquired where our waiter was. Another 5 min went by and our waiter finally dropped by with some water. I ordered a White Wiggle Whiskey but it turned out not only had they run out of that type but they had no stocks of Wiggle Whiskey left at all. Lucky for my friend his beer was available yet took nearly 10 mins to arrive at our table.   I had been to Industry Public House before on a Thursday night and had a great time. The place was packed yet the service was great. Not sure what happened this time but it was a definite fail.

yJ3H7dKuPIJ6V0Xt3NTS4A.text: It's decent. We've been a couple times and always feel like it's expensive for what you're getting. If you are looking for something quick, try one of their many beers and the nachos.

ZFurhTvT1u9nt67Cv_4XiA.text: I made reservations 2 weeks in advance for a birthday party that I was hosting. I requested a specific table in the bar section because it was a high top so people could come and go throughout the night without it being a "sit down dinner" I called to confirm the reservations a couple days before and everything was confirmed. When we arrived, they placed us at a low top table in the back restaurant area. I explained that my reservations were specific. They looked at in their book and realized that they had made a mistake. Management quickly solved the problem and relocated people so we could have the table that we reserved. After that, the service was great and we had a nice night.

6pl5szMKoYM9_Al3PNV0lw.text: It's always super loud in here, so I'm not sure how you can enjoy a good conversation. Don't expect to be able to hear the person next to you. The food is decent, but pricey. I enjoy the pot roast fries. The draft/cocktail list is good and the happy hour sounds like the best time to be here.

GsEKHOdZGnDgNJUJG2q7XQ.text: I have been here quite a few times now, but every time I find myself being surprised at how good the food is.  Anything on the menu that has pot roast in it is sure to be a good decision--appetizers, entrees, sandwiches. I also love the Lucy furnace, their portobello sandwich.  The most recent time I was here we got a few things off their late night menu, which still included some great choices--pot roast nachos, fries, pizza.  I really like coming here for their large selection of draft beers, at great prices. They have a lot of local options, and change the menu seasonally-great to try new beers. I'm not a whiskey person, but those that are seem to like their smoke stacks-pick your whiskey and wood flavor that the bartender will light on fire to "infuse" for you.   It is a surprisingly large venue, with additional seating in a side room, so I've never felt cramped even when it does it busy on a Friday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pot roast fries
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Late night nachos
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bbq chicken pizza

dH_OOYfgH3kO3kyublGlmQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and great drinks! We had the pot roast, crab cakes, fish n' chips, stacked smokehouse, and fries topped with pot roast and gravy. Everything was excellent.

3wjke2rpRx2w0GiYaTW40w.text: Wow!  This place is beautiful inside!    I feel like this is just what Lawrenceville needed.  A large, casual restaurant with no agenda.  Come one, come all!  The menu is all American, with lots of the faves, burgers, fries, etc.  Main dishes are lobster mac n' cheese (saved for another time fo' sho!), meatloaf, etc.  But the place is huge, with a massive bar in the center and chairs and tables spread out around the outside.  It's something I think Lola was missing... accessible for large groups with a casual atmosphere.    But the shinning star?  The drinks!  The drink list is actually much longer than the menu!  They have a full page devoted to fancy schmancy liquor based bevvies.  A then a couple pages of beer and wine.  It's very impressive!  They all sounded good, even the whiskey one, I'm not even a whiskey fan.  I choose the Carnegie Cucumber.  It was phenomenal.  They served it the right way.  Hendrick's Gin with cucumber.  Most places serve it with a lime, yuck!  The cucumber was actually soaked in gin.  I dare you to eat the whole thing, it's just a slice, but it's potent alone!    For dinner I ordered the Portobello Burger with fries.  Now let me preface this by saying it had all my fave ingredients.  Fresh mozz cheese and a porto soaked in vinegar.  Now I love me some vinegar but I felt like it was a tad too much.  That's a shocking statement for me to say.  But my friend thought hers was great, so maybe I was having an off vinegar night:)  I mean, it was still totally tasty and I ate the whole thing... I just may venture over to something else next time.  Fries were good and fresh and crispy to my liking.    The real thing I had my eye on from the start was this amazing looking birthday cake cocktail.  Forgive me for not remember the name.  Seriously all I can remember is the massive amount of frosting that rimmed my glass... WITH SPRINKLES!  This was my dessert and I enjoyed every alcoholic second!  It was funny to have taste the sweet icing against the strong liquor inside the glass.  Made with the cake batter liquor, it was really incredible and totally worth the splurge.  And by splurge I mean price - 11 bucks a pop - AND calories!    I can imagine this becoming a regular on the Lola circuit for me.  You'll find me in the corner sipping another fancy cocktail!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6SjhztvkToSmDW298Yw5IQ.text: So in my pursue of the tastiest wing in Pittsburgh I have come across this location - it's was purely accidental as I was next door picking up work shoes and was running late and needed a quick lunch - the side salad was fresh/ homemade Ranch dressing complimented it very well - ( did I mention that Homemade Dressing raises the bar when it comes to authentic food ) The Wings which was a fierce Carolina flavor was well mixed with flavor and fire - The wings were large and plumped but it was weird that it was only the lower wing served and not the Head ( drum stick) part of the wing - different! It was served with a custom/ homemade Bleu Cheese Dressing with a kick, not was good as the old Buffalo Blue Restuarant in East Liberty!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Carolina Fierce
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side salad with cheese added

No6MPAZ8QFsBBd-Svz5CBA.text: I have heard mixed opinions in regards to Industry so I was excited to check it out for myself. For the most part, we did enjoy the experience. Thee service was good, as was the food.   I ordered Idustry's Carnegie cucumber cocktail and it was delicious. There was fresh cucumber and elderberry in it.   I was with a few friends and we chose to share a few appetizers. We ordered the industry egg rolls, fries with gorgonzola and truffle oil, the southwest flatbread and mac n' cheese with tasso ham. The egg rolls weren't bad but weren't that great either. I honestly forgot they were ordered until I jogged my memory to write this review. The fries were good but generally anything with cheese and truffle will make people happy. The pizza was the most popular of the items ordered, with corn and spicy chicken, but the menu stated that poblano peppers were on it as well and we could not find any. Lastly, the mac n' cheese could have been good aside from one minor (major) detail. The cheese sauce, tasty. The ham, excellent, the noodles, however, were so overcooked, I couldn't eat them. I would most likely go back but with so many more restaurants in Lawrenceville that have much better food, it won't be anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Disappointing Mac :(

Hh7ipkY4Fmkqcco1eYqmQA.text: I love this place. Food is great, atmosphere is amazeballs. Service not so much. MORGAN was my server. She gave me the impression that she didn't really want to be bothered. She did not want to answer questions about the menu and she took a very long time from initial visit to my table to bringing my order. Place wasn't busy. I guess she does not work on tips. I also ordered a coffee, they didn't bring out any sweetener or asked if I wanted it. On top of that I had to use a butter knife to stir my coffee. Also, the drink manmosa...horrible. Avoid at all cost. I had to ask other services twice if they could get her for me. When I requested my check her mouth was full of food. Will I visit again? Yes, it was one poor experience. There management team is very good.

7OZe7Z-AJXY2zEVAtzFlXg.text: So many mixed reviews about Industry!  Was here for a birthday celebration, and it wasn't crowded for a 9pm reservation for 15 on a Wednesday. We were seated at a nice table by the open window. It was a little breezy, but I had a jacket.  Like others, I am impressed by the draft list--but the prices! $5 for an East End Black Stout? Yes, please! Beer ranges from $4 to $9, and I even saw an 11% ABV Stone Double Bastard Ale for $7. These aren't even the happy hour prices, when from 4:30 - 6:30 pm, everything on tap is $2 off. They also brew three of their own beers, I.P.H., a copper ale, and a hot blast habenero pale ale. They also listed three of Arsenal's ciders, all 8.5% and $9.  For the food menu, there were 3-4 choices that I was stuck between. I've seen the pictures of the handhelds, but then the reviews on the burgers make me want to try those too. I decided on a $13 worker burgher, rare, with sweet potato fries instead of the regular fries. I didn't notice the wait for the food, since our large party's conversation passed the time.   I was SUPER excited seeing my burger! With a cute little toothpick that read "RARE," it seemed like they just knew I was going to take a picture. It was all set up, the top bun on a little tilt so that the juicy patty, super dry goat cheese, mushrooms, and arugula were showing their best side. The sweet potato (in waffle fry form!) had confectioner's sugar sprinkled on top of a few of the rounds. I'll ask for it without sugar next time. Otherwise they were perfectly crunchy and sweet.  The only downside to my first experience at IPH was that I was sitting by a window, so the food got cold quickly in 50 degree nighttime weather. Cold sweet potato fries are still good, but not rare meat. I eat slowly, so I had to box part of that burger.  The service was ok; I'll give them the benefit of the doubt because the party was of 15 and some people came late. They were accommodating. The server may have been a little overwhelmed but he pulled it off.   I tried my friend's foods:  Truffle fries - The potatoes felt like just a vehicle, and it would probably be better on top of something meaty like chicken or a fish. Upgraded pot roast fries - Not extraordinary for the upcharge.  We were a party of ~15, so with tip, my meal came out to $25. I'll come back during happy hour for another stout and a sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Worker burgher, rare, with sweet potato fries. These waffle fries come sprinkled with confectioner&#39;s sugar. *****
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Draft list 6/8/16. Happy hour is 4:30-6:30 Monday through Friday! $2 off drafts, $5 house wine, and $7 featured cocktails.

tc9Ta-VWA9Ra_gQptni1Ng.text: Great spot, high-quality made cocktails, better than typical bar food

srskekZmwFsvjYRl7TnMPA.text: A nice trendy bar with a good selection on taps and bottles. I'd definitely recommend trying their smoked stack - these guys know what they are doing with it.   If you want a nice bar atmosphere, it's definitely the one to go to amongst the many in Lawrenceville.   They do a decent job at food as well. My favorites include the Mac and Cheese and the risotto. I have heard the burgers are good as well.   Good place to hang out with a group or alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ANtKoax5ryqXXt3M8JJAww.text: Smoke stack, anyone?  My first experience at Industry was for PGH Craft Beer Week when they had a beer pairing event with Yards Brewery.  Delicious beer combined with savory and succulent food?  Yes please.  But I didn't feel it was fair to review a venue based on one event.vvWhen I returned to Industry, I'm happy to say my experience only got better.    Friends and I met for drinks and dinner.  I was CRAVING a burger and I was incredibly pleased with what I ordered - Farmed Out Burgher with aged white cheddar/wild boar bacon/fried egg/BBQ sauce.  Juicy and flavorful are simply understatements.  I wish I could remember the name of my cocktail - something with scotch and absinthe... delicious!  They also have an incredible craft beer list as well as Arsenal Ciders.  My favorite thing about Industry - other than the decor and food - is the Smokestack.   Take one of your favorite bourbons, drizzle in some maple syrup & throw a few dashes of bitters. Then torch some wood to lightly infuse a fresh smoke to the bourbon.  Try it with cherry, mesquite, apple, maple, or pecan wood!  You cannot go wrong with this drink - and you'll make everyone around you jealous!   When you're in Lawrenceville and looking for incredible drinks with some flavorful food, get a little "smokey" at Industry Public House

Hv8Eb7dj3TBLp5qBUO9DPg.text: While it's cool that this spot has a giant drink menu to chose from it seems like they are on the more expensive side. The inside has a cool modern "industry" feel, but doesn't really invite me in as a spot I'd want to hang out at for more than a sporting event. I suppose that what's it's good for though.  Want a manly drink? They will burn cedar chips over your whiskey to add the smokey taste to a nice drink; Taste like a camp fire! I didn't eat, but friends told me they all loved their food. Even still, the final thought when the check came was "overpriced".

oE8FhtCLclbSVjU7Flz86Q.text: We were actually planning a night out at Arsenal Cider House, but they were closed so a friend recommended Industry.  I'm not hipster enough to be hanging out in Lawrenceville (at either location, really) but I was pleasantly surprised by Industry. There was a good mix of clientele, which made me feel less out-of-place.   The beer selection was great, with lots of local choices, but on the expensive side. I had (a few sips of) a $10 dollar cocktail, but it was too much/strong for me. I guess this is good considering it was $10, but I just couldn't get past the flavor. My friends were able to get past it just fine... multiple times. We didn't personally order the smoked whiskey, but a lot of other patrons partook. Fun to watch.   The food however was really hit or miss. My friends ordered burgers and had no complaints, but I got buffalo mac & cheese and it was just downright bad.   All and all, I'd go back if for no other reason than really liking the look/feel of the place + their beer selection.

h7pHd5QUFOjgJ_qJWha30Q.text: This place is OK. It is the place for people who don't live in Lawrenceville to go when they come to check out Lawrenceville.   In off hours Industry is decent with lots of beers, average pub fair and good service. However, when this place is busy the volume level is deafening and the "tourists" are annoying as hell and you might as well be on the Southside.   In short... Go for a beer when it is quite and bail as soon as the crowds start to arrive.

cOMuX_SqWlra6INgyGHovA.text: Have to start by saying that while I didn't drink while there, they do have a great selection to choose from. Also was impressed by the food, in particular the truffle fries and the smoke stack sandwich...both were excellent, will definitely be going back for a few drinks and a hearty meal.

EGK7WtT18rHz0KRmFA5FqQ.text: Usually always a good time here, but with its gaining popularity expect to have a longer wait time for drinks and food. I've only had one semi-negative experience here where the waitress seemed pretty frustrated with the crowd but every other time I have been to Industry, servers have been nice and accommodating. More of a party scene than a chill location like it used to be.

49NONu8th7p_Nnj4IpHs-w.text: It's a nice place to go have a drink....food is not consistently good.  I have had good meals and horrible meals.  Overrated in my opinion

SnKFuciO6JsJkj-4OJWmlA.text: I've always wanted to love you, Industry Public House, but I just can't get myself to that point. I don't know what it is about you, but every time I've been (whether that's for dinner or just a drink), there's something that turns me off and leaves me thinking I should have just gone somewhere else. Sometimes its your server's lack of service or making me feel not welcomed, while other times its just been the taste of the food. I love the ambiance of your space - the industrial look and feel is awesome, but  I want an all around connection - not just with the space. Won't you communicate this to your staff?

sOI_8NClEddMRFRLa_6Kxg.text: Great food, especially the burgers, but kitchen can be slow at times. The Smokestacks are unique and awesome if you like Bourbon. Can get crowded at times.

N6iZURPUHW2ib_TkzaeOEw.text: Beer selection is really good.  Food:  I stick to the burger (which is a good deal at $5 from 430-630 Monday thru Friday) and the chicken nachos which are huge and really good. The rest is probably good seems a little overpriced but overall really good.

jF22Hc0zEon8ryOgwWayBQ.text: Attentive service, 60 beers and ciders on tap and a variety of food options.  A great place to stop on the way to or from the airport.

JOe2sr3KA60Pk4vS_r-hSg.text: My friend and I came in early in the evening on a Saturday and we were able to find a good spot at the bar. I had the Farmed Out Burgher with Pot Roast Fries and wow. Just wow. I am unfortunately not a bourbon/whiskey drinker so I had the Industry Copper Ale and an Arsenal Fighting Elleck. The bartenders were awesome too! They saved us from this very drunk and creepy man who was sitting next to my friend. I would definitely go back the next time I'm in town!

ZbVyEVSLg82oPnkMyV8MTw.text: I wanted to give this place 4 or even 5 stars, but I just cannot.  The Not So Good: This place has an awesome drink list.  A full list of tap beers, 2 more pages of bottles.  An awesome list of speciality drinks.  So when J and I came in on a Sunday afternoon and tried to order two separate beers, I was stunned when they didn't have either one of them.  Why tease your patrons with thinking they can get a big selection if they can't?  Also, J got a burger - which was too peppery - and truffle fries.  $17?!?!  Seriously.  That's just too much.   The good:  I got an awesome salad called the Hand Looper - onions, oyster mushrooms, beets, goat cheese and shallot vinagrette - all awesome.  I added steak which was cooked perfectly.  All in all, awesome.  The dressing was super light, but still really flavorful and it was on a gigantic bed of fresh spinach.    I think I would go back, but it's hard to say.

dT67kKUno4W0Lh35iljLoA.text: Food was decent. Fish and chips was heavily breaded, but the fries were good. Mac and cheese was pretty good. A nice mix of cheeses and the pasta was cooked well. But......  Service was awful, like truly awful. We watched our food sit at the kitchen window for at least 10 minutes. Took forever to get the servers attention to get the check.   Will not be coming back. Too many other good places in town to come back.

TqQcehLG4ac3Dh1fealTKg.text: I've been hearing about this place for a while.   It was worth the look-see.   It was a quick lunch for me.  No drinks but the beer and bourbon section was impressive.    The Model "T"urkey sandwich was huge and satisfying.  The sourdough was perfectly done.   I'll definitely be back to explore more of the menu.

8-oy1DiHwlRnN9iGT2pzuA.text: Been in twice now; once for drinks only and the other time for dins (and the group tried every cocktail on the list). I'll be back. But only for drinks, at least until I feel confident they've had time to work out the kitchen kinks. Allow me to elaborate:   There are positives. Drink menu is totally solid. East End "house" brews, good micro draft selection, and plenty of bottles. I'm not a whiskey or bourbon girl, but I tried the wood-chipped smoked concoctions and they are delicious (albeit, seemingly inconsistent based on the bartender. some swirl and others shake the smoke). Bartenders are attentive. It's a cool environment with character.   Then ... there are negatives. It's loud. Super loud. If you're sitting toward the back of the place (near the kitchen), prepare to lose your voice having a conversation.   Aaaaannnd the food:  I ordered the Rooted Burger, after the server tried to sell me on a salad instead (I wanted a burger ... not a salad). It is 100% house made veggie burger, with what the chef explained as a base/binder of zucchini, bulger wheat, and a few other 'root' vegetables. The first burger that came out was cold in the center and essentially a pile of mush, and relatively bland. The server readily took it back, but explained that's why she had tried to sell me on the salad. Well ... alright then.   So the chef comes out to ask me what the deal is with the burger. I kindly explain that it is just mushy, a little cold, and I'd like it cooked through more. He counters that this is the healthiest thing on the menu, it's all housemade, and he just pattied them today. That's all well and good ... I would expect nothing less ... but that doesn't mean it should be mushy. Don't wax poetic on how it's made in house.   A new burger is presented to me. It's clear the fries have just been re-dipped in the oil, because now they're so greasy they slip through my fingers. It's crispier on the outside and hot, which definitely helps. Still needed salt. Chef comes back out to ask how it is, I said it's all good - but spend more time draining the zucchini and figure out the consistency.   Long story short: don't defend the food it it just isn't right. Figure it out. There may be some awesome things on the menu, but right now I think there are a ton of great ideas and a lack of execution. It's not unusual in a new restaurant, but they should trim it back and focus on perfecting a few items ... and go from there.

gEyDr1qmnxVdK3pFy5BZwA.text: We went on a Saturday night and obviously expected a wait. Hostess said 45 minutes.  We came back after 45 minutes and the hostess told us we were next.  We decided to wait at the bar.  After seeing her seat people prior to us, my friend walked over, confused, and the hostess told us it would be ANOTHER half hour! Obviously we were not happy. The manager was completely disrespectful and told us not to "yell" at his employee.  He did not even acknowledge the issue or care. He has no idea how to handle problems or be good at his job.    Therefore, we decided to sit at the bar and eat.  The only savior of this night was the bartender Stacy.  She was amazing and the manager should be really grateful he has her working there.  The food was ok, but my friend's salad was forgotten about and did not arrive till we were more than halfway done with our food and it was obviously tossed together at last minute.  I know this place is new, and I would have given it another chance, except the manager was a complete ass-hat.

wagw1ERA1dANgS6RqBOfnQ.text: I recently went with a friend on or monthly dinner out and had a great dinner Abbe several great beers. The was a wide range of beers on tap and even more in bottles. The dinners we ordered were tasty and delivered in a good amount of time. We were also entertained by the drink smoking process that was going on near us. Very fun to watch it being done! My only complaint was that there was a big group there that clogged the entrance..but once we got around them the whole experience was positive!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One of the bartenders smoking a drink.

oiFi7tJP4T4HtMZ7hwW3AA.text: Outstanding!! Food was excellent.. Definitely fresh ... Great draft selection... Have to try Smoke Stack infused whiskey... We had Jameson with apple wood chips ... Perfect!!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nl1Fs-Fn-mKdH0F9TD0ocg.text: This place is huge!! Love their decor and just how big their bar is!!! I unfortunately didn't have any of their food on this visit but did have a few draft beers. Their service was super nice and was able to find us extra seats so that we were able to join our party. This was definitely a place to meet up with friends and just spend a few hours. I also like the location of this place, right in the thick of it in Lawrenceville.

lSr5aTJFEjzTZQxXHJzozg.text: How do I put this?  How do I describe this place?  How am I suppose to use words to convey this experience?  OMGdeliciousscrumptousfingerlickingtrendylookingcomfortableanddidimentionDELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!  I think that may cover it.  This place seems to have a theme for people coming in.  You walk/drive by, see the front of the building, think to yourself 'what is Industry Public House,' throw it in reverse, and venture in.  This is one of those places that you are happy that you entered it.  The feel is industrial like in there, with the pulley system used for lighting, exposed brick, steel beams used for some of the hightops and the dark wood accents just right.  We were greeted and seated by the general manager.  First time I was ever at a restaurant and the general manager actually introduced himself and brought us our drinks.  Big thumbs up for you sir.  It took a while to browse the menu, but they were happy to let us do that, the staff was not there to rush us in any way.  When we finally decided on what we wanted it was a breeze after that.  Ordered the build to order nachos for the appy, so fresh, so good, so mouthwatering.  The mixture of food on that one plate alone was enough to convince me that this was a repeat place for me.  And we haven't even gotten to the main fare yet.  Back to the mixture of flavors, I had no clue black beans and pineapple could taste so good together...ok, I'll stop about that already.  Onto what i ordered for my main course, since it was lunch time I opted for one of their burgers.  I chose the Farmed Out burger.  The prochetta and BBQ sauce was amazing, not to mention the wild boar bacon.  The bun being toasted was amazing, fresh lettuce, tomato and onion...I did not need to add anything to this burger, just a napkin to catch the overflow of flavor.  The order of fries that come with it says 'fresh cut...'  I know what you are thinking.  But these were truly fresh cut...Reminded me of Potato Patch fries in Kennywood.  The taste was just so good, can tell they are not frozen at all.  Going for lunch here on a Saturday was an excellent idea.  Wasn't packed, staff was very friendly, and we could take our time in there without being rushed.  I also love the way they serve the water to you in a corked glass bottle, and they leave it for you so you don't have to wait for the inevitable moment when your mouth is full and the waitress asks if you need anything.  I'll definitely return here, maybe in the night time to check it out and see what crowds are like for the bar.

nLiKfYoU73dJwhDmyAqO6g.text: Industry seems to be a local favorite so I feel guilty writing this but this was one of the worst restaurants I've visited in awhile... And I eat out quite a bit.  My mom and I ordered the egg sandwich. It took 40 mins to come to our table during which our server only came by once to tell us it would be out in a few minutes.. 20 mins of it we could see a bunch of dishes just sitting under the heat lamps. When our meals finally came the bagels were rock hard - as in it hurt our teeth to eat it. The fries and the eggs were only luke warm.   I am a vegetarian so I asked for the meat to come on the side so my mom could still eat my bacon portion... Well they clearly forgot and picked the meat off afterwards cause it had residue on it. Lucky for them I'm not that anal about my food but in the vegetarian world that is a huge no-no!  Will never go back!

yzF_5TI2XIiW8aaWEVEunQ.text: My friends and I had lunch today and are entirely impressed with both the menu and the service. Our cocktails were well prepared. The entrees are delicious and I would especially recommend the turkey sandwich. The ice cream sandwiches, offered for dessert, are locally made and a treat. All around a value my money.

8V8JiAut_52EE9HCZKBkag.text: This place single handedly ruined Lawrenceville. It's filled with people who live in Wexford and recent college grads who think they're being edgy. Overpriced crap. If you like it, you are probably wearing a light rinse bootleg jean, pointy toed boots, and a sparkly black shirt on a Friday night.

UecUjlNV5Bvzap8iLxdQRQ.text: Another newish Pittsburgh gastropub that never fails to deliver, as long as there's nobody there.  The busier it gets, the more everything goes downhill.  It gets unbearably loud and the service gets pretty sloppy unless you are seated at the bar.  Go at 2 pm M-Th and get the nachos or chili.

4D0a7-0FozX40f3WOeSGyw.text: I gave this place average because of the food and service; as far as drink selection/unique cocktails, bar atmosphere, and beer selection it gets 4 or 5 stars. Its name speaks to the place; industrial, modern decor, dark, good mood lighting and atmosphere... 2/3 of the space is a bar, the other 1/3 is a dining room. Service is bad, but I suppose to someone in their 20's it may seem okay, but I have higher expectations when I go out nowadays.  The hostess asked if my boyfriend and I were okay sitting at a high top table in the bar for dinner. I said that I'd rather sit in the dining room where it is a bit quieter. She said that she only had 6 tops in there, I looked and there were four 6 tops! (yes, 24 seats), so I asked if we could just use one because my boyfriend has to give himself insulin and has an accessed port (permanent IV for his illness cystic fibrosis) and we'd rather not sit right next to someone in the bar , again she said she'd rather not sit us there because she'd have to turn away a party of 6 (I suppose if four of them showed up in the next hour and were unwilling to wait). So I said we were leaving and she gave us one (we should have left).   The food was blah. So bad in fact that I didn't eat it and left to go to another restaurant. Instant mashed potatoes and enhanced chicken. I asked if I could have a salad instead of the veggie, waiter said no problem. So he brings me a bowl of lettuce. I asked if they put anything on their salads, he said that it would be an up charge. I told him that I assumed a salad was more than lettuce and had I been informed that I needed to pay for salad "toppings" I would have paid for it instead of being served a bowl of lettuce.   The place seems nice, but the staff try way too hard to be hip and trendy that it comes off tacky.  The space is nice, I think the wait staff just need to be a little more down to earth. Go here if you want to drink with friends, but I would steer clear for dinner.

mcz7dnCNk4yAMGQZ3aHT4A.text: The food was decent but not good enough to justify the price. The atmosphere is charming and the staff are kind (albeit slow).    I ordered the Inside-out Cajun Chicken sandwich and a side of fries. The chicken was good, but the fries were severely undercooked. All in all it was a very okay experience.

PDeBQ1piGqQoGtcbKUJ4Eg.text: Would be 4 starts but the staff always fails us ( takes a long time for drinks, placing an order, refills, food to come out, get check). unless you get seats at the bar... Food is always good, drinks are good, A little over priced. Decor is pretty cool.

4e_1o1-KOCjRFwKTh2TJUQ.text: I have a love-hate relationship with Industry. It can be the most obnoxious spot in Pittsburgh if you come at the wrong time. It's a very cool, industrial-style bar with a lot of bar space and additional tables. However, there are sports broadcast on like eight different TVs at all times, which is fine, but wow..it can get so loud and "bro" ish. Every time I come during prime time (weekend evenings), there is always one group of people who get obnoxiously drunk, and I've learned to accept that's just the clientele of Industry. It's like a little piece of South Side in Lawrenceville. (Ever been to Local in Southside? This is Lawrenceville's version.) Also, the wait can get CRAZY on weekends.  That being said, I love this place for lunch or happy hour. They have a great great great whiskey, beer, and cocktail selection. (Though I wish they carried more local beers!!!) There is something for everyone as far as drinks go. I loved their summer cocktail menu these last few months.  The food is not too bad. It's nothing special - sometimes it's meh, sometimes it's outstanding. There is one sandwich I got once that I sent back - I think it was the shaved roast beef sandwich? It was inedible. Avoid at all costs.  Brunch should be avoided here as well. The brunch service is very slow and the menu overwhelming.  Overall, if you're looking for an interesting-looking place with some good whiskey or beer, and standard bar food, this is a safe bet. Just be sure to come early in the evening. ;)

oqJ5k2nKzA5dLGaHyLoaRA.text: While visiting from Chicago, my partner and I popped in to this place right at 5:00 PM, to get out of the pouring rain. Even though they were about to begin their busy Saturday evening rush and were full with reservations, they gave us a table since we said we'd just be having a quick drink and a snack to wait out the storm. The candied bacon was to die for, as were the Verdigris cocktails. We received excellent friendly service with a smile from our server (Jennifer), and were most impressed with the space overall. Great find! If I ever visit Pittsburgh again, I will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Verdigris cocktail - SO good!

MHkveOW7PIZyc82Z4L0GYg.text: This restaurant has become my go-to with friends, because it never fails. The drinks are awesome, especially if you like smoked bourbon. They lite wood chips above the drink to get the smoky flavor. All of the drinks though are really good, and the bartender will always help you find one that you will be sure to like. The food is more typical american pub food, but with a little twist. All of the flatbread are awesome, and even though they are an appetizer, I couldn't finish the whole thing. I have also tried the mac and cheese, and it was nothing short of delicious. Definitely big enough to split! If you are in the Lawrenceville area, this is a great dinner spot!

2WAHlVrBsd06UNZ5eLI51Q.text: I've been here quite a few times for different occasions.  Beer selection: awesome. Bartenders and servers always knowledgeable about the selections.  Drinks: sad to say I haven't had a cocktail here because I haven't been able to distract myself from the beer. Love the smoked whiskey presentation so I'll definitely have to try it. Looking at the cocktail list, there's a lot on there is like to try.  Food: excellent. Burgers, truffle fries, nachos, bacon. All hail a meat haven here. Popcorn was good, bit I don't think worth it on the appetizer list. Small bowl...come on, popcorn is meant to be shared!  I attended a beer pairing for Yards brewing a few months back. This was done really well! Fun way to try their selection and have the brewmasters explain and the food paired was excellent. I think it was around $40? All in all a great deal and lots of fun.   Most recently I was  there for a bachelorette party. All of the above was intact, but what I want to comment the most was the service. OUTSTANDING! 10 girls, 9?checks, great table by the open window (god, I'm going to be sad when it's winter in Pittsburgh), food delivered promptly. All in all the food is good, the beer is good, the atmosphere is good...but when you have excellent service, the whole experience is awesome. I'm a jerk for not referencing our server's name because I can't remember it. She was great.   I'll return...someone slip me the cocktail menu before the beer so I can try something new.

HUeql_UkniGH4RhyTsNZag.text: You know how you felt about the Buccos prior to this season? Like, you kept going to games, because you know in your heart there's something you love, but every time, they lost, and you went home feeling a little pang of heartbreak?  That's kind of how I feel about Industry.  I've been a handful of times now, and each time it is *almost* so good that I can't wait to go back. Buuuuuuuut not really.  Okay. Let me try to explain it this way: I order a small plate. It arrives. I'm super pumped! I love small plates! I take the first bite - damn, that's good! Second bite - oh wow, still good, but this is so rich! Third bite - oh, who cares how rich it is, it's delicious! Fourth bite - OH I AM STUFFED I CANNOT HAVE ANOTHER BITE.  Like, HOW DOES THIS HAPPEN ALL THE TIME?? WHERE IS MODERATION?  Every time. Every time, I am so excited to eat here, and then I take one bite too many and I'm just done.  If you're a beer-drinker, they've got a ton of variety. I don't do the beer thing, so I stick to their cocktail menu, which is quite nice. I particularly like the fresh-fruit-based drinks like the Rhuby Rhuby Rhuby and Fisheye. The Smokestack is their signature cocktail, and while it's majestic to watch in production, it's not my favorite to drink.  Service has consistently been good, although we've only ever sat at the bar.  My favorite food choices thus far have been the mushroom & goat cheese flatbread and the bacon. Those were the best balance of flavor and not-making-you-feel-like-Mr.-Creosote-ness. I am in serious love with the filament truffle fries, BUT only the first two bites. After that, I want to slip into a food coma and sleep it off.  Industry's all right by me. I'm starting to learn my limits there, so I don't mind popping in from time to time. A round and a small plate split between a few friends - that's a decent reason to come back.

ZVmr8FLH4epkgNSToL_rWw.text: Food: 5/5  Buffalo Mac N' Cheese Flat Bread was excellent. Sandwiches were also solid.  Atmosphere: 5/5  Cool spot. Nice TVs. Can't complain.  Service: 4/5  Not the fastest, but we had a big party, so not gonna come down on them too hard.  Cost: 4/5  Sandwiches a bit pricey for sandwiches. Not crazy, though.

ZZbHE1tsVqZCjl3g7iNi_g.text: The food was good and the beer selection was great, but the service was really lacking. They forgot to bring a lot of food even after being reminded multiple times. I think they were just getting the kinks worked out since this location is still relatively new. Still, the restaurant shows a lot of promise so I will definitely be returning in a few months to see if things have improved.

aFoMn5qyHnMbAqKktKPglw.text: Our group stopped here only after we were forced to leave the first place (E2) because of how uncomfortably hot it was... Glad we did. This place has a great selection of drafts with explanations on each of them. As we were tying on our "nightcaps", we were watching some of the meals coming out of the kitchen... they looked pretty good, but I have to say we didn't try any food. We all made it a point that we would come back some time for dinner. You must try their signature Smokestack drink, but make sure you have the bartender make it right in front of you... it's pretty impressive.

I2rkineEJwETwh2bBz4vjw.text: Excellent selection of rotating drafts for every beer snob out there. Service was great!

mLpAxEiiPObj4enhL8macQ.text: Great vibe, perfect for a brunch or a party with large groups of people!

q000wGOzX9XgmXGIECAJ4A.text: Went here for dinner after the Globetrotters last night.   The space was nice, and though I normally do not like bar stools, I found these to be pretty comfortable and the tables where a good height for me when I chose not to sit down to be able to still eat and drink without problems. Also I don't suggest this for a first or second date when you are trying to get to know someone because it is loud, but they also have an awesome selection of music, which is fun to sing along to.   Our waitress was great.  Sometimes she would forget something, but always realized when she returned to the table and immediately retrieved it.   The cocktail list is wonderful and I had a Cohesion which was like a kicked up last word which is one of my favorite cocktails!  They also have Aresenal cider on tap which my hubby partook in.   The food is the real knockout though! We ordered the Blast Pig Burger and the Cluck House with the express understanding that we where sharing.  Though the cluck house was delicious and very well made it may as well have not existed after the first bite of the Blast Pig Burger. This was literally the best burger either of us has ever eaten in our lives! I loved it.  It was perfectly cooked and the best amalgamation of toppings I could have ever thought up.  I can't wait to go back, and normally I would say try more of the menu, but chances are it will be very hard to get me away from ordering this most perfect burger.  We also ordered the donut holes for dessert.  The donuts where delicious. They where perfect.  They where also huge and I still have a few hanging out for a snack today.  Go here! It is worth it!

YmjQQS9LXL33pmg2UVf-AQ.text: Sat at the bar for lunch. Great service, the food came out quickly and the bartender was very attentive. The food was all very good, you can tell they put consideration into their ingredients! My second time here as I am visiting my brother in Pittsburgh and I remembered it from coming here over the summer. Definitely made the right choice coming back again!

gjiR7AA1DD8IhfWdAQB5VA.text: This place is incredible.  My husband and I love visiting Lawrenceville during our yearly visits home, but had never ate at a restaurant. Usually we stop for a coffee and cupcake at Dozens and explore the quirky shops. This day, we happened to be starving and were on the lookout for a place to eat. As soon as I saw the Industry Public House and looked inside I wanted to check it out, and I'm so happy I did!  My husband is a huge craft beer fanatic and his eyes popped when he saw the number of taps! Im sure he tried two or three with his meal - I didn't keep count.   Right away, I LOVED the fact that I had several vegetarian options to choose from. I was between the Company Salad (mixed greens, granny smith apples, gorgonzola, dried cranberries, red onion, candied pecans and balsamic vinaigrette) and the Lucy Furnace. Being on vacation, the indulgent side of me won and I went with the Lucy Furnace sandwich (portabella, tempura zucchini, watercress, chard sweet onion and ricotta salata). Holy smokes was it good!!   Surprisingly, my husband ordered the macaroni and cheese - which he dubbed "the best he's ever had". My mom will be upset. Thanks a lot Industry Public House.

zdCeLcMs5b8PXHCTPWp9AA.text: Very disappointed in the food and drinks. Spent over $90 and the food was not good at all. Had the spinach artichoke dip which was very sour tasting. The tomato and mozzarella flatbread had canned tomatoes. Whisky sour tasted like watered down whiskey. The bar itself was very nice looking and our server was nice. But definitely would not come back.

iSoWx2ggaR-8bMUbmXSy5g.text: Had dinner here last evening, seating was quick, but our table was sticky obviously not cleaned properly. Server was nice, but seemed a bit overwhelmed. Food was ok , nothing exciting basic at best. My Polish Hill Burger was dry and lacked flavor.   The icing on the cake was when the server cleared the table next to us and placed the cleaner and rag on the dirty floor before proceeding to use it to clean the table. Gross , Disgusting and very unsanitary.....probably won't go back.

jt_vRC6DdiHMPNXW9CRRmQ.text: The service and food was fantastic as always. We never hesitate to try anything new to us on the menu because we are never disappointed!!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0UZdgwDf-uzDh0jCv3IRWw.text: I'm really irritated with this place. I came here for a meal and a beer. I was greeted when I sat at the bar and got my beer, but the bartender waiting on me was ending his shift and never bothered to ask if I wanted food. I was trying to make eye contact but nobody even looked my way. There were about 5 other customers in the entire restaurant/bar area, and at least 5 or 6 employees, so it was pretty ridiculous. The employees were chatting with each other, playing on their phones, making themselves coffee, etc. After exactly half an hour, a girl who I don't think was even a bartender asked me if I needed anything so I just got the check.   I've been here a few times before and the service is pretty slow, but I'm definitely never going back. I just sat there for 30+ min and was completely ignored.

KJfFYtTWxspYeMfCm-CrXA.text: Amazing night cap for our trip to Pgh! We've been here a few times and I don't recall the food on those trips but had an amazing experience with the Bartender from Bloomington Illinois! Being from central Illinois now living in Chicago we had an opportunity to ask for recommendations for Pgh and he was great!!! Highly recommended for a night cap!

JOXuDbhB2Nwve9IX4KX0Qw.text: I love Industry. The soft pretzel with the beer cheese and cinnamon icing is a must. Their burgers, sweet potato Fries, and salads are my personal favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soft Pretzel
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pig Burger
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Company Salad

02r437Ir3TSkis3cURDTcw.text: As someone who isn't in Lawrenceville super frequently, it took me a while to eat at Industry Public House. But I finally stopped in one night before catching a movie at the local little movie theater. I almost walked into a little pizza place instead, but the interior of  Industry - with its wooden beams and decor - was so beautiful and inviting that I had to give it a try. The place was admittedly exceptionally loud, seeing as I stopped in on a busy Friday night. Not the kind of place I'd go to if I wanted to talk to my friends or date at all. But since I was a single diner that night, it didn't matter that much to me.  The menus caught my attention as much as the decor, seeing as they consist of strips of paper that are brought out on a little clipboard. And people definitely take the menus apart and reorganize them during their visits - the sheet with the appetizers was stuck in the bottom of the stack of the menu that I got. But I forgot about that pretty quickly when I saw just how massive the list of drink options was. I could have browsed through that for ten minutes, easily. I didn't though, because as soon as I saw the arsenal cider options I was set!  After sorting through the out-of-order food menu I ended up ordering a Worker Burgher - a $13 burger that comes with goat cheese, caramelized onions, arugula, mushrooms and herb aioli. I was also able to order a surprisingly flavorful side salad at no extra charge - yay! Unfortunately, despite its high price the burger was admittedly just ok. It tasted fine enough; it wasn't terrible at all (and on an unrelated note, I noticed the meat was shaped in a square patty, not a circular one). But at this point we've definitely been spoiled enough by burger boutiques in Pittsburgh that I wasn't very wowed with what I got. Especially for how much it cost - at that price, they could have added way more of the toppings to help add to the flavor of the whole burger, especially given how big the bun was.  So, will I be back to Industry? At some point, probably - the drink menu was impressive, and even though my main course was slightly disappointing in comparison to other places in the city, it tasted ok enough. And the service was stunning. On a busy Friday night where the place was jam packed I only waited ten minutes for my food. I was out the door in well under an hour with time to spare to make my evening plans. Those waiters, waitresses and kitchen staff have a tight run ship and it's honestly enough for me to elevate my rating. So yeah: I'd be ok coming back here sometime to see if another item on the menu impresses me more. Plus, I'll definitely need to enjoy more of that impressive drink menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cider and a Worker burger (I ate my side salad before I took this - don&#39;t worry, a side is included in your meal!).
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9xqwk_NZ927ZRpxgs1vbSg.text: We stumbled upon this place looking for a cool place for a late lunch after visiting Pitt. We liked the vibe ( Industrial, duh) and it wasn't too busy or loud, and the muszak was varied and good ( although we got Rick rolled! Lol).  We thought the menu was imaginative and the food actually tasted as good as it sounded, which is not always the case. My wife said her Worker burger was among the best burgers she's ever had, and she's kinda picky. The fish and chips portion was HUUUUGE!  They had a very extensive brew menu, and 3 cider choices!  The staff was attentive and friendly but not overbearing. Would def come back and try it again.  Cheers and thank you!!

OBJG4AHsjSJwSQi71aIHNA.text: This was the worst experience I've ever had in my entire life. First the host couldn't even do her job right seemed to me that she was on some type of speed. Finally when we got sat our server took 10+ minutes to even take our drink order. Then some older man that works there walked by me and my friends and smelled like straight feces. Made me almost vomit. I do not suggest this place to anyone. Horrible horrible service.... food was okay.

YfO8VAYqdsbYQKXClvgCmA.text: My boyfriend and I went here with a couple friends who live in the area and recommended Industry for its "actually *good* bar food". We went for dinner on a Saturday night, and it was pretty busy (a good sign). Overall, the experience was fine. We were tended to promptly, although our server was a bit socially awkward (which is fine, it just threw me off sometimes). The beer selection was good, the food came out quickly, and our friend were right, it was actually *good* bar food.   One thing I didn't like is that it was pretty loud... which is fair, given that we went on Saturday night, but it did make talking to our friends a little difficult.
