Plus it was on the pricier side, even for *good* bar food (unless, of course, you love bar food, in which case you might think the prices are reasonable).  Decent overall experience, but we'd probably try other places the next time we visit.

GqJ8IbfDiHT9Eoikxk72Vw.text: While visiting Pittsburgh for the weekend we decided to check IPH out for dinner. I had the lobster Mac and my sister and mother each had burgers. The burgers didn't come out correctly however our server Alexander was wonderful and got them fixed in no time. He was also very knowledgeable of the beer menu and able to recommend a craft beer for me. The food was delicious and the service was even better. We will definitely be back next time we're in Pitt!

Dk7rr8QWs2tAtj0OPtuGWg.text: My sister in law and I went here for dinner while in Pittsburgh for the weekend. We order the most ginormous pretzel I've ever seen and it was excellent. We also had fresh made mozzarella sticks as an app (they were amazing). With our dinner, we had pot roast French fries (so fat but amazing also). We were looking for someplace that had food that was different with a fun atmosphere and good service. We got all of those. Would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Our huge ass pretzel...

2wWV4XC-2x5m5DZX4N0Wkw.text: Industry is a cool spot if you want to grab a drink with some friends and an appetizer. Came here for my 30th birthday and thought it was pretty neat; especially watching the bartender prepare the "Smokestack" several times and smelling that awesome cherry and maple wood! Definitely a nostalgic smell for me and enjoyed it.   I ended up having three drinks; the Rhuby Rhuby, a French 75 (not on the menu, but they'll make it if you ask) and one of the whiskies. All 3 were delicious.   Cons: Like other reviewers mention it is LOUDDD. Don't expect to have an intimate conversation here. One of the hostesses was also less-than-friendly. There was no acknowledgement or even a hello when I walked in....I basically just said there would be 4 of us and the 2 girls talked amongst themselves and then led me to a table. Not necessarily the first feeling you want to get from a business upon arrival. I'd go back here but I'd sit at the bar for a different experience and maybe try some food.

vP1zhzb1_KVK3k1ydnz9CA.text: Went here to grab some drinks and a couple of apps. We were waited on by Alex, who was the most wonderful waiter we have had in a long time (even though he's a Giant's fan, as evidenced by the tattoo on his arm).   We ordered 4 drinks. My husband is a novice whiskey drinker, so he asked Alex for a recommendation. Alex suggested the Union Bushel, which had a hint of sweetness and included bruleed apple as a garnish. It ended up being a great starter drink; my husband had 2 of them. He also ordered 6 hot wings with ranch and blue cheese on the side. I'd say the wings were 3.5/5 stars. The blue cheese dipping sauce was outrageous. It was as though they put a scoop of chunky blue cheese in the dish and added dressing and hot sauce. It was pinkish in color and tasted phenomenal. It was the perfect touch for the hot wings.  Alex talked me into the shrimp bisque, which, unlike most bisques, had chunks of shrimp in it. It was thick, creamy, and topped with chives. Very delicious, and warmed me right up in these low temps.  I ordered the Rhuby Rhuby Rhuby as a drink and also enjoyed an extra dirty martini. They were made to perfection and, although it took awhile for them to come out, due to a shift change, it was well worth the wait.  The bathrooms were clean, although I froze my buns off both in the bathrooms, and at our table. We concluded, that due to the brick walls, it was probably difficult to insulate. We put in an order in for fried pickles that we did not receive, but wrote this one off as a sign from God telling us to not order anymore food, as we had a Valentine dinner ahead of us.  Seems like a great spot for meeting up with friends, and we will most definitely try to come back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dirty martini
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Union bushel ... Amazing!!
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 6 hot wings

4MLzmHgZ0AjCwEUb9CXMXQ.text: We have been to Industry Pub several times and were pleased. Today was a disappointment. It took over an hour to get our food and my husbands Nachos were cold and my daughters burger was not fully cooked.

xixMb4zKOfK7b0B9s5URbg.text: My friend and I went here last night for a late night bite. I got chilli cheese fries she got nachos with chilli added to it. Well they forgot her chilli on her nachos they did take the nachos completely off the bill which was super nice of them. My fries were OK there was a lot of chilli on them. It was really dark in there I could hardly see my food. It was decent I wouldn't come back to eat probably just to drink.

dTd9NCtIiw40x0Dyh_L4_w.text: Great spot to hang out.  They also have an awesome assortment of beers on tap.  Check it out if your in town.

XxBEtpRRmbcf8oYLE_kzMg.text: 3.5 stars, rounding up to four.   Industry Public House in Lawrenceville is a really cool spot. They tout themselves as a prohibition-themed spot, but I don't really get that vibe with a super modern bar setup. Regardless, they have an amazingly expansive alcohol selection, including some good wine options, which can be a challenge to find at "beer places." I find the TV screens with social beer info (I think it is an app) like glass type, keg level, etc. to be a really cool touch and helpful for people to really get a feel for what they are about to order.  I have tried a few foods and they have all been generous portions and super tasty. Bar food, but more upscale. However, I will say that the ahi tuna I had was so spicy I could barely eat it and no spice was indicated on the menu description, so I am curious if other dishes are not super accurately described.  Despite being very large with a larger than average bar, this place is usually packed. Granted, I've always ventured there on a weekend night, but even early on, it's crowded. My main issue with IPH and the reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the service/details. While some of the staff members are super helpful and great, more of them seem to have an attitude problem--the hostesses in particular. I'll never forget the time I came in after having shoulder surgery (I was in a huge sling with a pillow stabilizer) and the hostess wouldn't even entertain the idea of finding me and my boyfriend (so a two-top) a table away from the crowd so I wouldn't get bumped. I've also gotten an "eye roll" vibe from a lot of the bartenders. The restroom is nicely appointed, but typically in disarray without TP, soap etc. If IPH pays a little bit more attention to details like customer service, it could work its way up to 5 stars in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ahi tuna appetizer. Delicious, but EXTREMELY spicy.

hQ-BzWknVfQoMr31XTLj8Q.text: I've been to Industry both at night just for drinks, and for lunch. I'm very impressed by the drink selection and absolutely love the Rhuby Rhuby Rhuby but I'm less than thrilled with the food.   I've had both the Eliza Chicken and Arsenal Chicken Salad, both being just average. Nothing too terrible just lacking in flavor. However the fried pickles give the push from 3 to 4 stars, very flavorful batter, something I'd absolutely order again.   The atmosphere is very welcoming and modern. Clean bathrooms and friendly staff. Overall a decent spot but nothing to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half eaten Fried Pickles
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eliza Chicken Sandwich

1-RkUYJ4Vw2kE5ZW4MrePw.text: Enjoyed the dinner, brunch was so-so.   Dinner:  Hearty food, great alcohol. Would recommend pot roast or ribs, personally thought burger was a little dry. We ordered the pig iron because it sounded interesting, but it's really just thick cut bacon. Good pairing for the Mac and cheese flatbread though. Ordered the fish and chips on a separate occasion- huge piece of fish with crispy batter, definitely worth it.  Brunch:  Ordered corned beef hash and French toast. French toast was fairly standard, although the cinnamon butter on top was delicious. Corned beef hash was slices of beef, peppers and onions on top of home fries. It made a good breakfast sandwich with the English muffin and egg, but wish the flavors of the hash itself were better incorporated (i.e. the potatoes and beef were sauteed together, instead of assembled after).  Service generally good, seated quickly each time. Slightly chilly inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned beef hash, French toast

ZCGmtmBfCUyxvIKp0WmcRg.text: I've gone here once for brunch, and one other time to meet up with friends for drinks on a Wednesday night. The bartenders are super nice and service is fast. For brunch, the huevos rancheros and bloody mary bar were pretty good/standard/about what I expected based on reviews. When I went on a Wednesday night, it got busy as the night went on and was a really fun spot to hang. They have such an excellent beer draft list, and I love the menu app that tells you a little about the beer and how much is left. I'd definitely recommend this spot for beer and a fun atmosphere!

aNIq9ph_cNF7cmRzMEw5NA.text: Went to industry tonight after attempting to go other places that had very long waits. Industry also had a wait but we were able to find a spot at the bar. Bartenders were super friendly and attentive but mostly delighted by how good the food was. I got the vegan burger (I'm not vegan but enjoy vegan options) and it was so delicious I was questioning whether it was actually beef! My boyfriend said his burger is the best he's had in as long he can remember and our friend ordered chicken with vegetables that also were delicious. I love pittsburgh but honestly haven't had a great meal out in a while. Definitely recommend going to industry for dinner and drinks! Great experience :)

KaIIbQw5Wwc2BR1ibg_CJQ.text: Great service! Even better food & beer. Loved everything about my experience at this restaurant. And I'm a very tough critic!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mahi fish tacos and the industry copper ale brew. Perfect, perfect, perfect!

LXDIgUnnyvVBrqIyS1BcHw.text: We tried coming in for dinner on a Friday night (without a reservation) and was told the wait would be 30 minutes. We were too hungry to wait, so we went somewhere else. Came back again for lunch the next day and there was pretty much no one there, so we were seated immediately.   We ordered the Farmed Out Burger (minus the BBQ sauce), the Southern fried chicken, and a side of mac & cheese. Although the burger was salty, I still enjoyed it. Fries were also pretty salty. There was a lot of heavy seasoning on the Southern fried chicken, but I thought it totally worked and it was some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Loved the cheddar chive grits too. Although the burger and fries were normal portion size, the Southern fried chicken came in a huge portion. We were pretty hungry, but could only finish about 70% of the food!  Taste | 4 Atmosphere | 3 Presentation | 3.5 Service | 3.5 OVERALL | 3.5

Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oFC1hNQ6nFrpXtzNHjlXUQ.text: Industry Public House has a winning combination of noisy vibrance, diverse crowd, satisfying menu, and good service. Good for a group, definitely not intimate. For a toned-down experience, check out the side bar. Plenty of room so you can get a table at peak times. Consistently a winner in a neighborhood packed with options.

BzW6IDiMTcMHLk6Itoo0iw.text: I have been here now a few times. I usually get their macaroni and cheese, which is awesome. And a huge portion! I most recently tried their sweet potato burger (vegetarian). I loved it because it's something different - I'd never seen it on any other menu.   I like the ambiance/environment. They also have a semi private room that can be used for business meetings. However it gets quite loud in the evenings. I've also had a few bad servers, but overall positive experiences. They have a large draft list as well with great beer selection.

rbWRe3vcghAIIUBx0EsqXw.text: Food was lowkey lit, waited way to long for our table for 4 but the server was very nice.

NGVwmueQk80a6ejUlCh4Lw.text: I was very afraid I would not like Industry Public House.  I'm on board with the craft beers for sure.  But "artisanal cuisine"?  "Industrial cocktails"?  Ugh, this sounds pretty hipster.  Being located in Lawrenceville did not help the sale.  But they have an amazing craft beer, whiskey and cocktail selection.  So I had to give it a try.  I've been here on a few occasions and I seem to time it just right.  I've been there when it's pretty empty or scored a table shortly before the place fills up.  It's a beautiful huge space.  But it's also popular.  If you don't want a long wait, timing is definitely key.  If you're just there for a couple cocktails and not worried about crowds or waits, then it doesn't really matter.  Just know that service at the bar is usually pretty slow when it's busy.  My first time here, I met a friend for dinner around 6pm on a Saturday.  We were immediately seated at a table by the bar.  The menu isn't pages long, but it's exciting enough that it we weren't sure what to go with.  So we ordered a bunch of appetizers thinking we'd order food later.  I was eyeing up that Farmed Out Burgher as my main course.  My friend went with the popped corn and candied bacon, I went with the pot roast fries.  The serving of fries, as an appetizer, was way more than I expected.  And that gravy, oh that gravy....so delicious.  And it's not that I didn't want that Burgher, I just couldn't eat another bite after finishing those fries.  And one of the fried chicken livers my friend ordered that I just had to try.  We had a few cocktails, my favorite being the Rhuby Rhuby Rhuby.  I noticed over the summer that they have updated their menu because another one of my favorites, the Flux Capacitor, is no longer available.  The Smokestack, their signature cocktail, is made to your liking with your choice of bourbon and wood chip.    I haven't been back for food, but I have returned for cocktails.  Every time I've been able to score a seat at the bar.  It can get loud with the music and TVs.  But I just had another cocktail and ignored it.  Random side note: Industry Public House may have my favorite bathroom in the city.  Despite my reservations, Industry Public House exceeded my expectations.  It might seem a little pricey, but I think it was worth it, especially for the food and creative cocktails.  I won't hesitate to stop in again for a cocktail and finally get one of those burgers.

KImZamBzHgBavWXj8_A-PQ.text: Industry has an expansive draft beer, cocktail, and whiskey list. Definitely try their smokestack, which is whiskey infused with wood smoke, it's a pretty cool variation on drinking whiskey. Their food is creative and delicious, we had summer rolls, chili, lobster grilled cheese, and the Blast Pig Burger - which has jalapenos, candied bacon, and lots of other good stuff on a burger with a nice soft bun (probably brioche?). Industry is spacious with lots of seating and a long bar so it's great for groups, but can be pretty loud. Really great place in a booming neighborhood!

lWcdmt1PY5_2TFOw0xGYNQ.text: This place had a great atmosphere and the food was amazing! Wide selection of whiskey and beer on taps. Couldn't ask for anything more!

-ghZOmI-YFBC2qC7eEEQ4g.text: We came here for dinner and expected to wait awhile to be seated because it was a busy Saturday night in Lawrenceville. We were pleasantly surprised when we got there around 7 and were told the wait was only going to be around 30-40mins (previous reviews estimated the wait to be over an hour.) We were able to find two seats at the bar pretty quickly and ordered a couple beers while we waited for the table to open. We tried the IPH Copper Ale and Troegs First Cut, both were great! I stuck with beer, but they also had a whole list of mostly whiskey based cocktails which seemed to be their specialty. There was a mix up with phone numbers at the hostess booth so we missed our table and ended up having to wait an extra half hour. This was disappointing but when we said something they resolved the issue quickly and we were able to be seated shortly after that. For the main course we had the smoke stack sandwich and the workers burgher. We were really impressed with the food! We started with the fried pickles and had upgraded sides of truffle fries and brussel sprouts which really made the meal great. I also ordered a Moscow mule with my dinner and it was one of the better ones I've had, the bartenders know what they're doing. We want to come back to try more from the draft list and the industrial sized soft pretzel. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried pickles

RFubdjo01rlN1cqJXAMpQQ.text: It was time for me to grab lunch during my cookie tour so I wanted to try something new. Someone in one of the places I visited suggested I stop here.  The place was virtually empty and I ended up at a corner wooden table. I asked the waitress for recommendations and she told me the macaroni and cheese was exceptional. I thought that would be just too much with my stopping in at various businesses to sample their cookies so I asked for a salad. She recommended to me the 9th Ward salad which consisted of cooked salmon, kale, blackberries, green apples, and barley with a ginger vinaigrette dressing.  I found the service slow for a time of day when not too many people were in there but eventually got my salad.I received a generous portion. It was very good but spicy hot so I definitely needed plenty of water to drink. The place is a bit pricey with my salad alone running $16.00 so I figured that if I come in the future just to plan ahead for it. There weren't too many people at the bar but most I saw were drinking beer. I opted to forgo dessert since I was continuing my cookie tour and nibble from that.  My True rating would have been 3 1/2 stars but normally I round up when I'm not certain. Located in the heart of the business district it is not that difficult to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 9 th ward salad
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside

sHdB2MFqZkqeFWAFX3R74A.text: YES.  Just, YES.  I don't even like hamburgers.  I really don't.  But I ate one today and it was fantastic.  It was the Worker Burgher (without mushrooms) and it was delicious.  I also ordered sweet potato fries that were actually sweet potato waffle fries.   I went here during lunch on a Friday and there was absolutely no wait.  I felt like the food took a little while to come out, but it was okay as we weren't in a rush.  I would definitely not call the place "busy."  It was basically empty.  The waitress did not come around too often so I can't comment too much on the staff in general.  I was just happy with the food.  I don't know if I'd want to come here when it was busy though, I could see it getting a little overwhelming.  I will definitely be returning!

c1PJ1Aibm_8tYQ9Onx2Fwg.text: Had a lot of fun with coworkers who bought the disclaimer wings.  The wings were so hot that they looked extremely pained after taking just one bite.  I thought they might die, or at least puke!  None of that happened, though, so we took pictures of their pained expressions and laughed at each other as we joked about posting on the company intranet.  The beer selection is here is also good, particularly if you like trying microbrews on tap.    The interior is a disappointment.  The bar is new but the rest of the space is remarkable only for what obviously is missing.  The chairs at the tables are painfully uncomfortable.  This place is BYOCushion!

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Harpoon cherry furnace dunkelweizen. Great tasting and smooth.
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Puritanical chairs. Another descriotion could be masochistic.  Immediately painful lol!
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Helltown Rapture IPA

qEDkM465stVQueiIvNJwRg.text: Industry Public House isn't a restaurant that I ever have an intense craving to go to, however, they never seem to disappoint. I've tried a little bit of everything from the menu from apps to salads to entrees to burgers... all have been solid. All of their burgers and sandwiches are solid, and although I don't do it personally, they have an array of add-ons (for the fries as well).  They have a huge beer selection, some more reasonable than others, and I'm never around Lawrenceville for Happy Hour. If you're a bourbon fan, you have to try the Smoke Stack at least once, but they do have some wonderful cocktails as well.  I remember when they first opened how packed it would be (which, for it's original size was impressive), but since the expansion, I'm still amazed how packed it can get. Which leads to my personal downside... the noise. The entire place is steel and sealed brick, which means it gets loud rather fast.

1cS3Q7PaeTDda8tHCoiIeg.text: Maybe we came on an off night, but it's been quite some time since I've had service this bad. 1) waiter took 15 minutes to get to our table. 2) was not helpful when asking for beer recommendations 3) wouldn't give samples of more than 1 draft beer 4) served two wrong drinks out of four 5) didn't seem to understand the menu at all.   Sure, this could have been a server issue, but hostess and bartenders were equally unhelpful when asked for assistance. I would not come back.

IpNaErXcGMeiQvTWk7GZgA.text: Love the draft selection, there is always a nice variety to pick from. Bartenders are pros and never keep us waiting. Food is delish and love the atmosphere. Favorite Lawrenceville spot!

J17l3koGwpFSYtXs5uQUQg.text: I really enjoyed my meal here, but the idea that brunch should END at 12:30 doesn't make sense. By that point, the lunch part of brunch has barely even started! I ordered the sausage biscuits and ordered an old fashioned. This is a pretty standard brunch meal for me but it was delicious and a large portion. The drinks were strong and the service was good. This looks like a fun place to go out at night too. For a Saturday it wasn't very crowded which was nice. The set up of the restaurant has a good view of butler street and it's interesting to look around.  In the future I would like to come here at night. Their brunch menu had a lot of options and my friend enjoyed his much healthier meal there as well.

k7pk0t9gPGhtT7AJBVBNVA.text: Butler Street in Lawrenceville personifies everything that is happening right now in Pittsburgh. Artists selling pottery on the sidewalk, new commercial ventures evolving out of dilapidated industrial lofts, people teeming everywhere trying new places and tastes. Industrial Public House at the heart of Butler Street, beats a steady stream of flavor and beer, fueling the Cultural Renaissance of Pittsburgh.  The large space of Industry is great for groups, though you may have a hard time getting your waiter's or bartenders attention. I'm not sure if it's because of the crazy amount of people that frequent the pub or if it's the ear splitting acoustics that make it impossible to have a conversation. My thoughts...a little of column A and a little of column B. Industry is probably the worst kept secret in Lawrenceville, but for good reason.   But let's get to it, the drink selection is Epic! Whether you're a beer lover or a cider snob (like this classy lady), Industry has you covered. When you get hungry, and you know you will, their menu has both surprised  and intrigued this seasoned Yelper. Most of the food has been excellent; however, sometimes the complexity or ambition of the plate seems to overwhelm the chef leading to a smothered Croquet Madam.  I recommend visiting on an off night or an early brunch. And stick with the basics - a delicious burger or banging French toast.

VHtSAc0WrPwbKLPtjoEh_g.text: The place is amazing and our service was even better. Meghan waited on us at the bar and watching her work was amazing. I have never seen a more attentive bartender or hard worker in my life. Completely impressed to say the least. Meghan, thanks for the pride you take in what you do!!!

TI06Oam6C3JxcLRopuekng.text: A little more than I usually spend on dinner, but it was definitely worth it for the awesome combinations they offer here.   I can't speak to the drinks, but I had the Lucy Furnace - a portobella mushroom sandwich on ciabatta. It was AMAZING. (Although I tasted my husband's burger which was equally delicious.) The regular fries were also amazing so I cannot even begin to imagine how delicious the upgraded fries must be.  Oh yeah, and the bathrooms are immaculate. Wins all around.

V1oJaQBMgjBzfoA9OV5MRg.text: The service here just is not good. It doesn't matter if they are busy or slow, the service will always take way longer than necessary. I have been here about half a dozen times and it's underwhelming.  Decent place to watch a game. Industry has about 15 TVs. The food is bar food, and is simply OK. Extensive draft selection, but what bar in Lville/Bfield DOESN'T have that these days?  We went one day at 4 pm, only to be "greeted" by a snippy hostess inquiring if we had a reservation. A reservation? For 4 pm? For a sports bar? Naaaah. We promptly left.

LPc0LZwJ6iE3yQN2LK0wuA.text: Based upon the reviews that I had read, I was not sure that I even really wanted to go here.  I am glad that we did though (after a bothched attempt at going to the overly crowded Food Truck Roundup).    We got seated right away.  The first thing that I noticed was the loud music... It was a little excessive.  I guess they need to do that to drown out the sounds of the people since it is such a large and open space.  The TV's were great... feel like there is not a bad seat in the house really.    We ordered the Fried Mozzarella, Cheese and Bacon Fries and two burgers (mine was cooked perfectly for a change) and a glass of wine.  Everything was awesome... and our server was even more awesome.  Very nice and attentive.  I also noticed that the staff was very helpful with one another which I have noticed is not always the case.  Another server was walking past as we finished something and just grabbed it and took it away.  Very nice.   They have a ton of beers (Southern Tier Creme Brulee which is a huge selling point if my husband was actually drinking beer at this time), a good solid wine list, and a lot of yummy sounding drinks.    We will definitely be back.

fkzajabd8ZDZtJqEzS-DDw.text: I went to Industry Public House for the first time last night to watch the Pirates Wild Card Game. I'm glad I was at a great restaurant since the Buccos game was awful. I never venture into Lawrenceville as much as I'd like to. It seems like there are so many great restaurants and shops I really need to visit!   Anyway, Industry was absolutely great. We were there ultimately to just get drinks, but my fiance' and I ended up sharing the blast pig burger and pot roast fries. Oh my, am I ever glad we did. The burger was probably the best I've had in the city. Even better than Burgatory or Winghearts. The candied bacon they put on top of the burger was incredible. And the pot roast fries, oh my goodness...you'll never have fries that are this good. I'm really glad we shared because the burger was huge and there were soooo many fries.  Their beer selection is wonderful as well. And the restaurant itself is gorgeous. The only downside is the prices are relatively high for burgers and sandwiches. I think our Blast Pig Burger was $15. But for how good it was I didn't mind too much!

25aO-dEyIFJgwIuZTM3J-A.text: I haven't been here in about a year and a half and I could feel the difference in time.  I had a nice night, but it wasn't what I remembered.  I started out with a beer (appropriately) and it was a little sweet, so maybe it threw off the way I experienced my Tomato Basil Pesto flat bread.  Boy, it was garlicky with a side of garlic.  The crust was very nice, though, and it was the perfect amount of chewy and crunchy for a flat bread.  It did seem a little small, but it was just an appetizer I ordered as my meal.  I also felt that items were more expensive than I remembered. $5 for a can of beer is average, but still shocks me every time.

Ika7U6PtD3el2dewrnIfNA.text: Very good for trying a local place and being out of town.  Food was ok, a little price for the quality of food.  Was good, but not a have to come back too.  Service was ok, thought it would be a little better since it was slow.

PR8Ww0gvFgirqwtlnYg9iA.text: Way to dark inside. I get the vibe of the restaurant. But it shouldn't feel like 8pm at noon while eating lunch.   Food was ok. Recommend getting a burger, any burger. And nachos! They were amazing.   Salads were just eh.   Large portion sizes, but pricy for the location!?

08EcdtKxHPsRJymCxMygfQ.text: We were a party of 4 on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. Nice atmosphere, open air concept. The food wasn't anything I haven't had before.   I had the wings. They were a tad tough and I wouldn't recommend the honey mustard sauce.  The turkey sandwich was good. Nothing special. Fries were fresh cut.   President salad was a standard caesar. Too spicy.  We won't be back. Here are too many other places to try. I hate being so harsh, bc here wasn't anything necessarily bad.

NwFUFudBl7t4Qxt_JSHRRg.text: I could talk about the drink selection,  the awesome music,  or the friendly waitstaff,  but every word not spent describing the burger I had here is a wasted opportunity.   How do you describe the blast pig burger? Talk about the ingredients? Candied bacon,  Candied jalapenos,  fried ratatouille...   No,  that will not do,  this burger is more than the sum of its parts. Shall I talk about the careful preparation?  The perfectly rare (as requested) meat..   No, I shall try to describe the experience. It was like biting into a piece of heaven topped with bacon.  Like flying through the sky on wings of gold,  like reaching up and touching the face of God. No,  still better than that...   ...they should have sent a poet.

0gbOk2yFD10RFPDo-BpYhg.text: I don't love many things. Only Doritos and Michael Jackson videos really. But I LOVE the pot roast sliders from Industry Public House in Lawrenceville.   The sliders are served three ways: pulled pork, pot roast, or lobster. I originally chose the pulled pork but was steered toward the pot roast at the final moment.   They come three to an order and aren't sissy sliders like served by some restaurants around town. These sliders mean business, think a little smaller than a glazed donut.  The pot roast sliders come on a potato roll which is soft and chewy. The pot roast itself is tender and moist and comes topped with a mashed potato cake. I some how missed the mashed potato cake during the first slider but was beyond pleasantly surprised when I bit into during the second. The mashed potatoes were creamy and made every bit thereafter feel like a home cooked meal Mom made.  I enjoyed these sliders so much in fact that I seriously considered ordering another round. I didn't, but I probably should have...

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pot Roast Sliders, Industry Public House

bGxpTL5k0tBAY5FYFtNTKA.text: We came here for the bacon. Wild boar bacon and candied bacon. Well worth it!  In fact the industry IPA is very good too.   Also truffled fries with Gorgonzola cheese were very good. Very rich!    A cool looking bar that fits the name.   Service is more the suspect. The bartender looks more interested in taking stock of the beer coolers than actually helping people. She is very nice but inattentive. Had to flag her down several times.   Then a different bartender came and gave me a tab charging me for an extra drink.   But bacon bacon bacon!

Ea1_g45mp6aHjZPrELqH0A.text: I keep waiting to review Industry until I've had the opportunity to eat here, but I can wait NO longer!    Last night was my second visit and I continue to be impressed with the service and atmosphere.  Watching the bartenders make their fancy schmancy drinks is truly a treat.  Not only is it entertaining to watch, but damn, does it make you thirsty for some smoke-treated whiskey. Really.  The atmosphere is so lovely; dark, but not too dark, great televisions if you're trying to watch a game, comfy bar-stools (even though they don't look it) and enough room to breathe.  Heading there next weekend for a birthday dinner and I can't WAIT to eat, eat, eat all of the delicious food on their super-unique menu!

81ZsdyuloDxiri9U38ArUQ.text: Never fails to satisfy. Interesting how despite the crowd the place is consistent in quality of food and drink. Nice service and quaint "industrial" feel to the place. Very creative menu and items. Fun way to spend a weekend evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Menu, if you haven&#39;t done it before, you must try their! Smoke Stack.

F0UWazS_J5RMX7s5efzXoQ.text: Great atmosphere for drinks with friends on the weekend. The smokestack--smoked wood chips (flavor of your choice) and whiskey is so unique and fun to watch being made. If you aren't a bourbon fan they also have a wide selection of cocktails and almost 50 brews on draft. Had a great time there Friday night, and I will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smokestack!

8pxji5oLi4zrpeC_C0gPag.text: Ehhh. Very average place. They have a great beer selection and a nice atmosphere.   We ordered the mozzarella cogs which were essentially just fried mozzarella with very little of the other flavors listed on the menu, showing up. We also ordered the smokestack sandwich which again had a great flavors listed as ingredients, but when eating it they did not come through. The bartender attempted to make me a specialty cocktail (the Standard Oil) but was unable to because they didn't have all the ingredients (iced coffee being the one missing!) and so he made something up instead and still charged me for it.  We were really disappointed with our visit after having looked at the menu items and believing them to be very unique and different.

dwnvj92ACM9PJcn_fo8ZwQ.text: Terrible food.  Everyone go some place else for dinner and stay away from my favorite restaurant...er...this awful establishment.  The pot roast fries are so addicting you'll hate yourself later after you've eaten three servings, especially because they're half off during happy hour.  They even make healthy vegetables like brussels sprouts taste delicious by covering them in bacon and gorgonzola cheese...terrible if you're watching your figure.  Plus, you probably won't find anything you like on their huge draft beer list so you shouldn't even bother checking the place out.

tbFIpOraCKz3eUQEjmUKYg.text: Not worth the money. This is my 4th time here and each time I've been unimpressed. The large pretzel for appetizer was completely cold. The Farmhouse burger I ordered (over $10 in price) didn't come with lettuce, tomato, or onion. My brother's falafel was like mush and had to send it back. The waiter also seemed overwhelmed for lunch hour with barely tables filled. Every single time I've been here, it just hasn't been worth it. Did I mention it's $2.00 extra for a neat or rocks pour of liquor? When I asked how else you would order a drink, the waiter said it's a 2.0 oz pour verses a 1.5 pour and they have "fancy ice cubes" that take a lot of labor. When we ordered a rocks drink, it didn't even come with this so called fancy ice cube. I don't recommend this place. Maybe for a drink but definitely not food.

TjXF6PqZSPG3MAMnQHwpZQ.text: Really nice space and ambiance here -- high ceilings, spacious, dimly lit, with elegant decor that's old-fashioned in its style but modern in its feel.  The quality of the food is solid.  The menu selection contains basically pub-food items, but the quality is much better than you would find at most pubs.  I love their Management Burgher and Farmed Out Burgher!  But I'm sure ALL of their burgers are great, so of course pick the one with the toppings you like best (you can also customize by adding and upgrading toppings).  My various dining partners have also enjoyed their Reuben and the salads.  The alcohol selection is huge.  Their draft list is pretty decent, and although it's nowhere near as good as the selection at Fat Heads or D's, there are usually at least 2-3 beers that I like on the list -- to put this in context, I am very picky about beers and almost exclusively drink IPAs, stouts, and sours (and variants of those).  Their cocktails are inventive and the selection is extensive, but they don't hold a candle to the ones across the street at Tender.  All in all, this place is a great new addition to Lawrenceville.  I will warn that it gets *very* crowded and loud on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights and develops much more of a party scene.  On weeknights, it's a lot more mellow.

oZ9n9Tv-Qy0yNueRaOknQg.text: Industry has so much going for it: Good beer selection, creative cocktails, a fun NYE atmosphere, and delicious food made with quality ingredients. I've been here multiple occasions for Sunday brunch, late dinner, and just drinks, and I've had a mostly positive experience overall. Sunday brunch in particular has been an overwhelmingly positive experience. The space is so nice and large and it's much less crowded than in the evenings, which makes ordering food less of a headache.  The problems with Industry are primarily ones of consistency and service. For example, I've ordered the same two orders of fries on separate occasions and had them come out vastly different from one another. One order was warm but the fries were nasty little bits of potato and the oil they had been cooked in seemed very old. The other was much more generous and tasted freshly prepared, but the fries themselves came out room temperature at best. It was as if they'd been dumped onto the plate in all their delicious glory but then left sitting in the open for five minutes. I think having a few more dedicated food runners would solve this particular problem instantly.   Additionally, ordering food anytime after 8:00 pm is a convoluted and confusing process that everyone I've come to Industry with (myself included!) has yet to understand. I've been sitting at a table with a group who was handed menus after we'd expressed a desire to order food, only to have the server curtly tell us to go place our food orders at the bar once he returned and we attempted to order. Other times (later at night mind you) my group has been permitted to order from our table via the server without a hitch. If the food ordering policy was made more explicitly clear (like stated at the top of the food menu) I think the confusion would be largely eliminated. As it currently stands, the inconsistency in the quality of the food and the lack of clarity about ordering said food makes me not want to order any of the more expensive dinner dishes or burgers here. I don't want to shout my order to the bartender and have it come out wrong or pay $15 for a cold burger. I'm hoping the longer Industry stays open the smoother things will become.

h780ZGLRwLggg4EOVZtHFw.text: If you're looking to get a good burger at a good price, come to Industry. Their burgers are A+++.  Cool atmosphere, huge bar, good prices, and great location.

XmODiusGNZhkUvzfHT2Xdw.text: The food is all around pretty good, I've tried things from all parts of the menu. $5 glasses of wine during happy hour and they are BIG glasses of wine! Lots of tvs, but it's not really a sports bar, so that's a little confusing to me. It doesn't seem to fit to me, but I'm sure the guys like being able to keep an eye on the scores. My biggest issue with this place (which is not an issue with the business) is that it gets SO packed at peak times. They have a very large bar area, but when it's busy, there is no place to sit and there are people everywhere. I don't mean a little crowded, it's packed. Some people like that, especially the younger crowds, but that's my only critique.  A nice place for a cool dinner out on the town. Good food, not super fancy, definitely a relaxed atmosphere. Reasonable prices for the food -- I've never had anything bad and the portions are a good size. Their smokestack drinks are worth trying. Some are good, some are not, but it's a neat quirk of theirs.

MCdQ8_ahMOUBG_4f9i--Yw.text: Good for Lawrenceville.  Neat place trying to be trendy. However, there was no wow factor or lasting impressions from it.    The menu was awkward and difficult to read at first. But you eventually get through it.  Food was good.  Fries were surprisingly tasty.   Beer selections was pretty good, standard affair. I'd check it our if your in the area.

4MsmfzY9s0ERmtoKsgmR9A.text: IPH is growing on me fast. It's mostly what a souped-up pub should be. The beer selection is large and varied. There's also standard macro-brews if you want. They have some great cocktails and extensive collection of straight liquor. The menu is upgraded pub grub. The servers and bartenders are friendly. And the decor and ambiance are what one would expect of a place called Industry. Plus they have lots of TV's showing sports. Yes, folks in Lawrenceville are still allowed to like sports.  Let's start with the cocktails. They have one called the Smokestack, where they take whiskey, add a couple other ingredients and then torch some wood and let the smoke infuse into the drink. The differences betwixt the woods are discernible. I believe my friends liked the mesquite the best.  Now, on to the truffle fries. Get separate orders or rue the fact that you have to share with others. As we happily munched on our truffle fries one evening, we also looked longingly at another group that had ordered the nachos, which came out piled up at least half foot high with fixin's. (or a more realistic but still high measurement). The burghers (their spelling) are quite good. But last time I ordered a cajun chicken sandwich which came with habanero jack cheese. It was hot. Ridiculous hot. I'm South Asian; my people live for heat. This was hot.  As for ambiance and service. I've been quite pleased with the level of attentiveness at the bar. Things might take a smidge longer if you're sitting at one of the high tables; still not that bad. The place does get a bit crowded on a weekend night but, well, if you're expecting a quiet, unobtrusive night, why are you out at a place with the words "Public House" in its name?

AVU0DDPrhalmSjXYyrvCeQ.text: The food was great, but the ambiance killed it.  We all enjoyed our food, and my 'Electric Cheese' was one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've had.. ever. BUT, the noise level was ridiculous, like so loud we couldn't hold a conversation with the table.  Service was also sloppy which didn't help.  The food is worth 4 stars easily, but the overall quality of meal a low 3 :(

jf4vEhRrB7GI4uULibTJMg.text: If you order a whiskey from the menu, be prepared to pay $2 extra by default.  Unless you specify "just a shot."  With ice?  That'll be $2 extra.  Without ice ("neat")?  That'll be $2 extra.   "That's how all bars do it!"  Uhhh....  "We really recommend this new beer we've got..."   p.s. it's $17 for 10oz.  Yeeeahhhhh.......    that's the end of that.

16jOc1Sz3tOgTeIBAleGLA.text: We came here just for a quick drink and a snack. But, upon looking at the menu decided against a snack--it was pretty pricey for bar food on a Saturday afternoon. They did have a nice selection of drafts including quite a few of the local ciders (from Arsenal Cider House) and the hub tried a few drafts (they were a little pricey also).   The interior decor was cool and I think this would be a cool place for a first date. But, not so cool for starving doctoral students-maybe they could add a mid-day happy hour on Saturdays? That would certainly increase the traffic during game times.  Pros: Decor Draft Selection  Cons: Price Service was a little slow

g3C0huugpstH3W3coUgshA.text: Terrible service, waited forever for our food.  Food was mediocre....definitely not worth the high prices for a hamburger.  The finale was the waitress screwing up the bill.  Most likely, will never come back to this place or would recommend it to friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cool industrial atmosphere

_6pdss2fTem0z60bhyBjgw.text: Service sucked, took at least 15 min for our waitress to come and get our drink order. Food was good but super greasy. I wouldn't come back.

aeqcugOxOFhCclFd_13C6Q.text: I was really excited to try this place. The outside looked trendy and inviting. Sadly the food was pretty mediocre and it came out cold. Our dinner salad arrived 30 minutes after ordering, the appetizer never arrived and when the dinners came it was cold. My child's Mac and cheese was so cold it was a giant congealed lump of sticky noodles. The steak on my salad looked like beef jerky that was cooked last week.  Our waitress was very nice and comped us the appetizer that came after our meal but I can honestly say that I would never return. I guess if you had 4 or 5 IPAs this good might be edible but not if you are sober. They are going to need to step up their game if they want to stay in business. Hospital staff working in the area are not going to wait and hour for cold mediocre food.

KpdY6dbdY4nZWWgeci3t5Q.text: This place is a gem. Incredible and innovative cocktails. Great kitchen not afraid to play games with their ingredient lists. Well designed space makes for a great atmosphere. One of the best spots in Lawrenceville.

Xr_dxj9lmqDGEuab3DrFQw.text: While I haven't had a change to try IPH's food, their drinks are easily some of the best in the city.  Great selection of drafts, cocktails, and whisky/bourbon/scotch, etc.  They have an in-house line of contract brews (the IPA is pretty good) and I'd highly suggest trying the smokestack (signature drink) or the smoked bacon bourbon drink (can't remember the name).  Not a ton of tables, but the bar itself is absolutely massive (occupying easily 50% of the venue).  I definitely plan on heading back for food the next time I'm in the Lawrenceville area though as every time it has smelt/looked fantastic!

iQw5XHpAbqUjltUBKG5dFQ.text: We came back again to IPH for a night of cocktails.  Fort Duquesne: Delicious! A great complexity of flavors. Aviation Gin, champagne, lemon, cranberry, and thyme. Menlo Park: Just as great as the last time we were here. Aviation Gin, lime, simple syrup, and flamed rosemary. It was awesome to see the rosemary lit on fire right in front of us. Whiskey Remedy: A taste of this will warm your soul.  Next time, we will be going for one of their Smokestack cocktails. They torched different wood chips right over a glass of whiskey, then cupped the top so the smoke would infuse right in.  Their draft list is also the best we have seen in Pittsburgh.  If you're looking for appetizers, try the Buffalo Mac n Cheese flatbread. Great wings as well.

bFJ3YXBs9HoBBDhsZZRn7Q.text: Great place for cocktails or grabbing a casual bite to eat. Cool atmosphere and anywhere they light drinks on fire is fine by me. I got wine this time around but they were mixing up all sorts of crazy cocktails at the bar (burning wood chips over bourbon, you know the fancy stuff). Extensive beer selection. Our food selections turned out amazing. We started with fries topped with pot roast and gravy. Then, I got a burger (covered with goat cheese, mushrooms, caramelized onions & arugula) with a side salad. Clearly, I wasn't making healthy choices that evening but it was well worth it.  Will be going back soon!

5FEhVbhArjKKi9XkL8FTrQ.text: Great bar food (fish n' chips, burgers, flatbread, etc.) and extensive beer selection. Lot's of TVs for sports watching. It does get loud and crowded though.

NjCnizencWCoG8lDMr8kzg.text: We checked out Industry yesterday for the first time for lunch.  For a Sat lunch they were packed, possibly due to the Pens game that was on.  We did not order any drinks, so while they do seem to have an impressively large drink menu (especially beers and whiskeys) I can not comment on that, but only the food.  The special of the day was one pound of wings for half price, so my husband, got a pound of wings with the dry rub.  My husband normally prefers buffalo wings (which they do have) but did say they have a good dry rub.  I got the Lucy sandwich, a roasted veggie sandwich with cheese and a vinaigrette on it.  The sandwich was good, but messy as the vinaigrette sauce was runny and just seemed to get everywhere.  Instead of the fries that come with the sandwich, I got a side of mac and cheese instead.  The mac and cheese was great.  Very cheesy.  Almost wished I had gotten an entree size serving of mac and cheese.  We also got the loaded fries to split.  The loaded fries come with bacon and cheddar cheese on them.  I would have liked more cheese on them, but the fries were good.  The service was lacking.  Granted, I know they were busy, but my husband had to wait 5-10 minutes for his soda, and we had to even remind our server about it.  When we finally paid the check we again had to wait 5-10 min for the waiter to even come back around to pick it up so we could leave.  Overall I think the place has a nice concept, just needs better service.

y_KLTJ_MFiSY__tCM8Q1Pg.text: Not quite up to speed yet.  Quiet night, not too busy, but 10 minutes after being seated we still hadn't seen a waiter.  Surveying the room, we didn't see anyone working or hustling and a lot of tables looking frustrated without food and empty glasses. No one running food or drinks and no water people. No thanks, I know a poorly managed restaurant when I see one!

a3YMXcxiw-QYO5qYpbVBIA.text: My boyfriend and I chose this restaurant for our first date and still cherish the memory. We made reservations, which was a great idea because it was pretty crowded. The service was phenomenal and the food was really good. I had the fat gary but brown by east end brewery and the pot roast. I like that they had local brews. It is a little bit on the more expensive side, but it is worth the money.

hv09_fotLe32DLHCaktiew.text: We drove in from Chicago and hit the pub at an off time, I think it was 4pm. The service was great and the beer was delicious. We had the black bean burger and fish and chips. Both were very good. Thanks for your hospitality! It was great to see the positive changes happening in PBG since I was there last. Keep it going!

Zuvxjnk6Sn6RMavqRhc3kg.text: Great place to grab a drink. Tons of beer selections and a varied cocktail menu. Jury's still out on the food. Never had anything that was bad & some of the appetizers are stellar, but everything else has just been ok.  Would try again though.

photos.caption: Photo of Industry Public House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

XxSXExrzeM8E4Rm_mcC2Rw.text: This place is awesome ! If you are a beer person you should check this place out ! Idk may be 50 different beer selection and good number of cocktails ! This place is pack on Friday Night !
